reviewTitle: Best price for this screen size. But....
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviewDescription: I do love this computer but there are a few issues. One is the sound card. I listen to Spotify and KNOW how my songs sound , and this computer does not play them correctly. Also when you switch from speakers to earbuds (which you have to go to the back of the screen to do) you then have to tell the computer that your now using earphones or there will be no sound at all. And that is also a pain bc if you miss the pop up window as you run back to look at the screen, I couldn't find how to switch over, so I have to unplug and plug in again so the pop up happens and I can tell it which one I'm using!!!!! If it sounds like a pain believe me it is. And then the sound isn't even good. It plays youtube vids fine and every other thing with sound just not Spotify. I actually listen to my music on my laptop still to avoid all this hullabaloo. Also no disk drive is a bit weird. There are light areas around the screen when its on but black. Sometimes I can see it when a movie has a really dark scene but for the most part this is a small issue. Still, I feel something was damaged in delivery or storage. But so far so good as far as anything else. Just that all the plugs are in the back which makes any change more of a pain than if they were along the side. I got it on sale so now $890 seems like a bit much for these issues but if your looking to save $100-$150 (which you'll need to spend on a disk drive if you don't have one) go for it! Also the keyboard and mouse work just fine for me. No issues yet.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviewDescription: Initially, I loved this computer. I had no issues. At exactly 1 year from purchase date, the computer would not turn on. Had it tested by local repair shop and was told that the motherboard was fried. I've had computers that lasted for many many years. Amazon's return and warranty policy is great . They are going to refund me the full amount paid. Only thing that sucks is that it cost me $150 for the local repair shop to diagnose the issue and to back up allmy files on a USB drive. I think I'll stick to better name brand computers

reviewTitle: The look of this sleek desktop computer is what first caught my eye...
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021
reviewDescription: This arrived two days faster than what was estimated.  Bonus!  I opened this bad boy up and it looks even more cool in person.  The 27" screen is huge.  It's a vast improvement from my 15" laptop.  It's very easy to set everything up.  You can freely upgrade to Windows 11; which has a built-in virus protector.  Bonus two!  This computer is fast!  I can run three instances of BlueStacks at the same time.  Bonus three!  BlueStacks is an emulator used on a PC to emulate an android phone.  I bought this computer to play games on, and it's performing way past my expectations.  It plays The Sims 4 with the highest graphic settings beautifully.  Zero issues with the frame rate.  Bonus four!  Ive been using this computer for a lil over two weeks now and I'm finding cool new ways to customize this gaming rig.  I'm really enjoying learning the bells and whistles of this computer.  I'm thinking about buying another one as a late xmas gift, too.

reviewDescription: After first 5 months of use the display wouldn‚Äôt boot up. Had to return to Acer, pay for shipping.Acer Tech support was helpful and provided instructions where to send for repair.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2022
reviewDescription: I purchased almost 1 month ago. At first the screen would shake off and on every few days. I would restart and it would be fine. I ignored it for a bit and then it became more and more throughout the week. I tried to install updates and reset the computer two different times. I made sure the power cord was in securely as well. The problem continued. Then, the last week or so,the screen switched to black then back to normal on and off. The mouse was also not great as it took me multiple times to click on things. I wanted to love it and I gave it almost a full month but for the price I refuse to settle with annoying glitches. Now I just hope Amazon takes it back with no issues. I did contact the manufacturer and they wanted me to send it to them to repair but I refused because a new computer should not need repairs in less than a month.

reviewTitle: Mac Mini is lightening fast! But Amazon needs to change wording policy for renewed products.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2021
reviewDescription: The Mac mini with Apple‚Äôs new M1 chip is lighting fast! It amazes me how far computer technology has advanced since I first purchased the Apple II with only 48k of ram and the size of a large electric typewriter back in the early 80‚Äôs. When I first saw how fast the Mac mini performed I thought it may look mini but it has major power on the inside.Now for my complaint with Amazon. In the description for the Mac mini it said New Mac Mini... it is only at the end of the description does it say renewed. I think a more accurate description would be ‚ÄúRenewed Mac mini...‚Äù When I initially saw this i  thought ‚ÄúWow, a new Mac mini for only $626! That‚Äôs $38 cheaper than Amazon‚Äôs regular price of $664. And it says there is only 1 left. I better hurry and purchase it before someone else does.‚Äù Okay, I have learned my lesson to read the full product description of the item before making a purchase decision.When my Mac mini arrived I opened the box only to find another sealed box on the inside. This box had a sticker that said in bold letters ‚ÄúNew Item‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúRenewed Item‚Äù Also there was another sticker that said ‚ÄúAmazon Warehouse Deals Inspected and Repackaged‚Äù When I saw these stickers I was confused because initially I thought I purchased a brand new Mac mini. After opening the second box there was the typical white Apple box shrink wrapped in clear plastic. I removed the shrink wrap and opened the box and there was the Mac mini wrapped in Apple‚Äôs white opaque product wrapping. I removed that wrapping and there was a blemish free Mac mini aluminum case along with the information and the Apple decal stuck in a white folder along with the power cord fastened with paper straps. After purchasing many Apple products over the years I thought no way is this a renewed product everything looks so perfect. It even has that brand new Apple smell to it. Next I decided to call Amazon. I explained to the representative that it appears I purchased a brand new Mac mini. The representative said ‚ÄúNo, it is renewed.‚Äù I then told the representative that I made a mistake in thinking I purchased a brand new Mac mini. The representative was kind enough to say I could return it. In spite of what the representative stated that it was a renewed item, and I was 99% positive it was brand new Mac mini.Now the good news. I decided to give Apple a call and spoke with a representative in the sales department. I explained the situation to the representative and asked them if I gave them the serial number on the Mac mini could they check to see if it was brand new or previously owned? The representative responded ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù I gave the representative the serial number  and in less than a minute the representative replied it is a brand new Mac mini. I had the representative repeat the serial number back to me to make sure they looked up the correct one. The representative also explained that it was eligible for Apple Care which extends the standard 1 year warranty to 3 years.The representative offered to transfer me to Apple Care if I wanted to purchase the extended warranty. I told the representative to transfer me to Apple Care. The representative at Apple Care asked for the serial number and a screen shot of my invoice from Amazon. The representative told me that everything is fine and I purchased Apple Care using Apple pay for $99.I don‚Äôt know how or what happened. It‚Äôs rare for Amazon to make a mistake in the customer‚Äôs favor but in my case I guess the God of Luck was looking down upon me and thought ‚ÄúThis guy has already spent thousands of dollars as a Prime Member let‚Äôs give him a break.‚ÄùNow for a brief message to Mr. Bezos. I know this was a cut in your profit margin. But fear not! I will continue to spend thousands of more dollars for your products because I am an Amazon junkie. Oh, by the way, please consider changing your renewed product wording description policy. Thank you.

reviewTitle: it's a Mac, not a PC, so you can't expect much but it works.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2023
reviewDescription: I begrudgingly had to buy a Mac to run a specific software for my work that wasn't available for PCs and normal people. I worked in IT for years and have always hated Macs and how they've been marketed mainly to the computer illiterate like a cult and are entirely dumbed down, and this isn't the first one I've owned. The 8-9 PCs around the house can't run the silly book editing software. So I figured what the heck - I'll buy an Amazon "renewed" Mac.For what you get, as always, Macs are WAY overpriced (about 3x). This one is no exception. $641 for a "meh" computer with "meh" performance - even used. It runs well (i.e. doesn't crash) and got the job done. But now it sits in the corner and is hardly ever used.My son tried to run games on it to get some use out of it but even his i5 Surface well outperforms this thing.If you drank the Koolaid and are part of the Mac cult, this thing's probably for you. Personally I just have to ignore the Apple with the bite taken out symbolizing the "Fall of Man". At least I didn't pay $666.66 for it like all the Macs when they were first released back in the day.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviewDescription: The computer works well, It has no noticeable issues and runs pretty smooth. However, the power supply included in the build is for the BARE minimum. It is an incredible oversight, but for the price it still is a great deal. I just spent $80 on one with 1000watts and you'll be able to find something around that price if not a little higher and that should solve any major issues. My issue in particular was just that there was no way for the PC to run an Oculus without that upgrade but for less intensive games it MIGHT be perfectly fine.

reviewTitle: The pc is exactly what you buy
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviewDescription: The pc itself came in tact and nothing was wrong with it. You just get exactly what you pay for. An amazing deal to be fair! But there's definitely some upgrades to be had with it. To be warned controller gaming is very weird because input lag tends to mess you up from time to time depending on the intensity of the game. Pc and mouse work just fine though! Just be sure to not accidentally stress out the computer too hard. There was also an issue I had with the display not working from time to time. The graphics card sometimes unregistered the fact it was connected to a display port, only when switching windows from a fullscreen application though. Don't expect 2K or 4K gaming from this device, 1080p Max settings will grant you anywhere from 90 - 100 fps on average in modern Triple-A titled games. The RAM is the main issue though, if you were wondering the RAM is DDR3, not DDR4. So upgrade that when you can. Other than that, I'd say it was well worth the money. Saved me a few hundred bucks!

reviewDescription: I bought this stupidly cause of what I read. I was never a PC gamer. I kinda got talked into being one... Kinda. But I had to get a new power supply, but it needed to be an HP one. As far as I know I had the choice of 400 and 500 watt ones they make. The only one I could find was a 400 watt one. (Also I'm sure there's a converter somewhere in the world, but the HP ones fit the case) So with that, and on top of that I had to buy a graphics card. Which I chose an rtx 2060. With those both installed now. The PC runs how I wanted when I ordered it. VR works now, the games run at least at 57 FPS at 1080. That was the lowest it ran and that was Doom eternal. Halo infinite was in the 100s for frames. So 1080p gaming works just fine.Its decently fast at starting, I have no complaints at the moment. It would have been 5 stars if it all worked without the upgrading. But good to know for next time, just man up and build my own.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 19, 2023
reviewDescription: I purchased this computer here in October 2022 during a post-PrimeDay/pre-BlackFriday Lightning Deal. If you also bought it, make sure to check your warranty expiration date per the HP Support Assistant app (it comes pinned in the taskbar if you haven't yet unpinned it). Mine was dated to expire as soon as May of 2023! I found out later that's because HP automatically starts the 1-year warranty based on when Amazon purchased these in bulk from HP. Fortunately HP provides a place to dispute your warranty (apparently this is a Known Issue) - I uploaded my proof of purchase, waited a few days, uploaded it again, waited a few more days. After a week of waiting, I called HP Support, and endured a long phone call while the agent finally updated my warranty expiration from May 2023 to October 2023. Never had this happen with any other product before.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviewDescription: I was buying a low-powered system  for my wife to do her work-from-home job on and let me tell you this little Lenovo REALLY delivers. The Intel Core I7-6700T is a real workhorse of a processor and 32 gigabytes of memory is more than you get in most gaming rigs these days. The Intel integrated graphics are alright as well believe it or not. In addition to her work, she plays some light games including The Sims 4 - which runs butter smooth. So I really can't complain about the unit at all. Except for one small detail. The front faceplate of the computer isn't seated properly and it is just a bit askew. This does not affect the ability of the little computer to do exactly as advertized and I can fix it myself.Now not only did I receive the computer and power supply itself ( which is all I ordered)  but in addition I as sent a very basic (read really bad) keyboard and mouse - but you have to remember I didn't order that and it was basically included in the price of the unit. I also received a display port to HDMI adapter that I didn't order as well which saved me the expense of going out to buy a display port cable. There was also a 3.5mm audio patch cable as well.I WILL be ordering another of these in the near future, rest assured. If I were to sign this review, it would be signed, "A very satisfied customer."Thanks to the seller. :)

reviewTitle: solid performer for such a small size
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviewDescription: This is replacing an Intel NUC that I killed by running 3 surveillance cams and Blue Iris for 5 straight years! With this pc, I now see a much lower cpu load (used to be 80-100% on the NUC, its now at 20% and I added a 4th camera).One annoyance though, this is my 2nd Lenovo, this one did not come with the ssd cable for running an extra 2.5" drive internally, the 1st one I purchased did come with this cable. Because I'm running an external USB drive for the surveillance (yes, it really does work just fine, 10tb WD Purple on usb recording all 4 cams full time), I don't really need the internal drive cable, but it would have been nice to at least get it in case I want to use this pc for something else down the road.So far, both Thincentres I'm running right now (one is being used for my amateur radio equipment and remote base software, also on 24/7) are running fantastic with zero issues, although I did do a LOT of windows 10 surgery! Removing all the garbage (Edge/Cortana/office stuff, etc.) that's embedded in win 10 really makes these two machines run great!

reviewTitle: A gamble, at your own risk
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought two of these and they were both entirely different. The first one I got, I was incredibly impressed with, it came with the antenna for Bluetooth and WiFi, and everything was basically setup out of box. The second one I bought, because of how impressed I was with the first, was nowhere near as nice to me. First few differences was that the second one did not come with a VGA port (which was useful for setting up as a server), did not come with the antenna (instead three different dongles, 2 for WiFi, 1 for Bluetooth), and didn't work out of box (had to fix the windows installation). Other than that, they both run like absolute beasts, and with the price, that pretty much makes up for the downsides.

reviewTitle: A lot of bang for the buck
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviewDescription: Like new refurbish is a lot of bang for the buck.  No where else can one get a 32gb RAM and a 1 terabyte SSD drive with an I7 processor for under $250.  Any new Pc from a box store or comparable laptop just can't compete.  The SSD drive w/ a fresh windows install married w/ the ease of my already in existence Microsoft 365 account makes this refurb unbeatable.  I Booted up, signed into Microsoft to sync one drive and load in office from MS 365 and off to the races.  Switching to a new pc used to be difficult but Microsoft has caught up to Apple in this aspect and made a refurb a great way to go.  This was a new / used PC for my Dad who just didn't need a bloated expensive replacement for an aging pc.  Great upgrade to get fast web browsing, email, and some word processing if you already have a monitor.

reviewTitle: Awesome purchase, unlucky the boot drive failed 6 months after purchase
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2023
reviewDescription: Walked in to the office to see the screen showing no boot media, retrying.Removed the 1TB,M.2,2280,PCIe3x4 which is a kingston kingfast PCIE and it wasn't recognized in sabrent external enclosure.Luckily Amazon had a 1TB,M.2,2280,PCIe3x4 for less than $50 deliverable the same day!before 10 am, same day, have the new drive and will be installing from backup.  Go Amazon!  hope I didn't lose much.

reviewTitle: best product for small and large businesses
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2023
reviewDescription: i been using these little computers for my clients for about 4 years and i have nothing bad to say about them.  why buy brand new when you can get 3 of these for the price of one brand new and its either better or same performance.  even quality i say would be near brand new.

reviewTitle: Powerful, fast, efficient. Great value for the money
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviewDescription: This product I need for my home computer usage.  I am attending online school so its technical capabilities are very important.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviewDescription: The computer is fast for what I use it for.  Adobe creative suite and stock trading run great.  Missing the display to hdmi converter, luckily I had one.  Admin account caused initial problems with downloading programs and be prepared to run a lot.of updates for windows right out of the gate.  Overall happy with the performance for the price.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2023
reviewDescription: A fast computer for the price.  I had some difficulty getting Windows 10 to boot.  In Windows Troubleshoot I wiped the drive and reset Windows.  Since then it‚Äôs been working fine.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviewDescription: The systems are not it perfect working order, I had to reset the bios/cmos with the jump switch to remove admin passwords, the DisplayPort is worn out as well all 3 have similar issues. That said for a k8s lab they work great in a headless configuration.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2023
reviewDescription: Don't let the headline of this review fool you, it's a good thing! This tower is incredible! After transferring from an 8GB RAM laptop to this monster, I feel like I can do anything!I'm able to browse, game, shop, whatever I want...at the same time...something I could never do on my laptop. The graphics are crisper, brighter, flow more fluidly and has a ton of extra features!My only complaint is the size of the tower case, it's bulky and takes more room than expected on my desk (I was hoping for a slimmer casing). But, that, so far, is my only complaint.

reviewTitle: Pretty fast, easy setup, good graphics
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviewDescription: LIKE:  easy setup, small size, good CPU, good graphics;  DISLIKE: Upon waking from sleep, it doesn‚Äôt connect to the Internet as fast as I would like.  I'll click on a bookmark on my browser and it won't load right away.  I have to retry once the internet reconnects.  (I'm going to try and adjust this in device manager power management settings.)FRONT PORTS:USB-C 3.2 Gen 12 x USB 3.2 Gen 22 x USB 3.2 Gen 1Headphone / mic comboMicREAR PORTS:4 x USB 2.02 x DisplayPortHDMI (I plug in my monitor here)RJ45 (for ethernet cable)SerialAudio-out (for external speaker)This model has no card reader and no optical drive.  It does have a DVD drive.

reviewTitle: ORDERED MACHINE WITH WINDOWS 10 PRO...GOT WINDOWS 11 PRO
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
reviewDescription: I specifically wanted a machine with Windows 10 software.  My old Windows 7 was on its last legs and my ancient, still working and excellent software may or may not be compatible with Windows 11.  After opening the box, unpacking the machine, setting it up with the monitor etc..... I find I am stuck with a Windows 11 Pro machine.  Not a slip of paper or a label anywhere telling me in advance what operating system is in the machine before I activated it.  I AM NOT A HAPPY CAMPER!  BE WARE!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviewDescription: FAIRLY GOOD TOWER PC,BUT I HAD TWO BIG PROBLEMS WITH IT.1ST PROBLEM,UNIT CAME WITH SOMEONE ELSE'S INFORMATION STILL ON IT.2ND PROBLEM,IT WAS SUPPOSED TO COME WITH 3YEARS ON SITE WARRANTY,IT ONLY HAD 2YEARS LEFT.THAT TELLS ME SOME ONE BOUGHT IT,HAD A PROBLEM WITH IT AND SENT IT BACK,WHICH IS WHAT I DID.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
reviewDescription: I had been dreading my FORCED conversion to Win 10.  Have PERFECTLY working 8-yr old Lenovo ThinkCentre with Win 7; but, it would not be "worthwhile" to 'upgrade'.  Thus, a NEW machine was the only answer.  After much research, I determined the "specs" desired.  Could not FIND an appropriately "speced" machine in a local bricks/mortar store.Turning to Amazon, I was delighted to discover my "perfect" machine from Oemgenuine, at a very competitive price.  Not being a true 'techie', I was a bit reluctant knowing the machine would be OEM.  Was not exactly sure what that means, these days.  YEARS ago, it might have meant I would have to assemble a few things; AND, perhaps INSTALL the operating system.Bottom line:  I am a HAPPY CAMPER!!--  Order arrived within 7 days of ordering--  Order was WELL/Securely packaged--  Setup instructions EXTREMELY simple/easy [literally 'plug & play']--  Once keyboard, mouse, and monitor attached... NOTHING beyond plug-in to power and follow on screen--  Pleasantly surprised by Lenovo "form factor"... about  ?1/3 of my earlier mini-tower--  Quiet, speedy, fantastic machineIt will take TIME to transfer programs and data.Thank you:  Lenovo, Oemgenuine, and Amazon!!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021
reviewDescription: I have purchased three of these identical computers.  The first works perfectly.  The second had a problem with the fan running continuously.  Within a week of purchasing this one, I tried to exchange it but got a message that it couldn't be exchanged, but could be returned.  No problem, I thought.  I'll return it and purchase another.  When I went to do so the item was now $50 more.  I still bought it.  The third PC now has a fan that will run continuously, but so far, the problem is solved by unplugging the computer and plugging it back in.  This is a pain, especially since this newest computer is being used in a recording studio and time is of importance.  And, oh by the way, customer service is non-existent.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
reviewDescription: This thing is blazingly fast.I am a software developer, the software I work on usually takes 3-4 minutes to compile.  Doesn't sound bad, but when you are staring at a screen waiting, it seems like forever.  especially if you make a mistake and it fails minutes into it.After setting this all up, my compile time went to under 20 seconds.  it was so fast, at first I didn't think it actually compiled.The built-in graphics does easily run my 4K monitor at 60hz, using the display port. Like I said, I am a programmer not a gamer, so I cant speak for how it works for gaming.Computer came fully setup with no bloatware (except the mcafee free trial that all computers come with), I just uninstalled it and installed AVG.I also like the fact that it is a small case, not a monster tower.8-core CPU, 32gb ram, 1tb SSD, for about $1000, you cant beat that anywhere.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviewDescription: Excellent value for price

reviewTitle: She's got the clocks and she rocks!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
reviewDescription: I bought the 512GB NVMe + 1TB HDDThis thing is FAST! 10 second boot time. When you click on apps, they open right up with no delay or load times. I upgraded the 1TB HDD with a 4TB Surveillance drive. I'm using this computer as the camera software server for an NVR Surveillance system. My OS runs on the NVMe SSD and the recordings are saved to the HDD. This setup is perfect for me.A few random things I can tell you...The OS runs on the SSD. The HDD bay can take a 2.5 or 3.5 inch drive.This computer is worth every penny.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020
reviewDescription: Loving W7 for many years, it was time to upgrade to a W10 machine. I chose a 500GB SSD with 16gigs of ram, and it was very aggressively priced; with W10 Pro loaded it was a no brainer. After two weeks I have had no problems and that 8 second boot time brings a smile every time I punch that power button. Lenovo support was very quick to change the start date of the warranty for me (responded within hours to my email) so that I received my full 12 months.So far so good; thanks to oemgenuine for offering custom builds at great prices. This desktop was exactly what I was looking for.

reviewTitle: Great computer but there's just one thing...
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviewDescription: This prebuilt computer is great! It came with  great protective packaging and the case looks beautiful! Unfortunately, I had a bad experience with the overall shipping/delivery. I had to wait nearly 2 weeks to get it instead of a couple days and was given no update. The 2 buttons at the top (reset button and the rgb button) isn't working at all. I read the instructions but nothing helpful was listed. Fortunately, I can change the rgb colors through an app that was already downloaded in the system. Asking for a replacement would just be a hassle but the computer itself is a 5/5 if the buttons on the case was working.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
reviewDescription: The packaging was top notch, layers of padding and cardboard, I bet this thing could have dropped 20 feet on to concrete and been fine. Outer box had a shock detector which turns red if dropped hard, mine was still white, great!As for the PC itself I‚Äôm very happy with it. They say they build with whatever brands/parts are available to them so I was worried I would get low grade parts, but that‚Äôs definitely not the case. All the parts are brands I know and trust. MSI motherboard, MSI gpu, deep cool liquid cooler, Kingston fury ram, montech psu. It is all expertly built, excellent airflow and very securely fastened.Performance wise this thing is great. I use it only for gaming pretty much. It plays every game I‚Äôve thrown at it so far (doom eternal, RDR2, ESO, Elden ring, cyberpunk 2077 and Witcher 3 so far) at all maxed settings 200+ fps no lag no dropped frames no overheating and basically no noise. The gpu temps haven‚Äôt gone much above 50 and the cpu temps not much above 55 during the most demanding games I‚Äôve played which is great.All in all I highly recommend not just this particular build but also the Skytech Gaming company itself. I called their tech support with a quick question and was amazed to be greeted by a man who spoke English as his first language! He was very helpful and answered my questions with zero troubles. He was also very friendly and we had a nice conversation to boot, very deserving of a 5 star rating!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewDescription: So far I have no dislikes and the only small complain was I could tell the box at some point in the deliver process was dropped on a corner which cause the case to be slightly bent when I received it. I was able to bend the corner back out with no issues.

reviewDescription: I bought two of these. One of them worked great the other one didn‚Äôt have windows installed ‚òπÔ∏è

reviewDescription: Great buy on my part

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviewDescription: This computer is definitely a good starter and it pretty good for the money I would recommend to buy better parts in the future but is a good prebuilt for its price

reviewTitle: Set Up a Powerful Computer on the Cheap
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviewDescription: I wanted to dedicate a fast machine (3.6 GHz i7 7700) with 32GB RAM and a 1TB SSD to run a DAW (digital audio workstation). This arrived pretty much ready to do that.The BIOS needed some updates and needed to be set to use hyperthreading. Windows set up worked great. The keyboard and mouse supplied were the cheapest quality imaginable - no, cheaper than that. But they worked, I just would not want to use either.Things are going well with the machine. I'm using it with two displays - a 4K 32" curved Dell plugged right into the display port and another display in the VGA analog port. Adding a display adapter would require a short one - the case is compact. You could add a couple more SSD's. I won't need more storage for this machine and I probably won't add a display adapter.I would recommend this recycled computer as a great value. It is amazing what you can get for so little money.

reviewTitle: Excellent performance at a great price, if you don't mind doing some minor upgrades
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this to replace my aging PC that I used for software development, running Linux.  This refurbished PC is a terrific upgrade, especially as I ordered an M.2 SSD for 2TB of storage at a blistering 3,500MBytes/sec (confirmed using gnome-disks device benchmarking).  The small form factor means it fits under a monitor stand very nicely, with extra room for a mac mini next to it.  If you're a developer, you'll probably also want to trade out the included budget SATA SSD for a higher performance or larger SSD.  The USB ports are plentiful enough, but if you need lots more, a cheap PCIe expansion card can use one of the two available PCI slots (low profile only, remember).  The 7th generation Intel i7 CPU also gives great Intel QuickSync (QSV) video transcoding performance if you use handbrake or ffmpeg.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviewDescription: I received this renewed product in excellent condition as described.  Not one scratch on it.  It was in shrink wrap.  I opened it up and found no dust whatsoever.  It runs Windows 11 pro perfectly.  No driver updates from dell were needed.  It will not upgrade to Win11 natively, but there are many Youtube videos out there to explain how to do it if you so desire.  You can slide a NVidia 1050TI into it with no issues to play AA titles if gameing is what you are into.  I can't find a better piece of hardware out there for the price of this one and it works perfectly for me.  I may buy another one at this price.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2023
reviewDescription: UPDATE: After five days of testing and troubleshooting this computer with three different technicians at the seller, I have had to send it back. It never worked as it should for more than a matter of hours, and displayed a wide variety of problems (see below for a sample). The last straw was when I closed the Chrome browser and the whole screen went black. The mouse pointer was visible, but nothing else. There was nothing to click on, so I couldn't even shut it down. After a couple of hard reboots this problem persisted, so the machine is now on its way back to SJ Computers. No one is to blame -- there's just a ghost in this machine.ORIGINAL REVIEW:Bought the Dell i7-7050 SFF. It arrived in good shape two days early, but I didn't have the correct video cables (VGA to Display Port), so I didn't turn it on for a couple of days. Once I had the cables I fired it up, set up Windows and left it running for several hours, when it began to display various display anomalies: When I opened programs, the window would display for a second or two, then disappear. Later, the whole screen began flashing on and off. The Start button didn't work so I had to shut it down with the power switch.With the machine unusable, I called SJ Computers (the seller). This was on a Friday, and I spoke to two techs, Alex and Logan. Much troubleshooting was tried, and eventually the machine seemed to be stable and I was told to use it over the weekend and call back with a progress report on Sunday. I used it as much as I could, and it randomly logged itself off several times. When the "disappearing window" symptom reappeared on Sunday I thought I needed a replacement, and I called to ask for one.This time I spoke to Aaron, a third tech, who logged into the machine remotely to try and resolve the issues. He ran some diagnostic and repair tools, and in the end suggested a complete reinstall of Windows. Since I had not installed anything on the computer, I agreed to that. I now have a completely fresh installation of Windows that seems to be working, and I'm hoping all will be well over time.AARON WAS THOROUGH, COURTEOUS AND PROFESSIONAL DURING THIS LENGTHY PROCESS, and put my mind somewhat at ease by offering to extend the 90-day warranty for an extra thirty days. He went the extra mile by calling me back an hour or so after the Windows reset to make sure all was well. This computer will be used in mission-critical situations and I can't afford random shutdowns or on-screen controls that don't work. Since these problems were intermittent I can't honestly say that it's "fixed," but I fully expect it to be.For the past couple of hours this computer has been working fine, but I will update this review if there are further problems with it.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2023
reviewDescription: This is a great performing, fast PC for the money! Mine was refurbished and shipped by SJ COMPUTERS LLC and they did a great job. Computer is totally clean inside and out, came with a basic but brand new mouse and keyboard and was packed very securely.  Also came with the CD/DVD drive which is in good working order.  All in all I am very happy with my new PC!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this to use as a dedicated headless blue Iris server for my security cameras at home. I‚Äôm running 15 cameras and barely tipping 20% CPU. I also installed code project ai and use on all of my cameras with no noticeable impact. HW acceleration works perfect with stock intel drivers, fully updated with windows updates. The only thing that was a little cheesy, but I didn‚Äôt mind cause of how i planned on using it was the wifi being a dongle. I had planned on removing the card when i got it so a win for me

reviewTitle: Great price for a decent computer
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2023
reviewDescription: The system was very easy to plug and play and get it up and running.  A couple of things to note for potential buyers:-System does not meet system requirements for Windows 11 so Windows 10 (which is installed) is as far as the OS can go.-The included keyboard and mouse are very basic and must be plugged in.  It's nice that they are included, but recommend spending some of the money you save on upgrading both of these items.-For bluetooth to work it includes a USB adaptor.  It works fine and I haven't had any problems with it, but it does take up a USB port.Overall very impressed with what I got for the price and have not had any problems with it.

reviewTitle: Basic CPU is very good, but peripherals are awful.  Good value for the money.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviewDescription: I‚Äôve had the computer for less than one week and so far I am impressed with it.  I found that the keyboard and mouse were cheap and needed to be replaced.  The optical drive is deficient as well.  Fortunately I have an external optical drive that solved that issue.  But overall it is excellent value for the price.  Maybe more pros and cons will develop after I have worked with it more, but so far no major complaints.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023
reviewDescription: First I will say the PC itself works as I expected, after the add-ons were replaced. I bought it for basic functions for running basic word documents, spreadsheets, and paying bills etc. and am pleased with it. Takes an extra second or two to open a second spreadsheet, but I am okay with that. However, this is advertised as WiFi and Bluetooth. These features are not internal but done with USB adapters. The WiFi adapter they sent me was VERY slow, when it worked at all, making the PC appear very bad. My router is about 20 feet from this computer and my work computer, TV's, and everything else works just fine on fiber optic internet. I connected an Ethernet cable straight into the PC and it is like a different machine, opening web pages very fast. Second, the Bluetooth adapter they sent would not transmit past my monitors 3 feet from the PC. I literally had to hold my headset behind the monitor to get it to connect and it would loose connection when I sat down. Total junk. I ordered a $12 Bluetooth adapter and I can go to the next room. Third, the power cable they sent me did not hold into the plug on the PC very well and if you moved the tower, it would loose connection and shutdown. I have multiple power cords and simply replaced it and the issue is solved.In conclusion, for the money the PC is great and does what I want it to but only after I made the upgrades to the accessories. If they would send a decent quality WiFi adapter and Bluetooth adapter I would have given it 5 stars. The plug I don't see as a regular issue, but unless they upgrade the adapters they send you, plan on ordering those for yourself.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviewDescription: Great product as windows 10. This architecture does not support windows 11.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviewDescription: Worth the value. No issues

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
reviewDescription: I did a loooooong research (I'm the kind of person that does long researches before buying a device, believe me... long) to get a cheap MAC the would do the job for a day to day normal user, web browsing, writing, docs, emails, all the basic stuff that a normal person would do, not needing a powerhouse device. So I came across the mac mini M1, refurbished. GREAT price and the new M1 chip were very attractive.So after buying the computer and trying to connect the bluetooth mouse and keyboard I noticed that there was THE LAG!!! (which I read so much about but read other people reporting that they were not having those issues). The lag was BAD!!!! So I researched and tried everything.... and I DID try everything, to the point of having to buy a corded mouse and after plugging it, there was some improvement but nothing compared to how a normal computer with a normal cursor would move. And I even tried the mouse (a cheap one from macally created for MACs) and it worked perfectly without any flaws. But in this one it keeps having some lag still. So if you're thinking either to buy this, the iMac 24 inch with M1 chip or waiting for a bigger iMac M1 chip and possible 27 inch, I suggest to go for any of the 2 latter but DONT BUY THE M1 MAC MINI. There are reports everywhere of the lag happening, improving to some extent for some people but not completely going away. And let me tell you, IT IS GOING TO DRIVE YOU CRAZY. So don't do the same mistake.UPDATE:Turns out that afte changing the monitor to a 1440p, 140 hz, 27 inch monitor (I got ViewSonic) the lag disappeared completely. So it has to do with the monitor moreso that the corded mouse. But it's a good idea to get the mouse corded also.

reviewTitle: Good Value on the base M1 Mac mini
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
reviewDescription: I am the Apple tech for my school district.  I recently bought an iPad Pro 12.9" (M1) over getting a MacBook but still wanted a desktop Mac at home when needed.  My 2012 Mac mini was unable to update past Catalina.  I didn't want to spend much so I ordered this one in hopes it would be OK.  The packaging was very good though it could have used a bit more bubble wrap to keep the insides from moving around during transit. However the mini was extremely well packed inside a double layer of padding.  The only issue I've observed in this renewed product so far is that when it first booted it sounded like the internal speaker is partially blown.  I don't use the internal speaker so it's not an issue and I wouldn't bother to return it just for that.  Everything else about it is fine.  Getting it up and running was routine.  Since this is something I do several times a week in my job I know when something isn't right, even if it's minor.  The mini is fine and I'm happy with my purchase.  Hope this helps.

reviewTitle: I'm late to the game but the hype is real, the base model Mac Mini is still worth it in 2022
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2022
reviewDescription: I decided to by the M1 Mac Mini base model refurbished because the deal was simply too good to pass up.It was replacing my 2018 gaming laptop that started blue screening and eventually failed to boot.Being a photographer and working from home a dependable computer is  must.I was able to get the refurbished Mac Mini and the 3 year protection plan for $588 out the door. It seemed like the value of the year, and it turns out it was.The m1 was able to easily handle photo editing and 4k video editing. For a system with such modest specs It absolutely smoked my i58300h and 1050ti with 32GB of ramI wasn't even able to play back 4k footage smoothly on my gaming PC but the Mac Mini doesn't seem  to care. For 8GB of Ram and a 256GB ssd it very easily is able to handle whatever I throw at it.Since I spent so little on the computer itself I plan on adding a thunderbolt hub and a couple nvme enclosures to really maximize the speed of my workflow.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2022
reviewDescription: I ordered the Mac Mini M1 on Friday with standard free shipping from the vendor and it was delivered the next day (Saturday) by UPS. I'm still in shock. The computer out of the box looked new. I already had the peripherals so I connected everything and was amazed at the performance. I'm not doing any heavy lifting, web browsing, 3D Printing software, DAC for audio and some 4X games. My first computer was a VIC-20 back in 1980 but this unit surpasses any computer I've built or purchased by a large margin. The MacOS is nice but I come from a Linux environment so in the end I'll probably install Parallels and run Linux. The M1 processor that Apple has created is truly a marvel. For video or audio editing on the cheap pickup the 16 GB RAM model with the 512 GB of storage and you will be a happy camper. For the normal computer user the base model with 8 GB is fine. For additional storage and ports there are a number of docks with built in SSD slot made for the Mac Mini M1 available on Amazon.

reviewTitle: I love this M-1, but it does have its idiosyncrasies
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2022
reviewDescription: Having started on a Mac Plus many, many years ago, I am amazed at how the Mac, especially the mini, has evolved. This machine is lightning fast and all it purports to be. However, there are some idiosyncrasies. One I find interesting is that my monitor is hooked up through the HDMI port. If the mini goes in sleep mode, then when turning it back on, the monitor is a grey screen. I had to google to find out that this, indeed, happens with the M1 and how to easily fix it. 'Still annoying though.

reviewTitle: Nothing Really Impressive If You Use RAM
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2022
reviewDescription: Between Affinity Designer, Blender, Unity, Mail, and Safari, this model chugged along at not much better pace than my 2018 i5 Intel model with 32Gb of RAM (minus the fan, which kept me warm in the winter), so I returned it.Ended up going with the base model with 16GB of RAM, and that one makes a HUGE different, especially with rendering out of Blender.Buy this model only if you don't use such RAM hogs.It does put out less heat, though.

reviewTitle: This is a universally recommended desktop
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviewDescription: I looked long and hard before moving to an Apple platform. All reviews said this product was the way to comfortably into the Apple Ecosphere and the advantages of the RISC technology. I took the step and do not regret choosing this product.

reviewTitle: Apple Mac mini M1 - A great computer
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2022
reviewDescription: My MacBook Air crashed and I needed a low cost alternative. Apple didn't disappoint. This Mac mini with the M1 chip is super fast. It's so fast I never hear it running since it has an SSD instead of HD and no internal fan. But it doesn't get hot. It's the coolest computer I've ever owned which is a good indicator of how long it will last. Great job Apple. Thanks Amazon.

reviewTitle: Refurbished is like new. Just get it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
reviewDescription: Incredible.  I‚Äôd never know it wasn‚Äôt new.

reviewTitle: Not sure on this one yet
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2022
reviewDescription: I have had this PC 8 days and in that time I have lost the intel WIFI and the screen acts as if someone is shaking it at times and you can not read anything when it does it. I have to reboot to stop it. Amazon is replacing it over night. I do like how fast it is and the monitor is very nice. To bad something inside is making the screen vibrate at times. I spent 2 days setting it up and now I have to do it all over again. I have had Acer PC's in the past all have been very good. I hope this is just a fluke and my next one doesn't do this. reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
reviewDescription: I don't believe this computer to be a touch-screen, but beyond that, this Lenovo IdeaCentre AIO 3-2022 - All-in-One Desktop is a great desktop computer! It was purchased for my dad, who needed something new for his home office to do his work.I thought that this would be a great computer for him because it's an all-in-one, so it would help his desk be less messy. Everything is contained in the monitor, so no tower or extra wires all over the place. And it comes with a wireless keyboard & mouse to have less wires & clutter on your desk.I don't use the computer myself for day-to-day activities, but I did set it up for my dad & that was easy. The system booted up quickly, it asks you a few questions & pretty much sets itself up. Once I connected it to WiFi, the computer did all the necessary updates, accessed our Cloud, & downloaded all my dad's documents from his old computer to this new computer. I was really impressed with that, because usually, I have to do that manually or through an info share program. It really took me no time at all to get this computer ready for my dad.And this is a really sleek, nice looking computer too. I really like it & am a little jealous of my dad. reviewTitle: Just what it is.  All In One.  Nice. Did have a few items to change, though.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviewDescription: I needed a computer for my spouse.  This fit the bill.  I wish I had thought out the purchase more before I bought i, though.  Nothing bad.......I just needed USB and memory adjustments.  Height check, too.I did add memory to it after purchase.  That 8GB is not enough IMHO.  Windows uses 6GB right off the bat!  If it had to use virtual memory (on the disk), then it would slow down big time.Memory upgrade was........interesting.  Watch a couple of youtube videos.  You can do it. Just go slow.4 USB slots is ok, but, wife wanted her special mouse, so, instead of sharing one slot with the KB and mouse, she was now using 2.  Then, I got a DVD drive, for she HAD to have it for a couple of programs.  Now, only have one left.  Yup, got a USB hub, and so all is ok.Screen is nice.  The whole setup is nice.My only knock on the unit is that the height is not adjustable.  I thought about cutting the desk, or the bar that supports the screen, but, nope.......wife said oh no to that!  ;)  BTW, desk to center of screen is 11".It does tilt front to back, but the tilt to the front is about 5 degrees - not much.  To the back is fine.In summary..........a nice unit.  Check the height.  Consider more memory.  And, rethink the USB setup that you will use.Enjoy!

reviewTitle: Upgrade unfriendly and not for gaming.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2022
reviewDescription: Comes with a 180w power supply. HP power supply is proprietary meaning you just can't use a modular one. I had to order through the official HP parts store and it took two months to arrive. If you got this as a gift and want to upgrade L05757-800 is the model number to search for. Good luck.Installing a SSD was easy enough. I didn't upgrade the memory so I'm not sure if they are proprietary or not.If you're not looking to do any upgrades this is a fast machine. It boots up in a few seconds. Just don't expect to play anything except browser games or stuff from 15 years ago.

reviewTitle: Great for a power user.  Some pitfalls for a novice.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
reviewDescription: I purchased this machine to run Blue Iris for a security camera system.  No issues and a perfect fit for this project.I did run the Benchmark 24hour burn in test and it passed with a few errors that are maintenance related.  CPU thermal compound needs refreshed/ replaced. After that, temps dropped by 10¬∞ C.My take away:If you need a power machine for an appliance, that is what you will get.  No idea about gaming or routine tasks. The SFF has some inherent cooling issues due to the small form factor.  Inside was very clean with no dust.Some things to think about and consider:-Free keyboard and mouse are very basic.  Plan on replacing them-You will need to order video adapters, if you want to plug in a monitor.  I‚Äôd rather see the package include this instead of the mouse/keyboard and wireless adapter.-1Tb SSD is manufactured by Suneast.  Chinese brand with not much documentation, would not 100% rely on it.  Consider a name brand replacement.-Perception of shipping package is not great, no dents and machine was in working order.-If you are considering this a cheap buy to put into a new case and build up, look for a mid-tower unit instead.  Too many Dell proprietary connectors that will need additional adapters.Overall 5 star for a power user. 3.5-4 if you are a novice.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviewDescription: I am so very impressed with this refurbished desktop that I can hardly stand it. For 1/4th the price of new, I now have a super fast, workhorse of a desktop computer. reviewTitle: Excellent System to use as a Media Center
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
reviewDescription: My old Vista era desktop computer died after many years of upgraded service. I bought this to replace it as a media center attached to a large flat panel TV. It has plenty of ports and the built-in video card can handle two 4k displays simultaneously. One point to note is that this system processor does not seem to meet minimum specs for Windows 11. The processor is a quad core I7 with tons of memory and a 3.6 GHz speed rating. Not sure why Windows 11 can't handle that, but then again...Update: After about three weeks of daily use I started getting Blue Screen of Death (BSoD) crashes. They were happening on a daily basis. I had read one other reviewers experience with this and it was related to processor core temperatures. When I checked my unit, all four cores were running hot. I ordered some silicon thermal grease from Amazon. I pulled the chiller and there was not much grease on the processor at all. I cleaned everything thoroughly and applied an ample amount of grease to both the processor and chiller. It has been a week now and no BSoD crashes. I originally gave this system a five star review, but lowered it to four because of the added cost to fix the thermal issue.

reviewTitle: So far so good, sort of.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2022
reviewDescription: Overall I'm as pleased with this machine as can be expected with a refurbished unit. Being one who can't leave well enough alone, I immediately added a second SSD, which required ordering some cables--splitting the power and connecting to a second SATA port. Scavenged video and sound cards from the computer this replaced, and everything works great. All the specs are correct. In general, a good deal. (Since reviews sometimes get applied to different products on this site, it's the Dell Optiplex 7050 SFF Desktop PC Intel i7-7700 4-Cores 3.60GHz 32GB DDR4 model I'm talking about.)The only trouble was temperature issues. The CPU and mainboard started running hot--not right after the additions, but a couple of weeks in. Weird temp spikes came and went. From a comfy low 40s C, leaping for no reason up to 70, 80, and once passing a frightening 95 C! I don't do any gaming or heavy lifting, and the temp freakouts happened under low loads and seemingly at random. Not a speck of dust to clog things up, either. I feared my upgrades had messed something up... I reset the fan control in the BIOS so it'd stay cranked all the time, and that helped, but it was LOUD! Tonight I realized some old thermal paste was in the electro-junk drawer, so I pulled the fan out, cleaned the old gunk off and re-pasted it. Set the fan BIOS back to normal. Bam! Sitting now at 41C for the CPU, 37C mainboard. Otherwise, I'm a happy camper.If I were less brash with digging into the components, I might have given up and returned this one, or not have known it was cooking like an air fryer in there until it was too late. So, the 4-star rating is a stretch. It's 4 stars AFTER some fiddling around.

reviewTitle: i7-12700F/GTX1660 Super has impressive specs, but doesn't support expansion
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 3, 2022
reviewDescription: Let me preface this by saying I really get aggravated by listings that mix different types of products so that the reviews are totally misleading.  I got the top of the line unit from this listing that has great specs, but adding this review to all the other lower end units in this listing is really unacceptable.  I'm tempted to dock a couple of stars just for that.You can see the impressive CrystalDiskMark ratings for the Kingston NVME SSD in these units https://www.amazon.com/Kingston-OM8PDP3512B-A01-512GB-PS5013-Custom/dp/B09NMFCQ49.  It also uses Kingston memory.  The unit has a WD Blue 1 TB spin drive that I didn't really benchmark since I had to replace it with an 18 TB Seagate, (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08L5GQR5V), because while there is an extra SATA port on the motherboard, there's no way to mount a second spin drive.  Unfortunately the hole pattern for the 3.5" drive only matches the WD bottom mount spacing and not the spacing for the Seagate, so I could only install two of the four screws and had to work around holding it properly without rattling the case.The lack of expandability is really my only complaint about this unit.  The specs are really impressive, with the overall Passmark rating being in the 92nd percentile.  It's about 2.5x the performance of the uber PC I'd put together using top of the line components for about four times the price about seven years ago.  However, this is not designed to be expanded.  It has room and motherboard connections for one 2.5" drive, but that's about it.  Everything else, you'll be replacing components.  I can't tell for sure who makes the GEFORCE GTX 1660 card that's there without pulling it (can't find a matching picture anywhere) but it sits in the one PCIe x16 slot and unfortunately it's a two slot wide card that hides the extra PCI x1 slot that could have been used for at least some minor expansion.  The two onboard M.2 slots are taken with the NVME drive and the Wi-Fi card.  Upgrading to the max supported 32 GB of memory means throwing away the 16 GB it comes with.The spin drive mounts on a neat removable panel just under the case cover.  The blue cable you see in the pictures is the one I added to connect a 1 TB SSD into the 2.5" bay.  The unit has an ultra-thin form factor DVD drive but I needed Blu-ray.  It was cheaper to just add an external than trying to replace the one that's in it.Beyond that, there is one big deficiency that WILL affect the average user.  Where are the USB 3.0 ports?!!  There's only one on the back and one USB 3.0 A and one USB-C on the front.  The rest are all USB 2.0?  What the heck?!!  I'm immediately having to add USB 3.0 hubs just to connect everything I'd typically use, including the external Blu-ray.  Not very convenient.So, overall this highest end unit in this listing is pretty impressive specs in a nice lightweight case.  For the average user, this is probably more than enough and the lack of expandability won't be an issue.  However, given I was upgrading from a machine with better specs all around except for speed, the inability to expand it had me considering pulling the components into a larger case with a different motherboard.  Frankly, from the feature list, this is really a laptop in a mini tower case.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 22, 2023
reviewDescription: If you are looking for a gaming machine, this ain't it. But it IS a great setup overall for home or office. Easy to upgrade right out of the box. There are a few YouTube videos to watch for guidance. Memory was first, TEAMGROUP T-Create Classic 10L DDR4 32¬†GB Kit (Amazon $55.99). Then the available PCIe X16 slot was filled with a SABRENT NVMe M.2 SSD to PCIe X16 Card (Amazon $15.95) and a Crucial P3 1¬†TB PCIe Gen3 3D NAND NVMe M.2 SSD (Amazon $45.99) for a nice storage upgrade without using the much slower SATA interface. There is no case fan included, so an ARCTIC P12 PWM‚Äî120 mm 4 pin Case Fan took care of that (Amazon $9.09). Finally, there is only one USB-C port in the front and two USB-A 3.2 ports, one up front and one on the rear. So a low cost PCI-E Expansion Card with 2 USB Type-A and 2 USB Type-C Ports, SINEFINE (Amazon $16.99) filled the PCIe x4 slot and added plenty of ports. Goes from power on button to booted desktop in less than10 seconds. Upgrades totaled out at like $180.00 Delivered. Quite and fast, this build will last for years.

reviewTitle: Great for everyday use, gaming and photo and video editing
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 1, 2022
reviewDescription: This computer is a beast for the price! The multi-core processor performance far exceeded my expectations coming 4th with a score of 12391 in Cinebench and 2nd in the single-core performance with a score of 1437.The built-in NVMe in my unit is made by KIOXIA as shown in one of the pictures. The reading speed on this M.2 SSD is not as fast as I‚Äôd hoped. The other computers I use or have used with an M.2 SSD had reading speeds that exceeded 2530 MB/s, whereas this KIOXIA SSD has a reading speed of roughly 1780 MB/s as shown in the CrystalDiskMark screenshots from the tests I performed on it. The writing speed is relatively good at 1320 MB/s. Even though the reading speeds are lower than my expectations, I didn‚Äôt find it to be an issue at all for normal day-to-day use or for gaming, etc. I could mainly cripple the system if you are using an external hard drive to copy files from the computer, still, the difference would only be seconds or a couple of minutes.I used photoshop and premiere pro for photo and video editing on this HP Pavilion Desktop Computer and found it to be very fast and snappy. The videos didn‚Äôt take much time to render or export on premiere pro, definitely much shorted that the time it takes on my Dell XPS 17 9710.This computer is a beast for gaming as well, unfortunately, that display I have right now has a refresh rate of 60 Hz so I couldn‚Äôt test the gaming performance to the fullest at higher refresh rates but I don‚Äôt see running games on 120Hz, 144Hz, 160Hz being an issue at all for this computer. It comes with a built-in app for AMD Radeon performance tweaking which I found very elegant and useful.The fans can run quite loud when you‚Äôre performing power-consuming tasks such as heavy gaming or video rendering, etc. I didn‚Äôt find it to be a big issue, but you‚Äôll be able to hear the far spinning.The HP Pavilion Desktop Computer comes with the ‚ÄúMy HP‚Äù app which keeps track of drivers, updates, and the health of the computer, it also offers games and features like helping you transfer files between computers, etc. I found this HP software to be nicely designed and handy to use.This computer does NOT come with a CD/DVD player, but there‚Äôs space to add one yourself if you need to. To open the cover of this computer there‚Äôs only one screw you need to unscrew, and no screwdriver is provided in the box. You can use a standard screwdriver for this task though. There‚Äôs only one M.2 slot available, but there‚Äôs a PCI EXPRESS connection available to be used if needed.This computer comes with a wired keyboard and mouse in the box, I found them comfortable and easy to use. There are no built-in speakers or microphones but there are ports to connect your own external ones.It would‚Äôve been nice if they added a foldable handle on top of this case just to make it easier to carry and move around. There are no handles unfortunately and you have to be extra careful not to drop the computer if you‚Äôre moving it from one place to another.Overall,  I‚Äôm still surprised by the good performance of this computer. For this price, it‚Äôs a beast that can be used for gaming, photo, and video editing, and just about everyday activities. Its SSD is not the fastest I‚Äôve seen, and a folding handle on the case could‚Äôve been nice, but this is still a great computer that‚Äôs very powerful and relatively affordable.

reviewTitle: Great Desktop PC from a reliable company
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 21, 2022
reviewDescription: HP has been building desktop computers for such a long time, and has really been a staple in the computer industry for as long as I can remember.  This desktop computer is very simple, yet elegant in its own way.  There's no flashy lighting you see on so many gaming desktops.  This PC is built purely for workstation power.  It has an amazingly quick Ryzen 7 processor, paired with an adequate amount of RAM (16GB).  Unlike a lot of other PC's I see these days that only come with a single stick of memory, this one came with two, so it runs in dual channel, as any proper computer should.There are plenty of USB ports on both the front and back, and a welcome USB Type C also included on the front of the tower.  The technical specs page at the time of this writing is a very screwed up.  It states the Hard Drive is an 8GB SSD, but that's completely incorrect and would be wrong for any PC system today.  The included M.2 drive is a 512GB variant, unfortunately only capable of running 1.6gb/sec read and 1.2gb/sec write speeds.  There are considerably faster M.2 drives, even in the older gen 3 spec.Also on the tech specs page - again, as of the time of this writing, it lists a 7200rpm hard drive rotation speed.  There is absolutely no platter based hard drive in this computer system.  Only the single 512GB M.2 included, as seen in my photo's.  At least they got the processor, RAM, and amount of USB ports correct.If you are only comfortable buying a pre-built desktop computer then this is a solid solution for a fast and speedy workstation.  However, you can save yourself around $250 (at the time of this writing) and build a nearly identical computer, albeit with a better power supply, and a faster M.2 drive, which are advantages in my opinion.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 10, 2022
reviewDescription: This bundle is unmatched for the price. The packaging the monitors and PC arrived in was very secure and everything inside the box was encased in air pads. The 19 inch monitors were much larger than I had anticipated, and the back plates and stands were easy to put on. My only quirk with this bundle, which is barely noticeable, is the VGA to HDMI adaptor that was included displays short on the monitor. However, if you take the time to adjust it, the space is not noticeable due to the black border around the monitors, causing it to entirely blend in. The PC is slim, and does not make a lot of noise or overheat. The PC itself does not connect to wifi, so the usb-wifi adapter included in the bundle is clutch.I did purchase a separate wireless keyboard and mouse because when reading the reviews, the mouse and keyboard in this bundle were not positively talked about, and in my own experience, they were also pretty cheap. I also connected a Bluetooth speaker to the PC because the preset speakers are, well, built-in PC speakers.Overall, the price and quality for the two monitors and the PC is incredible. I purchased this setup to do school and clinical work as I finish dental school, and to have my first home office setup. The dual monitors are perfect for me in dental school because I am able to tx plan and review radiographs at the same time through the two monitors.Whether you are in school, looking for a solid PC and monitors for the office, or are trying to find a cheap, reliable, and quality home office start-up computer, this is the moment I would suggest you press Add to Cart and stop the long search.

reviewTitle: Computer Did Not Work from the Start, and a Bribe
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 21, 2022
reviewDescription: The computer arrived on Tuesday, but I was unable to set it up until that Friday evening.  Upon setting the computer up, one of the monitors was blurry and pixelated.  I ran through the standard troubleshooting - swap cables, swap ports, make sure the adapters were removed, check the settings in Windows.  No dice.At that point, I sent a fairly detailed message to tech support outlining the problem and my troubleshooting steps. I received a reply asking me to do one of the troubleshooting steps that I'd already done. After a little back-and-forth, they offered to replace the monitor.  So far, so good.Being a renewed computer, it predated on-board WiFi.  SJ Computers provided a WiFi adapter.  By Sunday, I noticed that I kept losing WiFi connectivity.  I had to manually restart the computer several times to reconnect, and I kept having to fiddle with it, to the point where I couldn't actually get my work done.This is probably a good time to note that all of the software we use to run the business is cloud-based, so no Wifi, no work.  In addition to a broken monitor and intermittent WiFi issues, the computer started then randomly restarting on its own.  I was now at the point where I'd spent more time trying to keep this unit working than I'd been able to spend doing my work. I am aware that in purchasing a renewed computer, these things can happen - so even though I was thoroughly frustrated, it was just a thing that could have happened and since the old computer still worked, easy enough to reverse and move on.Tech support called me and said they could walk me through the intermittent WiFi issues.  I explained again the series of issues I was experiencing (pixelated monitor, WiFi and random restarts) and told the gentleman I just wanted to return the unit.  He (Frank, I believe?) issued the return tag and we were good to go, or so I thought.After a frustrating weekend, I sit down to dinner on Sunday night and I get another phone call from SJ Computers.  There is a woman on the line, whose name I shall intentionally leave out.  She starts trying to get me back in touch with tech support.  As politely as possible (which probably wasn't very polite at that point - I'll admit) I declined.  I had already repackaged the computer and was home for the day.  She then starts trying to get me to leave a 4- or 5-star review telling me her job and her pay depended on it. Emotional blackmail, much?  I informed Anonymous Customer Service Rep that should I leave a review - my review would be completely honest: the computer didn't work, given the number and types of issues I had, I was not particularly willing to try their products again but I realized it was a used computer, things happened and up until that point, I had no issues with anyone to whom I had spoken.And then she escalates.  She offered me a "gift": wireless mouse, wireless keyboard, or anything else I might want if I would promise to leave her a 4- or 5-star review.  Yes.  This is an actual bribe.  And the conversation went on for several minutes, with her repeating the need for me to leave a 4- or 5-star review so her pay didn't get docked and offering gifts in exchange for that rating.  I informed her I did not want the gift and that my review, if left, would be an honest one.Had Anonymous Customer Service Rep not tried to emotionally blackmail me and bribe me, I would have most likely never left a review at all, but here we are.  Amazon - if you're reading this, you need to talk to this company about some of their practices.

reviewTitle: Had a system boot problem after 2 weeks
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviewDescription: I had a house power disruption that shut down the computer. I attempted to reboot and the processor didn't find the HD and would not reboot. I directed the system to run diagnostics via the blue screen option. After 15 minutes of system evaluation the HD was discovered and the system allowed reboot. I am concerned that this may be a symptom of potential HD problems. I have not yet seen this happen again, yet.I am happy with the computer otherwise.
variant: Style: Intel Core i7-4770 | No Optical

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviewDescription: I received an email a day before the delivery date from the company explaining how to download wifi drivers if there was a problem at boot up. It had a link that took me to the drivers. I ended up not needing to use them, but it was a nice gesture.The computer comes with:- Wifi USB dongle- Bluetooth USB dongle- AC power cord- Display Port to HDMI adaptor (computer only has Display Port slots)- Corded Mouse (low quality but useable)- Corded Keyboard (low quality, but better than the mouse)- Paperwork that explains that Windows 10 is a OEM volume install so it comes pre-activated.The outer housing of the computer was in almost new condition. The only flaws noticeable were a couple small scratches on the silver Dell logo area.It started right up and booted into Windows without a problem. It took me moving the Wifi dongle to another USB port to get a connection, but that was the only problem I ran into. Since then, the computer and connection are stable and strong.The graphics are good for business and video/internet duty. You can play older games, but the GPU isn't made for gaming so don't buy this computer for a kid who wants to game unless they like vintage gaming.I like the computer and knew the limitations before I purchased it. It's a big step up from my old laptop and the only real downside (which I knew before buying it) was that it's not Windows 11 upgradable.
