reviewTitle: Powerful mini-PC with nice configuration & fast processing speed for any entertainment room!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2022
reviewDescription: This is the 4th mini-PC that I have ever owned and I have to admit that this is the fastest one in processing speed of all & also the best looking one. The reason I had to try this is due to the i5-1135G7 processor. My need to buy a mini PC was to live stream and watch YouTube videos along with some light web browsing in my 2nd office room that we created recently. And this mini-PC sparkles on all the breakthroughs set by me. I have tried other mini-PC in the past but the experience was not good with them due to their super slow speed.Now talking about this product, you need to understand that this is not meant for overwhelming utilization, and over-clocking is constrained for the execution of heavy apps. I have used it fairly for 7 days and my review is exclusively based on this brief usage with the gadget. I will update my review in the future in case my point of view changes during the long-run usage.My 2 cents below :Pros:- Decent configuration: Intel i5-1135G7 processor with 4 cores & 8 threads. Its base operating frequency is 2.40 GHz/s rising to a 4.20 GHz in burst mode- Intel Iris Xe Graphics is an add-on to calibrate as per your need- PC performance is good enough for the processor and with 16 GB DDR4 RAM. Doesn't slow down the operation drastically while running the latest windows. RAM is expandable to 64GB maximum- High HD video including 4K run so smoothly without any issues. Have tried YouTube, Netflix, Apple TV, and many online free content providers.- PC supports triple display with 4K@60Hz output- Has WiFi6 inbuilt and hence up to the latest standards- Mini-PC runs decently fast even when I do multitask- No issue with web browsing either. I have parallelly used multi-tabs without any issue and playing multiple youtube windows together definitely works as well- It has WIFI (both 2.4 and 5ghz) & Bluetooth 5.2. My Keyboard/Mouse connected works flawlessly via Bluetooth- Multiple I/O ports: 4 USB 3.0 ports, 1 Type-C port, 1 Gigabit Ethernet port, 1 HDMI port, 1 DP port & an audio 3.5mm jack port. This should suffice for most of the needs- The device itself is very light and portable- This is a very good looking device with a nice design aesthetics- Comes with a monitor VESA mount & hardware to place it behind the screen- Licensed version 64bit Windows 11 Professional is pre-installed- Comes with 512 GB M.2 SSD already installed in it. SSD is expandable to 4TB maximum- It doesn't overheat. Thanks to the fan beneath it. I kept it on with video playing for 3+ hours and still went good- Comes with an HDMI cable in the box- Manual has detailed directions in it to refer to if needed- Setup process was easy and quick. Everything was ready within 10 minutes- 1-year worry-free warranty providedCons:- Yes, it does have a fan and so does the noise. Sometimes more when the PC runs the heavy job but I would say it's a trade-off to keep the PC running efficiently without any issues and I am completely okay with it- There are no DP cables included in the package- I wish it had 2 HDMI at least- No TF card port to add additional storage if neededConsidering the cost and convenience in a room where you do not need to put through a huge CPUs, I profoundly suggest this product.

reviewTitle: Lot of power but not without its issues - UPDATED
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviewDescription: I like this little computer but it has had issues and tech support has not been very helpful.  All the usb ports work intermittently which is quite annoying.  Tech support told me it is my wires, I assure you, it is not my wires.  I love the concept of a mini computer and will probably get another one in the future, just probably with a different brand next time.* Edited from 3 stars to 5.  The company reached out to me and stood by their product after the return deadline had passed.  Making sure your customers are happy is the backbone of any great company so I felt the need to update my review.  Thanks again, the new computer is working as it should.

reviewTitle: Compact, silent, excellent replacement for Mac Mini!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this to replace my Mac Mini that I use for my records management and NAS interface system. It runs my scanning software, my VPN client, etc., and is always on 24/7. I have it VESA mounted to my monitor, and it comes with the bracket for doing this. I was super pleased with how easy it was to install and it has ran perfectly for the two months I've had it, so this is not some review done the first week. Windows 11 can be easily tweaked to look like 10 or 7 with an inexpensive add on, so don't let that put you off. I'm really happy with this purchase!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviewDescription: Hello everyone and Happy New Year. I'm 58 years old and I did not get my first computer until I was 35 years old. My first computer had Windows 98 and it was fairly easy to figure out and use. Unfortunately the next operating systems and computers I've had since were difficult for me to operate. The fact is I'm tech challenged and I've been frustrated with each new OS and computer I've had, until now. My last computer was getting old and was still running Windows 8.1 and I knew it was time to upgrade. I contacted a close friend whom is very tech savvy and asked him for a recommendation and this is the computer he recommended. I didn't even know it was a mini computer when I ordered it so when I got it I was sort of shocked and confused by how small it is, 2x2x5. Anyway I called my buddy and questioned what I had bought and he reassured me it was fine. So I loaded what ever I wanted to save off the old computer onto a flash drive then mounter the new mini computer onto the back of my monitor and turned it on. The first thing I noticed is it is fast, as in very fast. Within a few minutes I was loading the files off the flash drive into it and in less than an hours time I was using the new computer. I've been using it for over a month so far and not once has it done any of the stupid and annoying things my old computers did. I also noticed it shuts itself off a while after I stop using it and when I turn it back on it fires right up and is ready to rock just about instantly. There is only one problem now. When I go to work and have to deal with the computers there, they do a lot of the stupid stuff my old computers did and it's frustrating. If you're like me and are frustrated with your computer get this ASBS computer and see what I'm talking about. An added bonus is I now have a nice open space that the old bulky computer tower occupied so I gained storage space and I will use it well.

reviewTitle: This was my first Mini PC and I LOVE IT!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
reviewDescription: First, right after I bought mine, there was a significant price jump. If it was as expensive as it is now, I probably would have not spent the money since I never tried a mini PC before. I have always built my computers (probably 20 or so for myself and others) so I was a little hesitant to buy a box that I can probably never fix if something breaks. I will probably never build another PC, these are powerful enough for daily computing and a little more. Comparing prices to the parts to build a system pr one of these, I think these are the future of home computing. I do not game with it so I can't give any info there... I use it as a Home Theater PC and for general computing and it is great, very fast.The Windows 11 was easy to activate (do not connect to the Internet until you are done with initial setup). I can routinely put this to sleep with no crashes on wakeup and I love that it is almost perfectly silent.The only cons are: Drivers not straightforward. Basically the support you get for the OS is an image, if you want to update individual drivers, do so at your own risk (if you can find them!) I wanted to update my video driver because of the second issue...Every once in a while  (maybe every two weeks or so) there will be some kind of problem with the video display to my HDMI TV. It looks like some kind of raster problem... very fine horizontal lines moving in the picture which makes it look blurry. When it starts happening, it will be rastered for a couple of seconds and return to normal... then rastered and return to normal. Sometimes it will simply stop happening, other times  have to restart and it goes away. It seems to happen when I have multiple video windows running... security cameras, Youtube, Pluto, etc. It happens to the whole PC, not just the video windows. Not sure if it is hardware, driver or what but it isn't annoying enough to return it.Overall I would highly recommend Mini PCs in general and this is a very good one!

reviewTitle: Excellent mini PC backed by equally excellent Customer Service
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviewDescription: I was looking for a no-nonsense replacement for my aging, old-school tower PC.  Having grown tired after decades of periodic hardware upgrades, I wanted something relatively beefy right out of the box, something that would keep up for a few years, performance-wise, but that wouldn't break the bank.  I should note that I'm not a gamer, so my requirements are relatively modest.I was quite surprised by the ease of setup.  Pretty close to plug & play.  I needed only to buy a couple of HDMI to DisplayPort adapters and I was done.  Stock Windows 11 Pro was up and running within minutes of unboxing.  It's been running continuously for about two months hanging off the back of a monitor, completely out of the way, and it's barely warmer than room temperature, despite being absolutely silent.  It's everything I had hoped for.A word about customer service - after about a month, I started getting Blue Screens (it happens.  I don't fault the seller).  I ran numerous diagnostics and determined it was most likely (though not definitively) a memory problem.  I contacted the seller and, literally within a few hours, was given instructions on how to reinstall the system.  When that didn't resolve the problem, I was offered a replacement PC, which I graciously accepted.  I received the replacement even before I had packed up the defective unit.  I sent the old unit back and was instantly reimbursed for shipping.  I was fully restored within, I believe it was 5 days, but that was mainly due to my slow response replying to emails, not the seller's.Bottom line is that I would have no reservation recommending ASBS to a friend who was looking for a mini-PC, or, indeed, if I need a second unit in the near future.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviewDescription: I added a 2TB nVME SSD ($100) and transferred the OS to it as my boot drive.  I kept the SATA SSD as a secondary drive and upgraded the memory to 32GB ($50).  This thing is super fast and super small.  You won't find a better value for the money.  It does sometimes make a popping sound when switching between applications but it doesn't bother me.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviewDescription: Edit 2 and TL;DR - I first got a faulty unit. The manufacturer's customer support did their best to help me solve the issues but did not succeed. I returned the unit for a full refund. They then offered to send me a new unit for FREE. The unit arrived a month ago and has been working flawlessly ever since.Bottom line: Exceptional customer support!I'd buy from them again in a heartbeat.In between returning the faulty unit and getting the free replacement I tried a similar mini PC from another, slightly more known vendor, which also happened to be faulty (don't know if it's just a coincidence or these mini PCs have a high malfunctioning rate, or perhaps low QA standards).The customer support I got from the other vendor was AWFUL. Slow and confusing communication, bad advice and general ineffectiveness.If you need/want this type of mini PC, consider that there's a probability that it would need service, and if it does, you'd be happy to have a company like ASBS, that takes their customers very seriously, on your side.OLD REVIEW for the faulty unit.This PC was working fine for about a week, and then started "acting out".At first it would freeze after about an hour or two of use, and I'd have to restart it. Then it would just restart itself.I wrote to the manufacturer and to their defense I must say they were quick to answer, and provided detailed instructions on how to reinstall the OS, which was supposed to solve the problem.Unfortunately it actually made things worse. While installing the OS, after a couple of restarts, the PC just stopped working altogether.I wrote again and they suggested that I return it and get a refund, which I did.

After installation of the memory and radio it booted up flawlessly and continues to run flawlessly. I'm very pleased with the ASBS Mini computer and for what I use it for as it runs and acts like a laptop computer. The video quality is amazing and the mini form factor makes it a keeper. reviewTitle: Small and tidy computer with plenty of power
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
reviewDescription: Do you dislike big box computers with their piles of cables?  I certainly do!  That is why I was attracted to this Intel Nuc.  Take a look at the pictures attached to this review.  Only two cables attached!  An HDMI cable to the monitor and a power cable to the Nuc.  Well yes, the monitor also has a power cable.  So there is actually three cables.  Still a very clean setup.I added a Dell Bluetooth Keyboard and Mouse combo KM7321W which is working great with my Nuc.  A bluetooth keyboard and mouse combo keeps the three USB A ports open and available and banishes unsightly keyboard and mouse cables. This Nuc also has two super fast Thunderbolt 3 / USB C ports.  One on the front one on the back.  The back also contains an HDMI port and an ethernet port.The Nuc is protected by a three year warranty.The i7 Nucs have plenty of power to browse the web, edit photos with Affinity Photo, design posters with Affinity Designer and work with Microsoft Office.I have my Nuc connected to a Dell 4k 32 inch curved monitor.  It is a great platform for watching 4k youtube videos.My brother connected an external gpu (Graphic Processing Unit) to his i7 Intel Nuc.  He has been playing graphically intense games without an issue.Thanks to Amazon Prime you won't have to wait long to receive an Intel Nuc if you so choose.

reviewTitle: Excellent small computer for basic users
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
reviewDescription: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews for items I purchase at Amazon but, as a retired IT pro, I decided to make an exception for the Kamrui Mini AK2 Pro I recently acquired.I purchased this machine in spite of some concerns about the ‚Äúdated‚Äù processor and the relatively small (128 Gb) SSD drive because my needs were reduced from my prior working days and my current system (a Dell Inspiron 5521 A14 laptop with i7-3537U processor and 2 Tb HDD) was getting tired after 9 years of daily use.The AK2 has exceeded my expectations.  It is as quick as the old Dell in most cases (at least partially attributable to not having 9 years of installs and deletes to contend with) and will in all probability meet my needs nicely.I did have one hitch in initializing the system in that in hung when trying to assign a pin number for booting.  I reached out to support@kamrui.com and received a quick response reiterating the advice in the Q&A section on Amazon (which I had skipped over) to do the following:To avoid initial setup issues, the first time you use this mini pc,1)Please don't connect network or wifi until the windows system of your mini pc is running. No need to fill in the mailbox, skip this step, you can use the machine normally.2)If you have connected to WIFI when it can not load into windows, please turn off the router you are using.3)If you only use the wired network to connect the mini pc, please unplug the wired network directly, restart the machine, and keep the machine disconnected from the network.Once I heeded that advice the installation completed quickly.One other issue I had was with the Ethernet connection ‚Äì it just won‚Äôt work with a 10/100 switch but replacing that with a Gigabit switch worked fine.I would definitely purchase this machine again but would recommend a more robust processor for anyone more interested in gaming than I.

reviewTitle: Great no frills home office machine
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
reviewDescription: Replaced an 8 year old dual core early i5. This machine flies on Windows 10. No bloatware on it either. Cosmetics are good, I can tell it was an off lease office machine but for the price, it's an excellent value versus some low quality consumer junk box at Best Buy. These corporate machines were designed with 5-8 year life spans and are easily to upgrade things like RAM, adding a video card, etc.It is my primary work at home machine and has been on continuously since it came out of the box in July and it is mid December, not one issue, blue screen or problem. Handles everything I can throw at it like Office 365, web browsing, YouTube even at 4K, etc. I am not a gamer so I have no idea how well it would handle a modern game, but I imagine you would want to put a better video card for that purpose than rely on on board video.These machines have plenty of life and are built to last. It keeps them out of the landfill and you get a much better box than some black Friday wonderbox at Best Buy filled with bloatware and bottom end hardware that will barely hold up past it's 1 year warranty.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviewDescription: excellent condition work great shipping was fast

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviewDescription: This is a great workstation PC. It has plenty of memory and speed. The SSD makes it boot extremely fast. It runs Adobe PS smooth while having multiple websites open.This is the i7 6700 processor and it does not meet windows 11 security requirements - you CAN NOT update to windows 11. However Microsoft will support & update win 10 until 10/2025.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviewDescription: I generally run a old PC as a game server and dev server. My CPU cooler went out and thought I'd look at a mini PC because it didn't cost a big amount more and I wanted something quieter and less heat. Enter this SER5.After watching some reviews and looking at the motherboard, I decided to give it a try. To my amazement, it works better than I expected. While I was setting it up, it felt responsive and doing simple tasks worked as well or better than most Windows tablets I've had that were light weight. Win11 was pre-installed, so I kept it and just cleaned it up a bit to get the M$ bloat removed.I'm not using this strictly as a user device, so I can't say how well it holds up to everyday use or running UI intensive apps/games. The GPU shares RAM, so even though you might think you have 16GB RAM on this, you don't. I had thought I could adjust the GPU RAM allocation in the bios, although I haven't found an option for it yet.That leads to my only issue with this machine. The web site for Beelink looks like it was made in 2005. Navigating is sloooww. Finding anything related to support about this particular model doesn't exist. The closest thing you'll find is an obscure link on the contact page that shows they have a forum. Getting any kind of reply there must require you to hold your head a certain way and let you tongue hang out a particular side because I've been waiting 3 days for a response on the BIOS version. Beelink's take on updating your BIOS for some silly reason is that you need to supply a picture of you machine's S/N so they can give you an exact version. I've seen some comments in the forums that it is too easy for users to flash the wrong BIOS. Well, someone send some notes to Gigabyte, MSI, ASUS and all the other manufacturers out there because I've been able to download BIOS for over 20 years. Hopefully one day someone will respond as from what I can tell, I need the update in order to change the GPU RAM.In the end, it's not the end of the world on the BIOS or support. I'm comfortable cracking a case and operating on a board, so other than downloads, I don't plan on needing their support. For the price of the machine and performance I've seen so far setting up some game servers, I'm happy otherwise. If this machine holds out well over the next 6 months or so, I'll probably get another (maybe more recent model) for other needs.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
reviewDescription: The ser6pro variant is probably the most cost efficient for next gen performance without buying a new board/ram/latest amd cpu which is gonna run you over a grand itself there for desktop.This comes with ddr5 ram crucial branded. A 500gb crucial nvme with pcie 4 speeds as I confirmed the model number online after disassembly. The wifi card is replacable too and there's a spot for a 2.5 old fashioned ssd but it blocks a fan above the nvme so idk if its worth having tbh but good incase.I installed Linux and ubuntu runs perfectly. Emulation wise, everything up to switch emulation will run including rpcs3. Surprisingly rpcs3 runs perfect than on my rtx desktop build so amd has am edge here even with integrated graphics. Yuzu however is 50/50 youll get drops in the really heavy intensive games like botw and scarlet/violet (which is already a mess to begin with) os unplayable since choppy and graphics pop in randomly. Thats the verdict on emulation and not the fault of the device but the current state of the emulators etc. Dolphin and below run perfectly.Power wise it never pulled more than 80w even on full yuzu rendering. I didnt run native pc games but its definitly cost effective electricity rate wise. The only downside is you will need two things to fully replace a desktop with that im surprised it wasent taken into account. Buy a usb audio splitter to run external speakers if you use external speakers. There is a headphone jack in the front but id rather the speaker plug not be in the front and ruin looks so usb audio splitter is req 1 to buy.The second is a usb hub lol. Two ports in the back will be filled almost always with mouse and kb, if you need anything else (like a usb audio splitter) then you'll be using front ports also ruining looks. So a hub to split 1 port to 4 and gives you 4 slots to expand(mouse /kb/audio/ ???).All in all this is a great device. Longevity wise  i have no idea since this is my first build but for general usage and emulation gaming you cant go wrong. People online have run native games like forza etc and it still produces a stable framerate which is great if thats your thing.Monitor situation: can theoretically use 3 since front USB c is usable for display in addition to the two hdmi. Idk what the hdmi ports are rated at but when i tested a dual monitor 144hz qhd each build it had 100hz options which was strange but I feel that 60hz is the safest best. Target 60hz and 60fps and you'll be fine.Fan noise is non existant which was shocking considering laptops ignite in heat and noise while this just stays a stable cool temp. Ofcourse if you load the cpu heavy for long periods of time itl heat up but that's the reality of everything. Cooling is definitly an improvement over other models I've tested.One random note ive noticed. Ubuntu recognizes the audio drivers as having a mic onboard but after testing it there's no input so i think this might be a component from a previous model that had a onboard mic. I took the device apart and still was unable to locate a physical mic port and bios is a mess to determine what's going on but if you're a privacy nut like me there is no cause for alarm for this. Disable it in the os if applicable and use an external mic if need be for stream or whatever.

reviewTitle: Great little unit so far! My impressions...
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviewDescription: Caught a sale deal on this mini-PC and decided to give it a try - early impressions are most definitely positive!Right out of the box, this unit has some heft to it - the build quality is really good, with an aluminum casing - definitely feels like a quality unit, and not cheap. Runs nice and quiet too!The performance for the price is excellent. It's more than enough for every day basic tasks or use as a media server (or travel computer), but in line with the advertising, it's a surprisingly good unit for gaming - within reason. The integrated Radeon 680M graphics on these new 7000-series Ryzen CPUs (used in this unit) is currently the best performing option on the market short of a dedicated GPU. While it won't work miracles on the most demanding games out there, it can handle a surprising amount of relatively recent titles in 1080p with good frame rates (esp. w/FSR enabled), and in a number of titles it outperforms the GTX 1050 Ti in my 2017 Desktop build - impressive stuff for integrated graphics!Even as a bit of a desktop purist to some degree, I'm a fan of these mini-PCs - they're really versatile (can be a desktop alternative for lighter use, good in a TV/media room setup, or even as a travel PC w/a portable monitor), and save a ton of energy over regular desktops for the things you can do with them. I can definitely recommend checking this one out if you're thinking of getting one!

reviewTitle: Really nice desktop for the price
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviewDescription: I like working on a full size monitor so a desktop always seems to be the best value. This Beelink SER5 replaced an Intel-based Mac Mini that was about 7 years old. The Beelink came with Windows 11 which booted up no problem but I did wipe the drive and replace it with Linux. The only confusion I had was the computer did not come with a Windows registration key so I am not sure if it has a licensed copy of Windows or if I would have had to buy one. That was not an issue for me because I don't run that cancer and I planned on installing Linux from the moment I ordered it.It has good performance, never gets hot and I play some older Steam games on it. The Ryzen 5 processor was released in about 2021 so its not the latest and greatest. Don't expect to run the latest FPS or racing game on it. I mainly program and do office work on it and it is perfect.  Great little computer for under $400 and well appointed with 16Gb RAM and a 500GB SSD. It even came with a bracket to install on the back of my monitor but it takes so little desk space I didn't bother.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewDescription: I had built a couple years back a decent gaming PC with an R5 3600x, 5700xt and 32g ddr4 mem.Honestly, this thing blows it away. My monitors even look more crisp and clear than they did with my gaming PC which I find very strange!???As far as running games as well as the other PC did, that's not going to happen as it was a much better GPU, however I rarely even play games. Video and audio editing though - this will crush the performance of the old one and I'm excited I could make that happen for sub $600! What a great little PC.Oh and the cost to run this vs that huge system is pennies to the dollar haha.Good buy. I was skeptical, but dang this is nice.You'll want to get a good USB 3 hub as well this is limited on IO which is probably the biggest drawback, but 30$ can buy a pretty decent 7port hub on here.I really wish they made external cooling options for this thing though. A 100mm fan that bolted directly to the bottom with some feet to raise for air flow or even a plate to use with the wall mount would be an easy implementation I feel and possibly help lower the internal temps. I like to keep my units temperature as low as possible and with water cooling on the old system it never reached over 70c even during high demand games. But I doubt many ppl will even need to worry about that stuff with every day workloads.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviewDescription: OK, so this is a computer (duh.) It is a modern (as of April 2023) very fast processor. Four type A USB 3 ports, 1 USB 3.2 C gen 2, headphone out, 32 gb ram and a 500gb PCIe primary memory. It is not clearly stated, but it is easy to pop off the bottom and put in a 2.5" SATA type SSD, which I did. It comes with a 1.5 m (give or take) HDMI cable and a robust brick type power supply. For what I got, the price point is astonishingly good. My only complaint, which I think is fair, is that the power cord from the mains to the brick is kinda skimpy. The case is very well ventilated, with 4 of six sides have ventilation holes. The top of the box, which comes in a nice gray fabric, can be exchanged for a black fabric top which is included.I'm not a gamer so I can't speak to those issues. I don't tweak, OC, etc so again I can't speak to those issues regarding BIOS.This could easily be my main computer were it not for some funky development and sound stuff that I do.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviewDescription: My gaming PC runs 24/7 and uses a lot of power and makes a lot of heat. This little unit lets my main rig sleep and uses next to no power and puts out nearly no heat. It's hooked into switch boxes for the mouse, keyboard, external hard drives and three monitors. I have tuned everything so that I can't tell which PC is running without looking to see if the gaming rig is lit up. Since the two are sharing storage, I can even download games while I'm playing games now. Now I use the mini for everything but gaming. Just so everyone knows, these minis stutter in video playback but only for a couple hours at most. It takes a little bit for the memory to learn how it's going to be used. Don't get mad and return it after a few minutes of use. In a couple hours, it will be running like a full on gaming PC. 4K video and high quality audio is no problem at all. Also, my gaming PC downloads at 970 Mb/s. The mini downloads at 986 Mb/s. Both are on a wired connection. No idea why the mini is slightly faster, but it is. lol

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviewDescription: Excellent price point for a laptop-in-desktop form factor mimi PC. I selected this because I was exited I could use it with three monitors. The teal color rather than a boring white, grey, or black is a nice touch. The fan noise is about what I would expect from such a computer. Quite at idle, but noticable when doing computationally intensive tasks.There are a couple of quirks though. The USB-A ports are in the oposite orientation than I typically find, so accessories that have an orientation, like a yubikey, will be the wrong way around. Nothing a USB extension cable can't fix. I also use the USB-C port for video output, so having it on the front rather than the back with the HDMI outputs makes the cabling a little untiddy. I suppose if you're using it for a different accessory though the placement makes sence. Finally, the top is a textile covered ventilation grille. I hadn't seen such a design choice before, but it does come second swappable top in case you want to go for the alternate color.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviewDescription: Bought this little guy to get some stuff done, and also be able to play some games. Haven't had any issues with games. I know they aren't at the top settings, but they've run great, especially for this price. It is so much better, also, buying a computer NOT from a big brand that loads it with all kinds of crapware. Having Windows Pro simplifies all that. I have my monitor I got used for like 30 bucks, keyboard and mouse, and headphones since there's no speakers. All I need. Haven't had a single issues and had it for a few weeks.

reviewTitle: Very happy with this little unit
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2023
reviewDescription: Compact, silent and plenty powerful enough for what I do. I am pleasantly surprised by the speed and efficiency of this machineSet this up as a dual boot system Windows/Linux.  It has enough capacity to hold both systems.  Have added a 1TB external drive for files/movies/work..

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviewDescription: I have ordered 2computers this week and they both did not have the features that were described. This one came with out the dvd player  with a dirty mouse and keys broken. It's really gross..amazon is slipping

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2019
reviewDescription: Bottom line... this is a very nice machine.  I currently own a three year old refurbished Lenovo M82 with essentially the same specs as this machine.  I wanted to buy my son a new machine to replace his old one, so I went looking for another refurbished Lenovo.  I found this M93p model.  It has all the specs I was looking for... a fast I5 processor, a 256 Gig SSD, a DVD, and 8 Gig of ram.  I could have bought a lower priced machine, and then upgraded its standard hard drive with a faster solid state drive (once you have experienced SSD speed you can never go back), but decided this machine was what I wanted for ultimately the same final price.  I'm very pleased with this machine.  It is extremely clean, inside and out.  In fact, it looks brand new.  After going through the Win 10 installation/registration  process, I was up and running.  It came with OpenOffice installed.  The supplied USB wifi adapter works fine.  It came with a keyboard and a wired optical mouse.  Both are usable, but cheap.  I expected as much, so that is no problem.  My son has a good keyboard and mouse he can use. This particular machine also came with two serial ports, and get this... one parallel printer port!  I have not seen a parallel printer port in many many years.  Most unusual.  I did not recognize the provided SSD manufacturer, but it seems to work fine.  Its speed tested reasonably fast.  Its reliability is yet to be determined.  In retrospect, maybe I should have bought the cheaper machine, and then upgraded to a SSD I have experience with.  Time will tell.  The mother board had two 4 Gig memory cards installed, leaving two empty slots.  I added two more 4 Gig cards for $32, bringing the total memory up to 16 Gig.  System recognized all the memory fine.  As a test, I installed Google Earth from the internet, and another application from the DVD player.  The machine is fast, and everything works great.  Again, I am very pleased with this machine.  My son should be as well.  He should get many years of service from this computer.  ...Merry Christmas.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviewDescription: I‚Äôve had no problems so far and imo Lenovo is a quality product that you can easily add extra memory to and speed the os up considerably. After I buy and add extra ddr3 sticks I expect to have a system that is dependable and fast as a computer that costs 4x as much. Prices on everything including ddr3 have gone up but it‚Äôs basically plug n play. I‚Äôm a senior citizen , not really tech savvy but I did this with a previous Lenovo desktop and was very satisfied. I lost it in a house fire.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviewDescription: If you need an inexpensive PC that can get you online and do some light multi-tasking, this one is great. Follow the setup-instructions and it gets Windows going no problem. It won't be running graphic heavy games or other super demanding programs, but it'll do fine for internet, zoom, discord, word processing, some minor image editing, etc. Very easy to open case which I appreciated. It has 4 slots for ram, of which 2 are occupied. I bought two more sticks of ram and a cheap video card to make it a bit faster and able to do dual monitors, which made this the perfect desktop for my needs. Ample USB ports make it easy to easy to plug in all peripherals without resorting to a USB hub. Wifi adapter included is trash, seriously not even worth the plastic so throw that away and research and by your own (there's room for a card if you want to upgrade), or just plug in a ethernet cable as there is a port for it, which is 100% better anyway.

reviewTitle: Great budget work and gaming PC!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
reviewDescription: The specs listed for this product are accurate and helped me to plan upgrades: I ended up buying a low profile 2GB DDR3 video card for $50, added a WiFi AC/N NIC for $30, and replaced two of the included DDR3 RAM sticks for two 8GB sticks (bringing the system to 20 GB of RAM). Next month I will replace the other 2GB sticks for 8GB sticks. For under $400 I was able to make this little desktop pack a small punch. The SSD makes starting up from a shutdown <4 seconds and the added video card and RAM has easily handled Minecraft, Rocket League, and a few other games I have thrown at it. I want to add a secondary SSD or HDD but space might be a factor‚Äîstill thinking through how to tackle this problem. Worst case I can pull the DVD drive and use that for storage space.Even without the upgrades the PC performed well and with Win 10 Pro includes it is a really hard price to beat.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
reviewDescription: I can't comment on the software it comes with as I have installed Linux on it but I have had no trouble out of the hardware.  SSD drive works great (I wish it were a little bigger but that's a small complaint) no fan failures, USB ports work even the old school optical drive works as it should.If you're looking for a gaming PC this obviously isn't it but it will preform all your daily activities with no issues. I still prefer a PC to a laptop as they burn out in a couple of years and I don't like surfing the net on a smartphone. This desktop does exactly what I need it to without issue and it boots up fast.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021
reviewDescription: I was pleasantly surprised to also have received a mouse and a keyboard. These items were not expected or listed. I have yet to connect all the parts and activate to insure the working condition but confident it will work as expected.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022

reviewDescription: So far this Lenovo M93 is running just fine. Been hosting Enterprise Zoom account meetings and everything has functioned just fine. reviewDescription: I have NEVER bought a new desktop; all of my previous new computers were laptops, mostly ACERS, but I did my research when it became clear to me that a desktop would be much better for my requirements, and settled on this one.It's been the smartest purchase I've ever made on Amazon!I LOVE the big screen, easy setup, the quality of the audio, the retractable webcam, etc.  However, the wired mouse and keyboard were kind of awkward, so I spent a few bucks and replaced them with a wireless combo, which has vastly improved the versatility of this computer. reviewTitle: Does not come with a cd/DVD drive
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 24, 2023
reviewDescription: This is a very good computer, I ordered it for a customer. It works well and it's very fast. The original computer listed windows 10 pro with a cd/DVD Drive. reviewTitle: Great value for the money, BUT return and reorder if any problems are detected, see below
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 10, 2020
reviewDescription: Intelligent choices made by Amazon in constructing a good general purpose PC. I suspect it is not optimal for gaming as you might have to change the power supply and video card, but for everything else, including SW development, it is excellent.I had problems with my unit and learned that when a PC is new and within the time window to return it, do not mess with Customer Service, return it and buy a new one.My NEW Envy was locking. (Had to do a hard reset to recover control.) I trusted HP was professional and had my interest at heart. I will NOT make that mistake again. They had me mail my PC to them. I expected a new motherboard or just a new PC. Instead they replaced the fan. This means that my NEW unit was stressed thermally with an unknown long term effect -- it might fail after the warranty period because of the stress.The whole process took about a month. (Diagnosis with a tech on-line, mail box here, mail PC there, wait, fix, mail PC back) only to find that the DVD drive door was broken. New claim (even though I emailed HP same day it was returned.) Then mail box here, mail PC there, Mail back fairly quickly this time. Now, here's the second rub. The original door had a small spring installed making it work nicely. This spring cannot be replaced manually, so it was mailed back with a new door, but no spring (takes automated machinery to insert that spring.)So I lost over a month of usage, HP did not even offer to extend the warranty to cover the down time. The unit was stressed thermally to an unknown effect. The door works, but not as nicely as the original.So am I pleased with HP? Furious is a better term. I own four HP PCs (can supply serial numbers on demand) and an HP Deskjet printer. Over the years I have owned many more HP PCs and printers. I like HP equipment. BUT I now recommend that if anything appears wrong within the 'return' period, return it immediately and buy another. You will have less down time, less fuss, and a better result.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 10, 2023
reviewDescription: I'm not sure why anyone would give this less than 5 stars. If you drop a better gaming card in it it would be a great gaming rig but it's fine just how it is. Boots in seconds and Windows 11 is better all around. It's actually way faster than my older i7 gaming computer cpu.Computers last about 6 to 8 years max. This was perfect. Very small footprint too in an ATX case. Simply amazing.

reviewTitle: Fast and great storage, but had to call customer service
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 28, 2021
reviewDescription: The PC is fast and works seamlessly now, but...out of the box it didn't start the Windows OS. Just got to the HP logo and then stayed with a dark display. After several tries on my own, I called Amazon's customer service and had to download a Microsoft file on my laptop and then, with a usb flash drive inserted on the new PC and restart, with no success. So the associate setup a call back to get me in touch with a HP technician the next day. The custumer experience was good (althought at times it was hard to understand the difficult accent from the associate, which I don't have a personal problem with it, but she needs to take a course in conversational English). The HP technician's resolved the problem fast. It turn out the PC only needed a "hard reset" and Windows came up and the usual initial setup for a new computer followed seamlessly. I read about the same problem in the reviews before I bought it, so I wasn't too worried, but this shouldn't happened. I have bought several computers for years, since PC started, and never had this problem, including with computer bought online. It wasn't damage. Maybe had to do with the mail handling or a shoddy work at the factory.The other thing is that the front usb plugs are a little off centered in the chassis or something like that because plugging any usb takes a bit of trying. Again, this shouldn't happen with a HP computer. Probably their selling it at a lower price due to these things. Anyway, the issues where resolved fairly quick and I got a high end desktop tower  for an affordable price, so I'm satisfied.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 11, 2021
reviewDescription: Having had the best luck with HP products over the years there was no question in my mind what brand I'd purchase when I decided to get a brand new desktop [I've been using primarily refurbs the last few years] .. and as expected, I'm glad that I stuck with HP. Out of the box this desktop has more than enough processing power for the average user, though I'm not sure that I'd recommend it for intense gaming as the power supply & graphics are a little on the weak side for that sort of thing. I do a lot of video editing and this system works well for what I do [primarily under 1 min videos] but anyone needing super high quality [professional] videos you'll want to go with the TE01-1020 model and upgrade the video card.The speed of this computer is quite fast, and doesn't skip a beat when the turbo processor kicks in [the base is2.9GHz] up to 4.8GHz ..ALSO [and this is very important if you're planning to switch to Windows 11], out of the box this model DOES meet the requirements for Windows 11 [I'm one of the beta testers] due to begin rolling out in early October 2021 ... and I'll also note that as well as this PC performs out of the box, the upgrades in W11 make this PC perform even better.Overall, this is a great computer for the average user. It's not loaded down with bloatware, HP support has an app preloaded that is actually very useful, and unwanted preinstalled apps are easily removed.Anyone shopping around for a new system at a reasonable price [especially for the purpose of running Windows 11] should definitely take a look at this one!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 18, 2023
reviewDescription: The computer seems to run fine but physically its not up to par. I noticed after I got all my programs reinstalled that the cheap plastic faceplate wasn't seating correctly causing the USB-C port to be almost impossible to use. I tried calling HP and also the Assurion contact on the extended warranty all either would do is say to send it back to Amazon and start over. It took days to get this setup correctly with all my programs etc.. I can't recommend this PC

reviewTitle: Almost Perfect, but Not for Upgraders
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 15, 2021
reviewDescription: While I've admittedly only had this up and running for 24 hours, I LOVE it! I have ran every single update required (HP and Windows) and installed quite a bit of software. I've loaded all of my software onto the SSD and my 377 GB of files onto the HDD. This PC is FAST FAST FAST!Today, I simultaneously ran Outlook (with 3 accounts), Excel, SQL Server Management Studio, a SQL Server Express instance, SQL Server Migration Assistant, 6+ Chrome tabs, a couple of MS Access databases, multiple File Explorer windows, Harvest, Word, Kaspersky, Notepad++, etc. and had ZERO issues... with one minor, but annoying, exception.As others have reported, you'll notice that devices connected via USB stop working periodically. In many cases (ex. when you're using a USB-connected wireless keyboard & mouse), this gives the appearance of the computer 'freezing up'. I'm not saying that this is what's happening to ALL of the users who are experiencing the 'freeze' issues, but it was 100% the cause of mine. Anyway, having experienced a similar issue with my HP laptop several years ago, I remembered finding that this is caused by a STUPID default setting. However, this problem can VERY EASILY be fixed and you'll experience the problem no more!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 3, 2020
reviewDescription: After setting up my sister's laptop with an SSD, I just couldn't go back to using an older desktop.  Going from pushing "on" to a desktop in 10 seconds?  Doing all of the windows updates it missed in 30 minutes, doing the latest 2 windows updates that took me 4 hours on my 5 year old desktop, took 10 minutes on this.  If you've never had a computer with an SSD, you'll be amazed.  When this arrived, there was one small problem.  After setting this up, I went to store some music and pictures and other data on the 1TB HDD.  The problem was the system did not recognize the HDD.  Thanks to the fine folks at Amazon, they sent me a hard drive to replace this one.  It's been a few years since I built my own computers, but the changes were manageable.  I could have bought this $100 cheaper from HP during their Black Friday Sale, but it was worth it to me to know when delivery would take place.  Nice to have the optical drive, but is not a very sturdy one.  Also nice to have a variety of ports to connect to. So far, I'm really happy with the purchase.

reviewTitle: Great performance, good price, be aware of BIOS update needed
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 14, 2021
reviewDescription: Purchased this desktop in August 2020 to replace an old HP desktop that was getting pretty slow.  The Win10 on SSD is lightning fast boot and app performance is great.  I really like that it came with Win10 Pro as I use Remote Desktop (requires Win10 Pro) all the time from my laptop when I'm not in my Den where the desktop is located, works slick.  I'm not interested in upgrading, so the lower end Power Supply is fine for what it comes with as purchased.My only complaint was after a couple months I started to experience lockup/freeze issues which worried me.  Finally in January 2021, the HP Support Assistant let me know about a important BIOS update, which reading further this BIOS update resolves Win10 freezes.  Since updating the BIOS over a month ago, I have not experienced a Win10 freeze or hangup since!  Kudo's to HP for following up and fixing this important freeze issue.  If others are experiencing this issue, the HP SoftPaq number for the BIOS update that fixed my issue is sp112332.So overall, great price, exceptional performance, just the one problem which HP fixed with BIOS update.

reviewTitle: A lot of bang for the buck.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 18, 2021
reviewDescription: The HP Envy Te01-1022 arrived on my doorstep about a week ago.Took it out of the box, plugged it all in and pressed the power button.Beep-Beep-Beep (repeatedly) with a blank monitor. Turned it off, checked the installation. and turned it back on. Same beeping pattern with a blank monitor.Those out there who are computer savvy are probably saying, "It's a bad RAM stick, or one (or both) of the RAM sticks need to be reseated." You are absolutely correct.Before I endured the hassle and returned this computer, both 8 Gig RAM sticks were removed and carefully reseated.  The computer booted right up and has worked perfectly ever since.I was immediately thoroughly impressed with this machine.  Super fast and completely silent.My previous computer, also an HP (Pavillion), which I purchased in 2011 and still runs great, came with Windows 7, so getting acquainted with Windows 10 Pro took me a day or so (hey, what can I say - I'm an old guy), but I am fully up to speed with Windows 10 Pro at this point.I am not a hard core gamer so this computer more than serves my needs quite well. However, it's my guess that this computer would handle most games quite well.Would I recommend the HP Envy TE01-1022 to others ? Absolutely.

reviewTitle: Performs well as a home theater PC
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2023
reviewDescription: I‚Äôm using this mini PC primarily as a home theater computer with occasional web browsing to stream content.Setup - The onboarding process took under 5 mins and was quick to setup, get online and start using it. Graphics - Since I‚Äôm using this as a htpc, it was important that the on-board video card supported true 4k at 4,096 x 2,160 pixels vs only UHD compatibility.Storage - On initial boot, the SSD has 439GB free based on the pre-formatting and having the Windows 11 Pro OS installed.Function - I plan on connecting this to my media server.  As a result, I have this set to hibernate/sleep when not being used.  The wake-up function is responsive and quick, so there was no lag whenever I try to boot up and access the machine.Design - The case is sleek and complements my TV with a similar shade along with the blue lighting around the frame isn‚Äôt overpowering.Overall, if you‚Äôre in the market for a budget mini pc, these specs and performance should be a good fit for a home theater PC.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviewDescription: I was skeptical at first when my friend recommended this to me. My Mac finally died after 13 years of use and while I do most things on my iPad I do occasionally need an actual computer. For the price I was not expecting much. But I was surprised how well it performs. I hooked it up to my big screen tv with ease. I then was able to connect it remotely to my Oculus vr headset. It works perfectly for me as a virtual office. I can open multiple programs and use side by side screens in VR. This tiny computer is a real powerhouse for its size. They only down side is I have to use Windows again. Apple has spoiled me for so long that I had forgotten how frustrating Microsoft‚Äôs interfaces can be. Still a Mac guy thru and thru but for this prices I‚Äôll gladly suffer with Windows.

reviewDescription: Does everything I need it to do. Compact. Very pleased.

reviewTitle: Great performance in a small package
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
reviewDescription: Great product and outstanding performance for a major bargain - will be purchasing a 2nd one real soon

reviewTitle: Extremely budget friendly choice for a home user
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviewDescription: Let's make this straight, a Celeron PC can never handle serious gaming so if you are looking for such experience, this is not the one. reviewTitle: Great Starter PC - for work and gaming!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
reviewDescription: If you‚Äôre researching and scouring the internet for advice on what starter PC you should invest in, you‚Äôve found the review you need. I spent months looking for a decent starter PC which would allow me to play all my games and  store my content effectively while maintaining speed and quality.  I wanted something that was visually appealing and functional. Personally, I‚Äôm a broke college kid who needed an outlet to balance school and fun. I wasn‚Äôt sure where to begin my search, and had no idea what requirements and features were required to have an effective and quality PC.  In this review, I‚Äôm putting you in the same position as me when I started looking through the PC marketplace. When beginning the search for your first PC, the search can be incredibly overwhelming and daunting. However, you are doing an amazing job searching if the internet miraculously placed you with this item.Let‚Äôs break down the features of the PC. This computer is a pre-built, which means there is no assembly required on your part. There‚Äôs a plethora of components that make a PC worth buying, and I‚Äôm going to break down the specifics of each component and how they correlate to the performance and quality of your gaming. The primary function of any PC is the central processing unit (CPU). The CPU, also known as the processor, is responsible for executing and refining the power of the computer and directly affects how fast your computer, or computer games, run. The CPU also processes the inputs from the user. The CPU included in this pre-built is an AMD Ryzen 5 3600 3rd Generation. Another important factor in the PC is the RAM. RAM stands for random access memory. The purpose of RAM is to store short term data and allow the computer to process applications properly. RAM‚Äôs data is temporarily stored while applications are currently operating, like having a game playing. This PC includes an 8 GB card, which means if your game requires around 8 GB of RAM, your game will function and run properly. If you‚Äôre not sure about a game‚Äôs required RAM, the developers include those requirements in the breakdown and analytics of each game. The RAM only holds the contents of the game for the duration you are playing. Once the application is shut off, the RAM is no longer active.While RAM is temporary storage, the hard drive processor is not. The hard drive is responsible for keeping your saved digital storage. For example, the space required for saving your game or Microsoft Office software. The hard drive also stores pictures, videos, and the applications you have downloaded on your PC. Hard drives can be external or internal, which means saving data to an external memory device or to the PC itself, and the contents can be deleted or cleared once you no longer need them. The hard drive included in this pre-built is a 500 GB SSD card.You can store up to 500 gigabytes of content as soon as you start up the PC.  While those features are required for every PC, even for basic processes and storage, this review will highlight the rest of the features through a gaming perspective since this is a gaming PC. The graphics card is responsible for rendering the images and content in a game and running them effectively. It renders the movements, animations, inputs, and images that are in a game through a series of fast acting calculations completed internally in the PC. The graphics card included in this PC is a GeForce GTX 1660 Ti 6G GDDR5, which holds 6 GB of RAM.If you are a little confused about whether or not your graphics card is going to make or break your gaming experience, multiple YouTube creators offer a compilation of benchmark videos with clips and segments from video games with demanding animation and experiences. The benchmark videos include multiple different video games from varying genres that allow gamers to evaluate how well the game is running and performing according to the graphics card.  In regard to usability and functionality of the PC, the developers include a detailed pamphlet that illustrates how to properly connect your PC to a monitor, how to enable your microphone and speakers, and the purpose of each feature throughout the PC. The PC does require a three-prong plug, and I recommend plugging the cord into a direct power source, like a wall outlet, instead of a surge protector or extension cord.When plugging in a monitor, there are two different HDMI ports on the back of the PC for up to 2 different monitors to be used simultaneously. Computer speakers should have a USB port to plug into the back of the PC, and headsets unfortunately require a splitter to listen to music and use a microphone concurrently. Splitters are cords that connect to the aux section of your headphone cord, and it divides this cord into two auxiliaries that can be plugged into two corresponding holes. The PC permits one USB powered keyboard and one USB mouse. These assets are included in the Amazon listing.This PC in particular is incredibly visually appealing.  It features a white tower, which is the casing around all the important parts of the PC, with a tempered glass window on the side to look into the tower. It also has multiple RGB lights and various functions. There are seven varying lighting functions to encourage individuality and styles. Located around the lighting fixtures are three fans to cool the system down. The fans blend in with the circular lighting fixtures. The PC is very cohesive in design, and incorporates each feature into the overall aesthetic of the computer. Overall, I believe this PC is a quality starter PC within its budget of $1200. It strives in multi-tasking, allowing the user to edit documents while having a YouTube video or music running in the background. I have been using this system for school and gaming for around eight months, and have had no issues with it. I give it an A for price point, functionality, and visual appeal. I believe this is an ideal PC for a casual gamer who wants something to balance work and entertainment with.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought the SkyTech Nubula yesterday from Amazon, which arrived around noon today. It was packaged in a large amazon box, and inside was the machine's box.  No chips or dings on the boxes or the machine. I disconnected my Lenovo ThinkCentre and hooked this new Nebula. I had an issue when setting it up; I could not get the monitor to work!  I called customer service and got right through to a technician.  The graphics card was covered with plastic plugs, so I did not see the HMDI socket. There was an HMDI slot above the graphics card, but that needed to be corrected.  Got it up and running, and it looks really kewal with all the blue lights. It's a very quiet running machine. The fans make a low humming sound I can barely hear.  I'm pleased with my purchase as well as with customer support!

reviewTitle: Superb Value and a Solid Gaming Machine
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
reviewDescription: So this is the second SkyTech PC I have bought and once again it was generally due to the fact that pricing parts to build my own was a bit difficult (COVID-19 has made GPU's scarce and pricey).  My first PC is over 2 years old at this point and I was looking to actually just upgrade it's GPU but everything I was looking for was out of stock or outrageously priced (at the time a 1660 Super was running near $400).  So settled on this machine, it had many of the parts I was looking to get myself: AMD 5 3600, 16GB RAM, GTX 1660 Super, B450 Motherboard (though I had looked at B550).I am not disappointed.  The machine is wonderful and came delivered without single flaw.  It booted on the first try and immediately went into Windows all the RGB elements performed perfectly.  I ran a series of tests after it finished setting up windows and was pleased to see that the SSD was not a total disgrace as some had stated before, getting about 530 MB/s sequential read times at 1Gib and 514 MB/s Write.  That's not blazing fast, but it was better than I expected after reading reviews.  I received an ADATA SU720 500GB model drive in my build and these Read/Write times are right on par with the stated performance for that drive, so I have no complaints.  I dropped a NVMe drive in right away as well as a smaller 256GB solid state drive for games and other files.  Storage was my only real concern with the build, but adding storage is not an issue (though it is a bit hard to get power cables up from the power supply, the cords are all quite well bundled and I had to cut a zip tie to get a free power cable for my SSD).  Unlike the pictured model my build came with a B450M/AC so it had the Wi-Fi built in to the motherboard, rather than in a PCI slot.  This was a pleasant surprise and also meant the motherboard had 4DIMM slots instead of 2 (like I saw some people received in their builds).  The RAM I got was OLOY Brand, which is actually Chun Well Technologies and it was just standard RAM, no heat spreaders or anything fancy, but it was strong memory, running 16-18-18-36 at 1.3v with a clock speed of 100Mhz at a 15x multiplier, giving you 1500Mhz DDR, so in total it matches the 3000Mhz advertised.  I am unsure what brand GPU I got, but I suspect by the I/O panel (DVI, HDMI, DisplayPort) it is an MSI Brand.  Its a single fan, compact unit and I am quite happy with it, though I would have preferred a model without DVI and instead a second DisplayPort or HDMI port.  In all I am very pleased with this machine, the quality, the build, the parts, and performance are all above what I anticipated and as a Cyber Monday deal for $200 off list it was pretty much a bargain.Edit:  so Cyberpunk 2077 has dropped and despite the poor reception I had it running at a smooth 60fps @1080p on this machine.  I am not a crazy hardcore gamer looking for 4k and Ray Tracing, I was quite happy that my new PC ran the game with no hardware related problems and a strong graphical performance.

reviewDescription: I recently upgraded from a super cheap asus that had a UHD 630 to this beastie. I love her. I'm low key getting a headache from the difference in quality. reviewTitle: Decent PC at an ok price.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021
reviewDescription: Came packaged well and setup was easy. All of the boot discs came with it. Basically hook it up and start it up and it's ready. The mid tower chassis has room to customize and add different things if you would like. The PC comes with 4 fans 3 RGB and 1 3pin fan. 3 fans are set to exhaust and the 1 3pin is set as intake. That was one of my issues right there. The three exhausts moved air fine. The one intake being on the front of the case which also doesnt let much air move because it's a slim vent on the side of the case caused the air to be very extremely negative and had air pulling into the case from every crevice. In the end I had to add 2 more fans to the front of the case. Even now the air is still slightly negative due to case design. Another issue I have with this PC is that the 3 RGB fans that come with it are rigged to the led bar that is on the front of the case. They are powered by a sata 3 adapter (molex) but the interesting thing is they run off a 4pin rgb cable that's daisy chained from all 3 fans and the led strip, there isnt a fan cable, I guess they are 2 pin fans  rigged to run off the power supply? I havent tried hooking anything daisy chained to the open connector to see if that theory was correct. With this setup though it leaves most of your rgb headers empty. The problem is you cant sync to those fans, havent tried hooking them to one of the headers because I have no clue how many amps they pull since the fans are hooked into that connector also. Another thing with the fan setup was the dual fans on the GPU would start to spin up faster and the case would get loud from those to fans. Since I added the new fans this hasnt been an issue. So with 2 more fans it actually run more quiet overall. That's why I dropped it to 4 stars. Now to why it goes down to 3 stars. The motherboard comes with built in wifi. You are supposed to get 2 antenna with the PC. Mine came with only one. So I got into chat with skytech, friendly customer service guy told me he would ship one right out to me with an email confirmation. Well, its 2 months later and I'm still waiting for either thing. Hopefully if something else goes wrong I dont have that issue. Computer runs really good at 1080p on high setting on demanding games. 1440p on higher demanding games it starts to lose frames and gets sluggish, less demanding games I was able to run 4k fine. So this machine isnt going to be an ultra setting machine unless your playing something older. Overall it was cheaper to buy this (it was on sale at the time) than to build something similar since PC parts are crazy priced right now. With it not being on sale you could build it for around $800 if dig for the parts. I got it cheaper than that. If you dont dig for the parts this build could cost around $1200. It took 2 months but changed to 4 stars since they finally sent me my antenna.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
reviewDescription: TLDR: Highly recommended for anyone who wants to play current gen games at 1080p. Great value and decent parts!Its been 84 years since I last set foot... well it feels that long since I was last in the market for a new gaming rig. I'm upgrading from a 9 year old Cyberpowerpc-amd phenom-gtx960 build (RIP). Long overdue for an upgrade.I didn't recognize the Skytech brand so I looked at some amazon reviews, their website, and the Better Business Bureau. Come to find out they are new  company (1yr old) and not accredited at the BBB. So, I read some more reviews at the BBB site. Most of the negative reviews were people that were impatient waiting for tech support or frustrated with the rma process and bummed about having a brick. One thing that I noticed was that all of the complaints lodged against them (there were 3) were resolved.I decided to take a chance on them. The package came 1 day ahead of schedule which was nice. But, when I saw the condition of the packaging I was concerned. It looked like Wolverine had slashed the top of the box (check out the pic). When I opened the package everything seemed well placed and secured.The first thing I noticed on this machine was the side tempered glass panel. It works on a hinge and magnet system which is super convenient and easy to access. Once I unpacked everything and took out the expanding foam that wraps the components (carefully), I checked all of the power and data connections. Everything was plugged in and snug but i noticed that the cable management was very tight, especially under the shroud where the power supply is. There is a 3.5 in HDD bay down there that is going to be difficult to access because it's partially blocked by the cables. Other than that the cable management is clean enough. The keyboard and mouse were umm... usable... Ive definitely had worse.I checked all of the components to make sure my device matched my product description, everything seemed good. I was a little worried because the video card looked smaller than I expected. Turns out that it is a PNY single fan card, smaller than most 1660 Supers but seems to be up to par.Next I crossed my fingers and hit the power button. First there were lights... beautiful RGB goodness coming from 3 case fans and the front panel. Next, the ASRock boot screen (Almost there). Finally the Windows setup screen and a sigh of relief. Windows setup went well, no issues. Startup after initial setup takes less than 20 seconds.I ran NZXT Cam software to get some info on the components and monitor cpu/gpu loads and temps. Idle temps are normal and the case seems to have good airflow.I can play RDR2 at 1080p at a solid 60fps with mostly high/ultra settings, I had to lower the water quality and reflections to keep above 60 frames. Other games that I tried out were COD Warzone, Doom Eternal, Borderlands 3, R6, Fortnite, DBD, CSGO and others. It ran all of them at med-high settings.I'm very happy with my purchase and would highly recommend Skytech Gaming.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
reviewDescription: Product arrived in pristine condition and delivered on time.For context, I am not a gamer. I purchased this machine for video editing. So my rating on the 'gaming' stars is to be taken with a grain of salt. However, judging it by the way it handles video editing...I'm sure it's solid.Though my old machines were working well, Adobe has designed their latest software to only work well with upgraded hardware. I was behind the curve with 4th and 5th gen intel processors. I have only had some working experience with AMD. But this Ryzen 5 3600 is amazing!After I went through the process of setting it up, I immediately ran a test with the current documentary I am working on. Previous to this machine, I tried several times to render 2, 4 hour interviews with timecode burned in to hand off to the producer. Each time it clocked at 12-16 hours and would either crash or fail at 99%. Frustrated to no end and wasting literal DAYS trying to render, I purchased this bad mF'er. My first test...rendered the first 4 hour interview in under an hour!!!!! (HD video). Immediately, I knew I made the correct choice. I have not tried to tax it yet with 4K video but I'm guessing it will handle it well.Why only 4 stars? Well, as some have pointed out (and I knew this going in), the wifi is pretty weak. I had to move it really close to my router (which is not near my office) in order to run updates and install the programs I needed. Also, the sound isn't good at all. Fortunately, I have an external USB Behringer sound box. Once I hooked that up, the sound was good to go!I have no issues with the supplied mouse and keyboard with the exception of a short cable on the mouse. I am unable to feed the mouse to the back of the box as a righthander and have enough wiggle room with my desk set up. An extender will fix this.It would be great if there was more than one extra PCI connection on the motherboard since the video card takes up so much room. This will limit putting in an internal sound card, a better wifi card and an external sata  card that I use to dock drives. Again, I knew this when buying. So it's more of me not taking the time to really look.  I was also unaware (on my part) that there was no space in the case for a DVD burner. Not a big deal for today's standards but I still have to occasionally burn DVD's for clients. An external will fix this.I was able to add an internal 7200 drive for storage with ease and I will soon be adding a few SSD's easily for the storage I need for editing.Overall, I am impressed. Skytech did a great job putting this thing together and though it is not a performance deal, I do love the LED lights and changing colors. Makes this thing look like a work of art! Beyond my minor complaints (all of which, I knew going in) I would totally go back to Skytech for a future upgrade. But I think I'm going to be good for a while.

reviewTitle: Clean, Quiet and Powerful PC for the Price
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
reviewDescription: Day 3 Review, 4.5/5 StarsThis Skytech PC shipped very quickly, is very clean, and arrived with all advertised components.  Having done some comparative shopping, I settled on this model, and after the first few days of using it, I am completely satisfied, with just a couple of things to be aware of, mentioned below.Pros:* Very tight and clean build, with a lot internal case space to spare.* Shipped very quickly, using Amazon Prime's free shipping.* Competitive pricing for the included parts - RAM, SSD, Motherboard and Graphics Card.* More than capable of handling any of today's games, or multi-tasking for business.* Comes with LED gaming keyboard and mouse.* LEDs are synced between the case fans (which you can see through the clear glass side panel), and the front panel of the case.  A button on the case lets you cycle between colors (or turn them off).Cons:* The included motherboard is small.  There are 2 RAM slots, and if you use the included WiFi card, there are no additional slots for more PCIe components.  To upgrade the RAM, you will have to replace an existing card, rather than just adding to what is already included.* In my build, the graphics card and WiFi cards are so close together, that when I first turn on the PC, there is a rattle sound, as the graphics cards' fan vibration makes the card tap against the WiFi card.  In my case, this goes away after settling for a few seconds, and the PC is very quiet afterward.* If you want to install a disk drive (not SSD), you will have to do some digging.  There is not an available mount directly inside the case.The parts are essentially of the 2019 generation.  You may be able to find another model with a graphics card that is newer.  However, at the time of this writing, I was unable to find a better overall purchase for the price on Amazon or any other site, and I believe this is and will be fully capable of playing any games released for several years to come.

reviewTitle: Broken and horribly inspected (UPDATE: FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE!!)
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020
reviewDescription: Original review when I left One star : The worst product I have ever gotten. The first time I loaded it up I was shocked that it had none of the essential drivers installed on it. I couldn‚Äôt open a single game in Steam because of it. After installing everything, it still didn‚Äôt work. I restarted my PC and it was stuck on the loading screen for an hour so I decided to completely wipe it out and start fresh. It was working perfectly for a few hours and had everything installed once I hard reset it (I have no idea how). I was happy I fixed the problem and I shut it down to go to bed. I woke up a few hours later and the computer is bricked now and won‚Äôt even load up. Pressing F10 and trying to repair it comes up with ‚Äúfailed to repair‚Äù. Not to mention SkyTech isn‚Äôt taking any calls right now due to the virus. I waited two weeks for the computer to be delivered and sending it back will take even longer to get a new one and at this point I don‚Äôt want to take another computer from SkyTech. This is a horrible product. How it passed inspection, I have no idea.Updated Review : It turns out I had a bad SSD! I don't think that was a fault of Skytech's but none-the-less, it was broken and corrupted. I still think it was not put through the proper stress tests or driver inspection, BUT the way Skytech handled the situation has me changing my review from One star to FOUR. If I had received the proper SSD the first time I would be leaving five stars for sure, but after everything I went through with having to reinstall Windows 10 on a USB to my old SSD and having to reset it three times and the frustration, is why I'm taking off a star.SKYTECH HAS AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I could not contact anyone because their offices are closed due to COVID-19 so I reached out through Instagram of all places. I spoke with one of the representatives who was extremely apologetic and swore it was a busted SSD. She sent me another SSD free of charge one-day shipping and I installed it myself (it was very easy to do). It's been three days and ALL IS WELL, knock on wood, the machine is running like the machine I should have gotten the first time. AMAZINGLY. I recommend this company and this computer to anyone. I can record and stream 1080 60fps on Ultra settings! I'm very pleased with my purchase!!

reviewDescription: The trend toward compact computer systems led me to this one from MicroDeal after my elderly tower computer motherboard failed. I was fascinated with the small size yet fully functional features of this system that was also fully serviceable for drives, memory, and a few other components. And I am not disappointed in the least. This is a ninth generation Intel product that is quite snappy, and the purchase of a refurbished product means considerable cost savings. The included SSD (NVMe by ADATA) had Windows 11 pre-installed, so I configured it even though I don't use Windows other than to see what Microsoft is up to. Instead, I use my own 2.5" SSDs and HDDs to play with linux distributions (Fedora, Ubuntu, Manjaro, MX), which are entirely supported on this hardware. I am pleased with this little machine and highly recommend it.

reviewDescription: So far this new all in one is performing perfectly.  The keyboard is not up to my standards but will work until  I can find a backlit keyboard with more old time tactile keys.
