reviewTitle: DELL SKIMPING ON THE EXTRA THAT WERE ONCE STANDARD EQUIPMENT.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
reviewDescription: Over all it's a decent XPS computer, but it lacked in a couple of areas for me. I needed a much larger HDD just to find out I need to order a SATA data cable  and screws to mount the HDD - oh they have the SATA power cable by the mount there but no data cable, bracket or screws to add one so why one cable and not the other? Dell use to have both in the case and some extras like a mounting bracket, but not no more, probably saves them about 25 cents per computer. So off to order those. Then I needed to expand the number of USB ports for my needs just to find out that now I needed a longer SATA power cable as the supplied cable (that has been long enough for every Optiplex I've set up) was too short for the XPS a much more expensive computer. So off to get one of those .... huff! So anything you plan on adding to this computer internally plan on buying ALL the bits and pieces you need as all those thing that use to be pretty much standard inside the case is not anymore. Assume you'll need to supply everything.BTW not impressed with Windows 11 Pro, it takes it longer to "wake up" from sleep mode fresh out of the box than a poorly maintained 6 year old copy of Windows 10 Pro that's rarely shut down or updated. Might have to wipe it and go back to 10 pro ... oh and they dump a copy of Mcafee on you even if you opt not to have it installed it will be.Set up was easy, cable management was good (since there wasn't any extra it should be) very quiet (Liquid cooled) and decent Seagate Cuda HDD, nothing special on the RAM but I upgraded that to 64gb in a better brand anyway. Worth what I paid but I see it's about $500 higher now less than a month later.Stop skimping Dell on extra cables and screws they don't cost that much and for the price of this machine they should be included.

reviewTitle: limited upgrade ability, and worse than useless tech support.  SUPPORT IS A HORROR SHOW!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
reviewDescription: Tech support is worse than useless!  Turns out this unit can't handle more than a 2TB hard drive in each of the 2 slots, which nobody mentioned.  On-line documentation is terrible, and tech support, while they pick up quickly, is worse.  Just trying to tell which of the USB slots are type 3.2 and which are 2.0 took more than a half hour on each of two phone calls.  The agents kept saying "yes" to just about anything, but even with the diagram (which I pulled up while talking) the agents were unable to differentiate between "the sockets next to the ethernet port" and "the sockets above the ethernet port" to tell me which was which.  After I got the unit, I decided to increase storage capacity. They said all cables were included.  Dell charges twice the price for the same hard drive from Amazon, so I got the drive.  And purchased the "drive caddy" from Dell.  Turns out, the cables were NOT included as Dell tech support said.  Anyway, machine is working, after many hours on tech support.  The audio sockets I had to figure out by trial and error (icons indecipherable).  But due to limited upgrade ability, I've relegated it to secondary status at the office.  I will never again purchase a Dell product.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 8, 2021
reviewDescription: Spent the better part of three weeks trying to figure out why this PC randomly would freeze up forcing a necessary hard reboot. Turns out the "HP Recommended" Power plan was the default setting.  I changed this to "High Performance" and modified a couple WHAT POWER BUTTONS DO plan settings (i.e. turned OFF Fast Start Up & Sleep in the SHUTDOWN SETTINGS section.  Do this by UNCHECKING them.)  I also deleted all temp & prefetch files.  (To do this, in the "Type here to search" box type %temp%.  Hit enter.  Now select all files & delete them.  Then type "prefetch" (without the quotes).  Hit enter twice.  Select all the files and delete them.  Reboot.  And you should be good to go.  My PC has not frozen even once in over 10 days now!  NOTE:  Its probably a good thing to delete temp and prefetch files on a regular basis to keep things running fast & smooth!  Good Luck & Enjoy!

reviewTitle: Not sure about the on button, but nice computer
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 10, 2021
reviewDescription: I purchased to replace a used i7 second gen I was working on with a noisy graphics card fan.  The add'l  RAM and newer USB version make for quicker data transfer and generally faster performance.I had to replace a smart power strip due to the lower power consumption.  This strip would turn off power to all peripherals when the computer turned off - monitor, speakers, etc. which did not need to be on after the computer is off.  But this computer powers down slightly after it is on and it tricked the smart power strip into thinking the computer turned off and the monitor and speakers would turn off.  I replace that strip with a newer "adjustable" strip that can be tweaked for the lower power use. (purchased on Amazon as well)The Bluetooth and WiFi were not a must, but some day I might need them and it is nice to have then and not install an after market board.Overall I am happy with the computer

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 26, 2020
reviewDescription: I purchased this because my seven year old Dell was beginning to show signs of end of life.  The HP Envy fit the bill in every respect and the price was excellent for the features it had.  I ran into problems copying my old PC to the HP and had to sent the HP back to have it reimaged.  HP did not include a recovery CD/DVD/anything and I started getting blue screens when booting it up.  I had to send it back to HP Tech Support for it to be reimaged.  HP Tech support wanted $70 for a recovery thumb drive.  Otherwise, I really like the machine and HP Support was the best.  I would recommend the machine to anyone looking for a compact, fast PC and I also recommend that you create a recovery drive as soon as you start using it.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 13, 2021
reviewDescription: Seeing how may last desktop was a 3rd generation I3 you can tell where I'm going with this review. This new computer is very fast. I love that it has both SSD Storage and a Standard Hard Drive together. I can keep the OS on the SSD where it is uncluttered and won't be competing with other files. All my files are now on the separate drive. I didn't give high or low marks for Tech Support because I haven't had to contact them. Everything set up flawlessly. The one thing I do have a problem with is the added software that is included. It's all fee based for Cloud Storage, Data Transfer, Anti Virus and so on. It can become pretty annoying. The preinstalled 1T disk drive has all the storage I need. I'm not much in to gaming. I mostly use the computer for Photo and Video storage and editing. Bit of an over kill for what I use it for but I love this machine.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 9, 2022
reviewDescription: Lightning fast. Solid state hard drive startup means no waiting for it to open up. Really was hesitant about video on motherboard. However it pumps full HD to one 60"tv and wireless full HD to another 55" tv without lag or issues. Don't game with it but can't believe it would not easily handle video demand. Zero documentation except thru online HP. Excellent  value for the dollar. Seen thousands of dollars spent on machines that aren't even close.

reviewTitle: Don't look for real help from HP
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 29, 2021
reviewDescription: I bought this computer because the ad said it could handle multiple monitors. There's only 1 HDMI. There is a USB which I suppose should do it, but good luck finding an adapter that works. It has been freezing and I haven't been able to get much help from HP on that, but a customer left a review with a solution that I hope will work. (Thanks!)  It appears it's because of a default setting. That shouldn't be something you have to spend time on. I'm griping a lot, but it is a pretty good pc for home office use, etc... I'm not a gamer so I can't speak to that. It just seems like there is a wall between the customer and real service at HP. On their chat system, one of the phone bank people asked me if I was still having the freezing problem before offering any solutions. I guess they thought I was just some lonely guy who calls call centers looking for someone to talk to. Of course, I still had the problem. So, as a piece of hardware, sure. But don't expect much help if something isn't working right or you need to figure out how to add monitors. You're pretty much on your own.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 17, 2021
reviewDescription: I had a 3rd generation i7 with 64gb of memory. This computer puts that one to shame! I installed a video card and a 1.5TB additional hard drive. Installing the hard drive was tricky since they included a very SHORT sata power cable for the drives. I took the video card out of my old computer and installed it in the new one. It's a GeForce GT640. Nothing spectacular but it's an upgrade from the built on video card. My only complaint about it, is the fact that it only has 2 memory slots. I knew that when I bought it, but you would think that they would have chosen a motherboard with 4 slots. It takes less than 30 seconds to boot it up and has more than enough USB connections. It's hard to find a computer right now, and I'm glad that I chose this one.

reviewDescription: I got this as a refurbished item so I saved a bit of money. This computer comes with a SSD and 1TB hard drive. The bonehead who did the refurbish installed the operating system to the 1TB drive and the SSD as the D: drive. I had to spend a few hours Saturday morning setting it up properly, but after that it has worked great. I ordered a new graphics card for it for better performance in that area. I would recommend the computer for anyone doing work not requiring a good graphics cards.

reviewDescription: I've always owned either a desktop or laptop computer - until now. This all-in-one computer is beautiful. I hardly ever transported my laptop anywhere - usually just used in on my computer table at home. So the fact this wouldn't be easy to lug around is no problem.I purchased this 27-inch screen and I LOVE it! You Tube videos are fantastic to watch on this big screen, as well as movies on Amazon Prime or Netflix. The screen is crystal sharp! Another thing that I love: the VOLUME that comes out of this unit is top notch. In the past, all my laptops's volumes were not enough sometimes to hear videos (esp many YouTube videos). I'd have to use external speakers or plug in a headphone to hear what was being said. NOW, I often turn the volume DOWN, and never have to put it at max volume like I did with other computers. Finally!This model is not a touch-screen. I didn't want one. I prefer to use a keyboard and mouse. The camera on top of the screen works very nice. The only issue there is I can't tilt it very much up and down (I'd probably have to get a separate camera if I find I need to move it around often). But you can move the screen side to side easily. The screen is sturdy and a bit heavy (but not unbearably so), but I'm not lifting it around anyways.So, if you need a new laptop for travel, this is not the product for you. It's not really portable and the screen is certainly too big for that. But if you're looking at getting a unit to be put in place and stay there, this computer is excellent. No issues so far at all with it. Plenty of memory, easy to operate, beautiful sharp clear images. excellent speakers. I paid more for the big screen, but I'm so happy I did. All-in-One computers are the way to go for me!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 22, 2022
reviewDescription: It's like I am seating in the pilot seat of a plane..wide viewüòÇThe quick swap between applications and seamlessly of it all.BUT!The solicitation of application purchases popping up every 30mins from Microsoft windows is a joy kill. Seriously!Camera quality isn't great (but I don't use it for that)It isn't touch screen, I kinda wish I bought the one that is though.The screen quality is amazeballs!!!!Overall 4/5...good value for money.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviewDescription: I have never updated a review. I want to in this case. This PC is awesome. I left a negative review. I want to change my review. I wish to state I I copied my first review and plan to paste it in at the end of this updated review. I no longer place blame on jack's shop or Minisforum. I now have had 3 PC's that failed because of Windows 11 updates. In each of those incidents this same thing occurred. As most of you know when installing a Windows update restarting the PC is part of the installation. My 3 PC's that got messed up all did the same thing. Windows update appeared to be installing normally during the shutting down phase. However, during the starting back up phase all I got was a black screen. So I now blame Microsoft. I read news yesterday. Many others besides myself has had the same thing happen. My advice is to use Windows 10 until this issue is resolved. Also many people have successfully installed this update I don't know how a person is to know in advance if their PC will install the update successfully. I do know nobody wants to deal with this. This was my original review: I connected it and used it for awhile (2 weeks) a short while then I was told Windows had an update. I thought sure update windows. The PC has never booted since. Before that update I used this PC and was so happy with it. When that update occurred I contacted Minisforum. They replied that I failed to update the BIOS. They were saying in a nutshell that it was my fault for not updating the BIOS. I had it only 2 weeks. I have updated a BIOS before. Straight out of the box it needs a BIOS update or it will crash because of Windows update. Really how was I to know it needed to have a BIOS update or Windows update will crash it. When it worked it was totally awesome. I am posting this to inform new buyers, the very first thing they should do is find out if they need to update the BIOS or they may have the same thing happen them. They sold me a Windows PC with a BIOS that can't handle a windows update. Then said it was my fault for not updating the BIOS. It wasn't my fault like they (Minisforum) says they sold me a new PC with a flawed BIOS. They didn't want to backup their product so they blamed me.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviewDescription: It features the Ryzen 7 5800H processor, 8 cores, 16 threads, AMD Radeon graphics, a 100w charger, and all the features I wanted for a mini pc including Wi-Fi 6, 2.5g ethernet, and Four different methods to output a display 2 via HDMI and two via USB C.Commonplace items like an instruction handbook that illustrates the various application cases, a vertical stand, as well as a USBC cable that can be utilized with a monitor with downstream capabilities when it comes to power and 1080P video with a single connection. I also like that they put additional rubber feet because I do need to remove them in order to remove the cover. Additionally, a 2.5 inch drive connection is present. The other thing provided is a VESA mount to connect this to the back of a display. And I'm really pleased with how little this thing is, because it makes the entire device more portable. In terms of the IO, we have the power button, reset CMOS button, microphone slash, headphone Jack, to fully functional USB C ports, and the video capable USBC port on the right. To keep the UM580 cool, it also includes a ton of various air vents located all around the unit.The alt mode USB C port, which is first and foremost on the left,can be used  one of two ways. One is simply plug it into the power brick. However, even though the power brick may have multiple ports, I would only use one and avoid plugging anything else at the same time to ensure that the main unit will receive constant power. If the monitor is capable of operating in Alt mode it can connect with just one cord. The monitor will power the mini PC and the mini PC will supply the video to the monitor. Unfortunately my monitor is not able to operate in Alt mode so I can't really comment on that. Monitors can provide 100 watts of power that this PC requires most of the times. These monitors will only provide 65 watts. More information regarding the back IO. Is that it includes a 2.5 Gigabit Ethernet connector, USB 3.2 Gen, 2 port, two HDMI outputs that can both produce 4K at 60 frames, and two USB 2.0 ports.I think that because it is mostly black, it blends into the background and also runs quite silently. I really enjoy the way it looks. I believe it would blend in well at the back of the monitor. For other specs, it features a Ryzen 7. 5800 H processor, 32 gigs of RAM, and 512 gigabytes with Windows 11 Pro installed. Therefore, this device will be excellent for 1080P video editing and perhaps some light 4K editing as well. In all honesty, I was hoping that this device would be great for media video editing, video encoding and video playback and I'm glad that delivered.In conclusion, I appreciate the genuine mini PC, small size, the fact that it  Has a little power brick and the ability to operate in alternate modes. These features make the mini PC, which is  already small, much more portable because I don't have to carry along the bulkier power supply.I like that the device can be upgraded on all fronts and that there is room for a 2.5 inch disc as well. This had dang good PC gaming performance, I wouldn't call it a gaming PC, but gosh, it can play a lot of games. I believe that emulation is where it really exceeds. This device outperformed every other category in its weight class when it came to emulation, and I was really impressed with how well it handled GameCube at high resolution.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviewDescription: Very nice PC.  These mini PCs are the wave of the future.  Plays 4K movies on file or streaming with no problems.  Fast file transfers, fast boot, lots of USB ports including USB4 and Thunderbolt.  Dual monitor capable, room for an SSD,  This PC is packed for its size.  I love the PC, however their is one problem involving windows11 updates and the AMD GPU.  Win11 updates can break the system and cause computer to freeze in green, blue or black screen.  Subsequent upgrades fix the problem.  My UM690 worked great for but for 3 months then it suddenly started to freeze on a green screen.  This got progressively worst until about two weeks later it self cleared up.  Looking at the windows log file confirmed the cause was the updates.  The computer is fine, it was windows that screwed things up.  Just putting it out there encase someone else runs into the same problem.  I highly recommend this computer.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviewDescription: For months, I looked at a TON of options for building a home theater PC ‚Äì¬†Intel NUC, BeeLink, MinisForum, Zotac, or even a custom build.  What I wanted:- All the usual streaming stuff, in 4K with 5.1 surround sound- Ability to do some light gaming (Minecraft, emulators)- Silent operation (or at least very quiet)- Something without useless RGB lights all over it- Something affordableAnd based on those criteria, it came down to a choice between one of the BeeLink SER models or this MinisForum.  At the time, Beelink had something like a 15 week backlog, so I went with this one and it is exceptionally good.  Affordable, quiet, and extremely powerful for such a compact system.I can't recommend this option enough if you're looking for a "Living Room TV" type of setup.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviewDescription: Great deal for a zippy little shop PC. The specs state it's Wifi 6 and supports 4K at 60hz. Using the included HDMI cable I've discovered that it supports 4K at at least 120hz although that was only testing it with one monitor. Device manager also appears to show it's a Wifi 6E card.Boot times are very fast and the overall feel is snappy. Although the integrated graphics are inferior to the GTX 1050 in the PC this is replacing, the CPU blows an FX 6350 completely out of the water. It runs Solidworks and Fusion 360 capably, albeit not quite like my main office PC. (Ryzen 7 7700X and RTX 3070) I did need to uninstall and reinstall AMD Adrenalin as it had an incorrect version installed or something. With a Windows 11 Pro license, it truly is hard to beat.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2023
reviewDescription: Product has met expectations after a few days. Size is a nice compromise between those tiny 4 inch square mini computers and a smaller tower while offering desktop-like features. Case seems durable so far. Ventilation exceeds expectations while running quietly, plus one could place the entire unit on a laptop cooling pad during demanding use. USB4 ports are described as 40 Gpbs in the description online but as 20 Gpbs in the little paper manual--in either event they are multiple times faster than anything I've ever used for external backup. Paper documentation is very limited and I've not found a detailed PDF manual online, so the unit may not be best for a timid computer user. In sum, great computer and value for experienced users.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviewDescription: It works GREAT for gaming, only having to tone down a couple games from the "ultra" setting (of the 120 games I own, notably:  Cyberpunk 2077 and Horizon Zero Dawn).  then, within a couple months use, I get problems with connecting to my home network.  I replace it with my old computer to see if the problem is my router, and don't get the same error, so I'm guessing it's the fault of the minisforum 'puter. I'm not an IT guy, so I can't be sure what the problem is, but I shelved the minisforum, and went back to my old computer (for now).  it's cool otherwise...maybe I just need to update the drivers (again, not an IT guy).  I'd give it a 5 otherwise.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviewDescription: I purchased this as strictly an emulation machine. I like games and I own an awful lot of them. The UM690 by Minisforum, does a good job at emulating everything from the old 70‚Äôs Atari 2600 all the way up to the Xbox360. It is plenty powerful enough to do all your basic office stuff, surf the internet, stream movies, but I like that I can play Forza Horizon 5 on it. Windows 11 Pro cam pre-installed but I didn‚Äôt like it and downgraded it to Windows 10.In all I‚Äôm satisfied wit my purchase. I like the upgradablity of this unit and plan on purchasing more and faster ram as well as setting up my own external graphics card for it. To me, it‚Äôs fun to see how far you can push these little computers. If you buy it you will like it.

reviewTitle: So far so good- quick and speedy little box.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviewDescription: Needed to upgrade my notebook and with money being tight, I decided to look at a small footprint computer. Using a surface pro for mobile business, this pc more than fits the need. It's fast and the large graphic files that I produce for trade show large format prints, are opened and saved quickly. I just wish it had a card reader like my notebook does, but I can deal with finding a usb card reader. Super happy with this.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this (HX99G) because I needed something that could run cooler and quieter than my current rig with enough performance to fit my streaming and video editing needs.To put things in perspective, I was running a Ryzen 9 3950x with a 6900XT and 64GB of RAM in ThermalTake Tower 100 with a Cooler Master MA620M. On paper, the HX99G has about half the performance for a fraction of the size and power ratio.So is it good enough?I stream at higher bit rates on YouTube, so using the hardware encoding at 1080p10000 kbps seems to be keeping good frame rates without eating all of my resources. I still haven't tested x264 encoding, and video processing is about what I expected for Kdenlive.Custom builds are awesome, and I love building PCs, but this little guy is probably going to be my favorite main "desktop" for years to come.

reviewTitle: So far so good but a few minor issues
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
reviewDescription: This is my new computer in a little over 10 years and my Dell Inspiron has served me well. I bought this computer last month and its been ok so far and I am still getting used to Windows 10 and this raised keys keyboard as I am typing. Problems encountered the quick start guide says not to plug in your monitor directly into the video card port but it is the only way I was able to get a signal from the monitor. One of the usb 3.0 ports on the top is not recognized by the computer an issue I will get to at some point. I tried to put in my old hard drive and ssd drive which was difficult since the cords are so tightly wrapped and there is no real way to screw down a hard drive unless you take everything out to be able to get your hands and a screwdriver in there. I have the hard drive just sitting there underneath where the ssd drive that comes with it is. Also recommend using a towel or thick cloth if you are going to lay the case on its glass door side. My other ssd drive is there next to that one also hard to screw in to stay in place so I just used some electrical tape to keep it in place in case I need to pick up the case. The power supply is not strong enough to support a 144gz or higher monitor without the monitor shutting off by itself after a while of use. I currently have it at 120gz and has yet to crash and I will buy a 650w power supply some time later on. I also have my old 60gz monitor connected which works fine as well. I would also recommend adding another fan since it has an empty spot for one more. I had an issue with the audio from the video card it gave no sound but when I set the audio to Realtek it works fine but also be aware that sometimes the sound will revert back to the video card but can be changed again from the taskbar. Overall I would recommend this pc since the parts alone come close to the total price.

reviewTitle: Excellent starter PC and easily upgradeable.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviewDescription: Alright, I‚Äôve had this PC for about a year and a half. I purchased it looking for a prebuilt back when GPU‚Äôs were super expensive.The 1660S is a great starter GPU that runs any game on 1080P with well optimized games running on high graphics settings. This even ran some games in 1440P.I‚Äôve had no problems with overheating or crashing. I‚Äôve never bluescreened once on this. Make sure to check connections and that everything is seated correctly as always, you never know if vibrations during shipping could unseat something.This computer is definitely a good recommendation for a starter budget build. I‚Äôve since added 2TB M.2 SSD, upgraded to a 3070TI, and upgraded ram from 16 to 32GB. There may be better buy options out there since I‚Äôve purchased this, but this was a great choice.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviewDescription: So I was a bit nervous after reading some negative reviews; as a starter pc this baby is beautiful and perfect. It‚Äôs beautiful. The fans are quiet. It was easy to set up, and obviously a starter doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs anything big and fancy but I do feel like I got a bang for my buck and I‚Äôm very happy.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviewDescription: Very good

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2022
reviewDescription: I have had nothing but good things to say about this PC over the month or so I have had it. This PC has no problem running first person shooters, or games like Minecraft on max settings with mods/ shaders. I have had no issues running discord or spotify behind my games while maintaining an exceptional gaming experience. I did not utilize tech support for the simple fact that I did not need it; Set up is straight forward and any instructions you need are given in the package. Speaking on packaging, I was impressed by how well the PC was protected for shipping. I was skeptical about buying a PC online with the worry I would receive a damaged product after spending my time and money waiting for it. However, this was not the case. I was very pleased to pull my PC out and find it didn't have so much as a scratch on it and that it booted up wonderfully. All RGB lighting setup is incredibly easy; I could customize the front fans separately from the inner one to have multiple colors inside my PC. Not only does this PC perform wonderfully with anything I throw at it, but it also looks amazing doing it.

reviewTitle: It really has been a good machine for me
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2022
reviewDescription: I had been wanting to give PC gaming a shot for years and, more specifically, I really wanted to try out PC VR games with my Oculus Quest 2 (Meta Quest now, but you know what I mean).  I'm certainly plenty tech savvy, and 100% believe I could have actually built my own PC, but for my introduction to a world outside of consoles, I figured a pre-fab would be the safer option.  I've had this machine for right at or over a year now, and I've been nothing less than surprised with how well it has worked for me.  I always thought that I would need pay $2,500 to get a machine that would run games at max settings, but this one actually does it very well.  I play games like Total War: Three Kingdoms, Battlefront 2, & Smite - and they all run on max settings.  The first game that I found that didn't default me to max settings was Resident Evil 3 (remake), and I really won't hold that against the machine because that game is absolutely gorgeous, and I doubt my Series X could hold out at absolute max PC settings.Anyways, yeah.  Great machine, maybe the fan is a little loud, but if you get a decent set of speakers or use a headset you will never even notice. Great job Skytech.

reviewTitle: The best review ever - Some top notch performance would have been best if not for the horrible SSD
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
reviewDescription: I got this unit for myself as a daily driver. I do some graphics and some gaming so video performance was important. I have been in IT for years and used to build my own using the best graphics cards, best motherboards etc but am too old an busy for such things these days and wanted to see what a "custom" unit off the shelf on Amazon looked like. After doing benchmark testing, some really interesting things became apparent.The unit is beautiful, crafted well and unlike my first computer from Skytech (which was configured wrong) everything appears to have been installed correctly. FIt and finish are great and I love the fans and LED lights that give it nice curb appeal. I used Passmark software to benchmark this build. I highly recommend it to anyone. Passmark gives this build a 75% rating. From my experience this essentially means that it beats 75% of the people who have put their computers to the test recently. Since most of the users are geeks like me, that usually means that a higher bar is expected. Thus, the 75% rating is that this machine beats 75% of people who are spending money on a GOOD system.OVERALL: 75%CPU: 83%2D Graphics: 73%Gaming: 88%Memory: 58%What I found interesting is that this machine build is a monster when it comes to gaming and general computing power but is prevented from being a real killer because of some parts that they really failed on . The worst part of this machine is the SSD hard drive which received a 3% score in performance. The PNY CS900 is one of the WORST performing hard drives you could possibly pick. With out a doubt this 3% score affected the total performance of the build . In my experience, hard drive performance more than ANYTHING makes for a computer's performance and feel. The memory performance was also middle of the road. They could have spent the same amount of money and gotten better memory and for the love of god a DECENT hard drive. Literally the worst performing hard drive that costs the same or more than some stellar performers. I don't get it. This system could rock out with a marginal HD. Too bad it is not easy to replace (Like memory).

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
reviewDescription: Let me just start off by saying that I don't know much about PCs, and I was worried about taking the leap to purchase one, even after doing a couple weeks of research AND asking my hardcore PC gamer friends for advice. However, I am super impressed and so thankful that I chose this one! It is sooo worth the money! I started getting into PC gaming not too long ago, mainly playing Minecraft, and much more recently, Valorant. Both games ran like garbage on my old laptop, so I decided to upgrade - and let me tell you that this PC has not missed a BEAT! The only issues I've ever had with Valorant on this PC were due to internal issues with the game itself, not the PC. No lag AT ALL - same goes for Minecraft and a few smaller games I've played. Everything runs absolutely great! I will say I was a little worried when I opened the box up (I was hoping it hadn't gotten damaged during shipping), but it was actually packaged really nicely and came with a nice quick start guide, which was really useful for me, considering I've never set up a gaming PC before. Everything was hooked up properly internally, so it was plug and play after getting everything arranged the way I wanted on my desk, and I instantly loved the RGB lights! They're awesome! You can change the colors just by pressing a button on the top of the PC. I leave mine on the solid rainbow setting most of the time, but there are so many colors you can rotate through! The other nice thing is that it has a lot of open space inside, so I could definitely upgrade it as needed, and there's 5 cooling fans! It never gets hot (even after HOURS of playing Valorant) and is pretty quiet. The mouse and keyboard included are okay - I'm sure most pro gamers will want to upgrade, but for now, they work good for me. Coupled with my new 24" Sceptre Edgeless Curved monitor, it's a perfect match for me. If I ever need to purchase another PC in the future, I'd definitely buy one again from Skytech!

reviewTitle: Amazing gaming PC for this price range
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
reviewDescription: I'm very happy with this PC. Not to throw HP under the bus, but I had originally ordered an Omen from HP which came with a i7-9700k and an RTX 2070. The computer was amazing in terms of performance but it had one fan and little oblivious me buying my first pre-built gaming PC got it, long story short it would overheat a lot and I had to return it, was a shame because I really liked it. Anyway, fast forward a week, I'm much more informed and I run into this while looking for a replacement. This PC is amazing, it runs any game I want at max settings even though the components are technically less powerful than the omen which came with the i7-9700k and rtx 2070, although that PC cost $1700 and this one, the SkyTech PC costs only $1000!!! So this runs any game I want perfectly smooth and at a fraction of the cost, it has a total of 5 fans, I originally thought there was only 4 but there are 5, 2 on top, 1 for the exhaust, the CPU is self cooled with it's own fan, and there is one fan you can't really see in the pictures which blows directly towards the graphics card. needless to say this PC does not get hot at all. It stays cool under load which is amazing to me. It came with GeForce Experience already installed which was cool, opened it up and I instantly downloaded the latest drivers for the 1660 SUPER. This PC is just amazing I'm happy I stumbled upon this gem, the RGB lighting is controlled through a button on the top of the case, again this is so amazing to me, The only thing I had to do to this PC since I got it to be fully up to date was update the mobo, update windows and updated the graphics card drivers in GeForce Experience. to update the motherboard it comes with a CD, this PC has no CD drive though, I googled b450 update and I found it easily enough lol. Overall I'm in love with this PC and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a pre-built in this price range.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2022
reviewDescription: I've had this prebuilt PC for over a year now. This is my first gaming pc I've ever bought. Overall it's not bad but there's a few issues.Pros: - Super convenient and set up was seamless. - Runs most games on medium setting - Relatively cheap compared to alternatives.Cons: - Some games (Fortnite, World of Warcraft, etc) that I've played on this machine - I get pretty bad graphic rendering. The gameplay isn't as smooth. I also get the occasional crashes - (Not an internet issue because my partner's system on the same network works fine) - Fan is pretty loud. If you're in a quite room you can hear the fan going off. It's not that big of a deal but you really notice it after you turn your pc off. - It gets hot.Overall it's a decent buy. Probably would have to replace the graphics card or something to improve gameplay across different games. If gaming is important to you, perhaps it might be easier to start off with a cheaper machine and upgrade whatever parts you need overtime. I have not yet contact their customer support about these issues yet but I'd assume there's not much that will be done.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this for my birthday in march of this year and I am more than impressed it‚Äôs been exactly a month since I received the computer and it runs every game I‚Äôve thrown at it with high quality settings and runs flawless. Games like Warzone 2, rust, Tarkov and more. I was skeptical buying a pc on Amazon due to the fact Amazon pcs have a bad rep so I did my research into Skytech first and seen they run a reputable business. It came with a B550 gigabyte motherboard, a gigabyte 3060 12gb windforce and 2 XPG 8gb ram sticks. Thanks SkyTech great job!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviewDescription: I've had it for a few months now and so far no issues! Runs all my games flawlessly.

reviewTitle: Fantastic so far, an absolute monster
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021
reviewDescription: *MY FIRST PREBUILT PC!*Well well well.. to be honest, I was a bit skeptical about my product when I read the reviews of hundreds of others that had bad experiences with Skytech. This skepticism was compounded as I read the reviews AFTER I purchased the product (I purchased the product because my buddy who builds PCs said this was a great deal). I admittedly got very anxious about the product, as well as its delivery to me (I chose 2nd day air shipping).First, what was unfortunate was that my shipping was delayed. As mentioned before, I paid for 2nd day shipping and it did not arrive in two days. I thought about the reviews I read where people had issues with shipping and I thought to myself... damn. Did I just get scammed out of shipping? So I sent an email to customer support and I was say almost instantaneously I received a reply AND refund for my shipping NO QUESTIONS ASKED! Fantastic!!! I was reading how customer support doesn‚Äôt get back to you, isn‚Äôt helpful, etc. So I was very surprised and happy that they got back to me so quickly. That was a huge relief.But wait, there‚Äôs more. I saw a discrepancy between the UPS shipping and Amazon shipping. Amazon said my order had shipped, yet UPS said it hadn‚Äôt received anything yet, only that a label was created. So that confused me... so I contacted customer support AGAIN, and immediately they got back to me and told me that everything on their end was completed and to wait for UPS to scan the item over the weekend (I ordered the PC thru Amazon on Wednesday). So I said ok... that‚Äôs ok.Saturday came, I got an updated saying the item was scanned they UPS, Sunday I got another update saying that my item will be delivered on Monday! Yay!!!So I received the item yesterday, and immediately I saw that the box was punctured a bit. That was a bit disheartening, but I was still optimistic. I opened the box, found a tinier box that had cords in, and began pulling out the item. The PC itself had a huge bag over it, which was pretty cool. So I pulled it out, took off the bag... and boy I was stoked. Everything looked clean physically, and I began to open the PC tempered glass door (which is very high quality IMO), and took out the safety foam from having the hardware move around o n the ride here (which I very much appreciated).Unlike other reviewers on here, I received my correct GPU, SSD, all the goods. I‚Äôm so happy about that! It‚Äôs been running great, (today is T+1 since having the PC) and I‚Äôm very optimistic about the future of the PC. I plan on purchasing a better monitor today and I will see how it all runs. But so far I am very happy and grateful everything came as advertised. Hope this helps!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2023
reviewDescription: Let me just say this. Be careful with this company. Not Amazon, but Skytech. Here are some problems I am having.- Bought this computer back in Aug.- Set up, immediately started restarting...ON A DAILY by itself! Started taking pictures as much as I could of the problems we faced. I have way more pictures than the attached.- Called Skytech TWICE before the 30 day deadline where they had me reset the entire PC back to the beginning.- 30 day return policy for a computer is NOT enough time when there are issues from the beginning.- Being the busy person I am I hadn't had a chance to call them back until recently.- Called Skytech and was on hold for 6 HOURS (started at 46 in queue)! Up until they closed.- Tried again a few days later to be 86 in queue. I just couldn't hold that long.- I emailed them on Tuesday this week, NO RESPONSE.- Called Amazon to see if there was something they could do to help and LUCKILY, I bought the warranty. HOWEVER, Skytech's Tech Support should be helping me. They should allow me to exchange this defective computer. A computer I spent over $1200 on for it to be defective when I bought it.Moral of the story, beware when purchasing from this computer company. If you find your computer acts out, immediately ask for an exchange or return. DO NOT wait on the tech company to help in any way. Be assertive.Pros: great gaming computer specs. Thats it at the moment.

reviewTitle: Would be great, had I not had issues.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021
reviewDescription: As somebody who is very afraid of building his own PC purely out of fear of breaking anything, good prebuilds are my go-to. After a couple years, I knew very well I was due for a computer upgrade, as my previous one had been owned for nearly four years and sat on a Radeon RX 580 in our year, 2021.So I went with this one.I'm pretty happy with the presentation and quality of this build. I will admit, I was pretty distracted by the lights it comes with, and I spent a good 15 minutes playing with the colors until satisfied, so that's not at all a bad thing. I'm able to play a lot of modern games at the highest setting and without any framerate drops, and I think that's absolutely fantastic.However, while I'm satisfied with my purchase, getting this thing to work without crashing from a memory management BSOD was obnoxious. These BSODs would occur without warning, and for that it was really frustrating. I'm a college kid, and I only make so much money, so you can imagine how peeved I'd been when this computer would crash at random points throughout my week, despite how much money I'd poured into it. I'm thinking I somehow ended up with a faulty RAM module, because I'd tried every other fix offered to me. Fortunately, I had some money set aside to purchase a new pair of RAM to use instead. These ones fit the PC build much better anyway, and look much nicer than the default pair it came with (OLOy B-21Raider). I'm hoping that this will provide a fix for these blue screens I've been experiencing.I really wanted to give this computer a five-star review, and I'm sure many other people have had great experiences with this prebuild, I think I just ended up having poor luck this time. I think a better quality check was in order, here.TLDR;Despite the issues that I've had, I would absolutely recommend this computer, especially for those who aren't too tech savvy and don't understand what is good hardware and what isn't. Whether it be for your child's 18th birthday, or just for your own personal use as a gamer, I totally recommend this.

reviewTitle: Great system, but no support from Skytech or Amazon
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this thinking I had found a bargain. As the old saying goes, buyer beware. When it arrived, it did not have all the internal foam. There was some damage to the ethernet card, and the WiFi antennas were missing. After going through the system and verifying all of the power connections, PCI and RAM I fired it up. It worked great for a couple of hours.Then it began to randomly crash. I started updating all the drivers and Windows to no avail. I managed to do a kernel dump and found that all the crash errors were coming from the Gigabyte Eagle RTX 3060 video card. I took the card out of the PC and put it into another PC and found that it did the same thing there. After calling Skytech for a few days, and waiting for 4 to 5 hours without and answer or call back, I called Amazon. Amazon offered to either refund the purchase or help me contact Skytech. I opted for the later and after 10 minutes of waiting the Amazon tech said that "Skytech doesn't open until after 4 pm PST." which I found very odd. They said all they could do was refund the purchase. After I checked Skytech's website, I found they are open from 9-5 PST M-F.I tried again the next day and after 2 hours managed to make contact with a rep from Skytech. I explained what I had done and that I had called NVIDIA and Gigabyte (both with less than 30 minutes wait) and they had agreed the graphics card was kaput. The Skytech rep apologized and sent me a text requesting my personal information, invoice, picture of the serial number, and a few other things. I texted it back immediately and was told that they would text me with information to ship the graphics card back to them and once it was received they would send me a replacement. I waited for a couple of days and no information was forthcoming. I texted the number back and had no answer.After doing a cost-benefit analysis, I decided to just purchase a graphics card and bought a PNY RTX 3060 from Best Buy. Now the system works like a dream and plays Sims 4, Civ VI, FS 22, GTA V, Cities: Skylines, CMS 22 and Command Modern Warfare in ways I never knew they could be played.Based on the experience I have had, I would tell you to be prepared that you will either go out of pocket for parts or have to go through the trouble of a refund if yours doesn't work. When it works it is great, but I don't think I will buy another Skytech product and would rethink buying another gaming PC from Amazon due to their extremely poor customer service.

reviewTitle: Great Machine, But Getting To Be Very Pricey
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2021
reviewDescription: My previous pc gave up the ghost, so I needed a new machine fast.  After doing a lot of research I finally settled on Skytech.  But, Before I could pull the trigger they sold out, went on back order and the price went up over $200 (this may be due in part to DRAM memory shortage & other tariffs) .  I Still needed a new machine and I didn't want to start my research all over again from scratch, so I went ahead and placed my order and tried to wait patiently.  Due to shortages the new stock would essentially be BTO, and I was originally told that the build and shipping time would be 6 weeks.  To my pleasant surprise it only took 3 weeks and it arrived well packed (Skytech's box inside an Amazon box).  Despite what past reviewers have said about their various start-up issues, I didn't experience anything unusual.  Right out of the box, set up was a breeze and within minutes I was up and running.  My only caveats at the moment are that I wish the pc could have been ordered with Windows Pro instead of Windows Home, and the other item is that the filter screen on the top of the case just appears to sit there and is not attached or secured in any way.  I don't know if it's suppose to be that way on purpose so the filter can be changed when needed, or not.  Other than that, I'm very satisfied, so far.  If the situation changes, I'll post an update and let you know.P.S.:  Pricing on Skytech's website might be a bit lower than what's listed on Amazon's website, but they don't offer any extended warranty coverage.  And, when you're spending a lot of money for a high tech piece of equipment, you expect it to last for a long time (at least 5 yrs.).  So, the 1 yr. manufacture's warranty just is not enough, therefore I would highly recommend that you get the extended coverage.  It's well worth it.

reviewDescription: works out the box loved they actually spent a lil extra for the packaging inside of the tower <3

reviewTitle: Glitchy WiFi card on UM690, but plays Hogwarts Legacy
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2023
reviewDescription: First off, this PC typically runs great! Boots up quickly. Runs quietly, even with games. Doesn't run too hot in my opinion. It is a lot smaller than I expected. I have been having glitches with HoloISO and Windows. When you restart, it's hit or miss whether the Mediatek WiFi card will be working. Under HoloISO, it does not recognize the modem for CAT5e at all, but that at least works under Windows. I probably would have gone with something else if I had know I have to replace the Mediatek card to get Internet running smoothly. Plays Hogwarts Legacy pretty nicely though, so I don't think I will return it. I'll update my review when I have more experience with the device.UPDATE: I did order a replacement Intel WiFi card and removed the faulty Mediatek one. If yours isn't faulty, I wouldn't bother replacing it. Be careful if you do. The Mediatek card's pins were extremely cheap, and broke when I ininstalled it. I had to use a thin needle to clean out the connectors before installing the Intel WiFi card. Everything works great again. Now I just need a slightly longer SATA cable to fit the 2.5" drive I hoped to use for dual booting between HoloISO and Windows. This machine is a lot snappier than I expected, especially with a couple minor upgrades.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviewDescription: After contacting Minisforum support, I've finally got everything working correctly. They were very helpful. So I'm updating my review of the HX80G.As of right now it's 4 out of 5 stars. The only 2 problems with this PC is the teardown and reassembly is a pain. Also, if you have a right angle audio cable or a thicker USB-C thumb drive, it won't fit between the "fins" on the front panel. So I dropped a star.As for the good. I'll leave you know in a future update, if I decide to keep this PC.

reviewTitle: A lot of power in a small package... For a month
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviewDescription: Update  after 1 month I started getting all types of corrupted video and surprise reboots.  Reinstalling windows and all the drivers from scratch did not help .  Obviously a hardware issue.  Memory tested good, SSD tested good.  Minisforum worked with me to diagnose and eventually sent me a replacement unit which is working fine. This isn't your hottest gaming rig, but it you don't mind running games in 1080p it will make you smile.  UM690 with Ryzen 9 6900HX/32GB RAM/512GB SSD, which includes Radeon 680M GPU.  No problems at all multi-tasking with multiple tasks open such as spreadsheets and multiple browser windows.  Even in the late stages of Civilization VI it doesn't lag.  Running on a Samsung 28" monitor and the colors are rich and deep.  Never felt it get more than warm when gaming and mounted vertically as that seems to allow better cooling.  USB 4 works well though only touches the peak throughput from time to time which is expected.  It fits on the back of the monitor with an industrial piece of velcro so I don't even know it's there.  Benchmarked over 10,000 multi-core with Geekbench 5 which was a bit above the average.On the downside... You're not going to be able to compare full powered desktop scores with this but if space is important to you, this is well worth the consideration.  Quite a lot of power in a small package.

Far Cry 5 runs but is not really playable. Solasta runs fairly well. No Man's Sky runs pretty well also.

reviewTitle: Great general purpose desktop in a mini form factor
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviewDescription: My wife wanted a general purpose desktop with light gaming but has very limited desk space.  The MINISFORUM Mini PC UM690 was a great choice for her.  It's the first WiFi 6 device we have in our house, and even though its at the most remote spot, it still churns our the fastest Speedtest.net.  We get BIG computing ability from a tiny package.  You can lay it horiztonally, vertically in a base stand, or with a VESA mounting bracket.  We choose the base stand, though I intentionally orient it upside down according to manual.  I chose to have the power button intentionally higher and the power cord come in lower than what the manual shows.While it is capable of gaming, it is not really a gaming PC.  But if your priorities are a general purpose computer first, and secondly some occasional gaming, this is a wonderful little choice.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
reviewDescription: This MINISFORUM HM80 Mini PC has all the features I wanted, it's well built, has a small footprint, and fantastic specifications for the price point.I'd give this computer five stars, but I haven't been able to install a Linux Operating System on it, as the damn Windows bios keeps blocking my efforts to do so.I've installed Linux on many computers over the decades, but this one is truly corrupted by Windows and has stopped every path I've tried to get Linux on the hard drive, I HATE Windows.However, if you want an exceptional deal on a great computer that uses the Windows operating system, then this is the box for you.Also, the vendor has been great in responding to my questions, good service by them as well.

reviewDescription: Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase. reviewTitle: Ein sehr spezieller Mini Computer mit einigen interessanten M√∂glichkeiten:
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany üá©üá™ on August 2, 2020
reviewDescription: Der HISTTON Mini PC wurde gut verpackt in einem Karton geliefert.Enthalten ist neben dem PC auch Zubeh√∂r:-Das Netzteil mit Anschlusskabel und Netzkabeln f√ºr EU (Stecker E+F) und einem f√ºr (vor allem) Gro√übritannien (Stecker Typ G)-2 Aufschraubbare WLAN-Antennen-Strom sowie Datenkabel f√ºr zus√§tzliches SATA-Laufwerk-Befestigungsmaterial f√ºr Laufwerk, Montage an Halterungen-Befestigungsplatte-Eine DVD mit Software (macht keinen seri√∂sen Eindruck)-Eine englischsprachige AnleitungNicht mitgeliefert wurde ein Tischst√§nder, der in der Beschreibung gezeigt wird.Der Computer hat ein sehr robust wirkendes und einwandfrei verarbeitete Geh√§use aus Metall (Aluminium) mit K√ºhlrippen. Das sollte die W√§rme dieses passiv gek√ºhlten Ger√§ts gut ableiten.Der Computer ist offensichtlich eher f√ºr den Einsatz in Industrie, Produktion etc. vorgesehen und nicht f√ºr den normalen Schreibtisch-Einsatz -aber dennoch kann man ihn nat√ºrlich auch da n√ºtzen.Der Mini PC verf√ºgt √ºber eine riesige Anzahl an Anschl√ºssen:An der Front gibt es neben einem COM-Port einen SIM-Steckplatz und vier USB 2-Anschl√ºsseDaneben ist rechts der Einschaltknopf mit einer blauen LED-BetriebsanzeigeAn der R√ºckseite befinden sich:-Zwei Antennen-Anschl√ºsse (Gewinde) f√ºr WLAN-Antennen -zwei sind ja im Lieferumfang-3,5‚Äú-Anschluss f√ºr Lautsprecher-3,5‚Äú-Anschluss f√ºr Mikrofon-2 Ethernet-Stecker (Gigabit)-4 USB 3.0-Ports-Ein USB C-Port (TPC)-Ein Display Port (EDP)-Ein HDMI-Port (HD)-Daneben der DC IN-Anschluss f√ºrs externe Netzteil-Unten ganze 5 COM-PortsInsgesamt sehr viele Anschl√ºsse. F√ºr normale Nutzer werden die zahlreichen COM-Ports aber wenig interessant sein, eher f√ºr Spezialanwendungen.Hardware im InnerenDer Mini PC l√§sst sich leicht √ºber 4 Schrauben an der Unterseite √∂ffnen -die Bodenplatte l√§sst sich dann sofort und einfach abnehmen.Schon hat man Zugriff aufs Innenleben: Insgesamt ist das Geh√§use √ºbersichtlich, bei meinem Exemplar war bereits ein 16GB RAM-Modul DDR4 2666 (Marke WEIDIAN) installiert, ein zweiter Steckplatz ist frei.Die Module lassen sich ganz normal austauschen.Die SSD (Marke KingFast) F6M.2 scheint auch einfach austauschbar zu sein.Als Prozessor kommt ein 4-Kern Intel Core i5 8265U zum Einsatz.Au√üerdem gibt es eine integrierte Intel¬ÆUHD 620 Grafik.Aufstellen/Platzieren des Computers:‚Ä®Der Computer verf√ºgt unten √ºber gummierte Standf√º√üe und kann daher nat√ºrlich einfach normal auf einen flachen Untergrund gestellt werden. Ebenso befindet sich an der Unterseite diverse Bohrungen, so dass man den PC an der Wand oder diversen Befestigungen montieren kann, auch eine Befestigungsplatte ist dabei. So kann man den PC auch z.B. an die R√ºckseite eines Monitors mit passenden Gewinden schrauben.An den Seiten der Bodenplatte sind auch vier √ñffnungen, womit man den PC wohl z.b. einfach an Verankerungen oder einh√§ngen oder direkt irgendwo anschrauben k√∂nnte.InbetriebnahmeDer Computer lie√ü sich sofort in betrieb nehmen: Windows 10 Professional war bereits vorinstalliert und aktiviert. Das System war bereits eingerichtet und ein ‚ÄûHistton‚Äú-Account angelegt.Wie vertrauensw√ºrdig das ist, und ob man das System lieber neu installieren will, muss jeder f√ºr sich selbst entscheiden.Auf der mitgelieferten DVD d√ºrften aber nur Treiber sein, ein zus√§tzliches externes DVD-Laufwerk wird zur Nutzung der DVD ben√∂tigt.LeistungDer Computer sollte auf jeden Fall genug Leistung f√ºr Alltags-Aufgaben bieten. Nat√ºrlich ist er wegen dem l√ºfterlosen Design und der Onboard-Grafik f√ºr Spiele, grafikaufwendige Anwendungen etc. ziemlich ungeeignet.F√ºr einen stromsparenden, l√ºfterlosen PC scheinter er aber eine brauchbare Leistung zu bringen.Er startet schnell genug und alle normalen Anwendungen laufen fl√ºssig.K√ºhlung, W√§rmeDas Geh√§use wird an den K√ºhlrippen, speziell auf der linken Seite, sehr hei√üt im Betrieb, dass man ihn gerade noch kurz anfassen kann. Ich hoffe, das K√ºhldesign ist durchdacht, und das sollte so sein, denn ich hatte noch keinen derartig passiv gek√ºhlten PC.Fazit:‚Ä®Ein sehr spezieller Mini PC -f√ºrbestimmte Arbeitsumgebungen und einfachere Aufgaben k√∂nnte er durchaus interessant sein. Ich werde ihn erst mal als Media-PC am Fernseher einsetzen.Wer die vielen COM-Ports wirklich brauchen kann, der hat nat√ºrlich einen klaren Vorteil bei diesem Ger√§t.Alternativ gibt es viele Mini PCs, die etwas aufger√§umter und mit weniger Anschl√ºssen kommen -z.B. Intels Nuk-Serie k√∂nnte f√ºr viele auch interessant sein -man kann sie auch teils selbst ausstatten und anpassen.Wer es optisch hohe Anspr√ºche hat, kann auch einen Apple Mac Mini in Betracht ziehen -der verf√ºgt sogar √ºber deutlich schnellere Prozessoren und die aktuelle Variante (Modell 2018-2020) kann neben Mac OS auch unter Windows genutzt werden. Au√üerdem hat der Mac mini gleich 4 Thunderbolt 2-Ports.Bis jetzt l√§uft der HISTTON Mini PC bei mir allerdings einwandfrei und weitere Erfahrungen reiche ich gegebenenfalls nach.

reviewTitle: Loving it.. Great power! Great for games.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2023
reviewDescription: I'm loving this pc. Bought it for games and video editing, runs really smooth. It's running the latest flight simulator on ultra settings with no issues whatsoever.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2022
reviewDescription: I bought it one year ago as a birthday gift to myself since luck would have it, my old pcs graphics card died and it looked cheaper to buy a prebuilt than to get a scalped card. It arrived, ran great for a few days and then blue screen of death hell ensued, I wiped it thinking maybe it was a bad driver, but that didnt make ot go away so I contacted their technical support, who advised me that it was probably the ram so they sent me new ram sticks. I swapped them out and it didnt fix it. So finally I package it up to have it looked over and repaired. They ended up replacing several parts and sending it back to me about a week and a half after I had sent it to them. It worked fine for about 3 and half months... and then.. it wouldnt power on, sent it back again, turns out the power supply died, so I sent it back to have that replaced incase anything else broke. When it came back, it worked but the psu they had used to replace it withs fan was unholy loud. I could hear it 2 rooms away, instead of bothering with their technical support, I spent 200$ on a high quality evga psu to replace it. Since the last misadventure 9 months ago, I have had no more issues. I love it! I just wish it was less work to get working than building it myself would have been.  Would I buy again from skytech? I'm honestly not sure. They did do alot of work under their free warranty but I'm not sure that cancels out not having a working gaming pc for the better part of a month and half last year due to various issues.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2022
reviewDescription: Pros* Great specs considering the price* Ample USB hookups* Looks awesome* My daughter no longer complains about her PC being too slowCons* Not as fun as building your own PCOther thoughts2022 is not a good year for replacing your PC, what with the Biden regime's Make the World Suck Again plan raging along.  Still, if you absolutely have to replace an old box, you'll quickly find that building your own PC is now the pastime of the idle rich.  For the rest of us, you'll want to consider something like the SkyTech Archangel.  There are cheaper alternatives out there, but most PCs under $1000 these days have dubious components (especially RAM).My daughter was using an old business PC from Sam's Club that couldn't even run Don't Starve Together and was getting too clunky even for schoolwork.  The Archangel is huge improvement, and now she's enjoying a gamer's summer vacation.  So far it's taken everything she's thrown at it without any hiccups.Not sure whether this is a pro, but the PC comes with some deluxe packaging, including a huge black sack that our cat turned into a toy and a SkyTech Gaming folder (I guess if you want to show off at school).

reviewTitle: Has met all my expectations so far!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021
reviewDescription: It's fast and the graphics are great. I come from console gaming PS4 pro so I wanted that kind of quality out of this PC and got the one with the RTX 3060 graphics card. In my opinion, the quality is there and then some. I left some video of me running around Death Stranding to show the quality. I have it hooked to a 144hz FHD monitor and it is a million times better than my consoles. I've played other games like Batman Arkham Origins and Path of Exile as well as Apex Legends flawlessly. I create a lot of stuff so it also runs music software like Reaper, illustration like Clip Studio, and 3D modeling like Blender without any issues. Render time in Blender is very fast. Comes with Windows 10 but not Office so if that is important to you, you will have to buy it separately. Great Bluetooth range and connection.Also, I came from a laptop so the extra USB and HDMI ports were a miracle for me. I felt like the product description and pictures could have done a better job explaining what ports and how many for each model so I left my own graphs above. Just remember they are for the RTX3060 model.Overall I'm so happy with this PC and have had 0 problems. Like I said it is fast and so quiet even when I play games I'd forget it was there if it wasn't for the lights (which you can turn completely off if you want but I like them). Highly recommended.As far as Support goes, I gave 5 stars but I have had not had to contact them at all for anything.

reviewTitle: Good PC Given the current market
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022
reviewDescription: I've had the PC for about a month now. I run Valorant, halo infinite, Elden ring, and a few other things on medium-high settings. The PC handles it all pretty well, and I got all the parts that were outlined in the description. The RGB is nice, and the setup is really easy even if you aren't very tech savvy. If I could make ANY comments, it would be that I would do something about the ventilation, but with the help of MSI Afterburner, I found that this pc doesn't run as hot as I might've thought.P.S. Not every PC they send out will be in tip top condition! As everything is, sometimes a lemon can be produced, and things can be damaged when shipped. That being said, some of these one-star reviews you might be seeing could just be a lemon or a "bad batch", but overall, I think my PC is doing pretty well!

reviewTitle: Working well out of the box - EXCEPT
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 2, 2023
reviewDescription: I received the Acer all-in-one exactly as promised.  Package appeared to be more than adequate and secure.  Set up was amazingly simple - after I connected my old wired keyboard and mouse!  The USB reveiver plug necessary to operate the wireless key board and mouse was missing!!!I always unpack this kind of equipment very carefully - one piece at a time following the directions carefully.  I save all the packing material just in case something is wrong and I would need to pack it up to return.  So I reexamined the empty bok each piece of packing material - no receiver to be found.  The keyboard and mouse come in a separate plastic wrapping that also has the batteries in a separate little pouch.  I'm guessing that little pouch should ha had the receiver in with the batteries.So I love the computer so far using my work around mouse and keyboard, but part of my selecting this computer was tha fact that it had the wireless components.  I trust the right person will see this review and make it right.  I'll let you know.UPDATE:  Receiver is located inside the mouse next to the battery.  Nothing in the instructions showed that.I really like this computer.  Customer service people were very helpful!

reviewTitle: Even if I received this at NO cost, I'd toss it straight in the dumpster
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 6, 2022
reviewDescription: For starters, I only write reviews if something blows my mind - whether good or bad. This is the latter. I work in tech and have a very large event every year for 2 weeks which requires a moderate volume of data transfer from SD/USB drives to an external hard drive and cloud. Basically, three times I day I have to sit down and copy an average of 50 mp4 files from an SD card to my Lacie drive and Dropbox. I wanted an additional computer (this one) to tap in remotely to control from my MacBook Pro, which works well but a second computer is necessary if I don't want to give up my MacBook for solely those tasks multiple times a day. I did tons of research to find something that was simple yet fast, ideally an all in one for size. This Acer seemed great on paper so after weeks of comparing, I bought it.Fast forward to DAY ONE of getting this set up at my event. Set up was easy, went smoothly. I set up my USB hub which houses 6 USB drives (this computer and most other only have 2 inputs) and immediately had issues. Only one of the USB slots would be recognized at a time. This hub worked great with my MacBook, so it was obviously the computer. Completely defeated the purpose of purchasing a $100+ hub and 6 SD/USB readers not to mention how much time it would now take to come back 6x for each upload to swap the cards out.I finally had no choice but to only use the one reader, but once past that it was one issue after another. The computer would freeze....it would disconnect from the hard-wired internet...the keyboard would die half sentence with new batteries. The entire experience with this computer was nothing short of an absolute nightmare. I was not asking a lot of a system....simply transfer a few files (no larger than 150mb each) and boom - done. This was way too complex for the computer apparently.It would freeze every time I went to access my remote software....also a complete waste of the $100 software purchased to do this. At 2 am I would have to drive out to our workstation to restart the computer so I could access it from my laptop off-site. Restarting it alone is a 30+ minute process - in fact I click restart 45 min ago, walked and fed my dog and wrote this entire review and it's still on the Acer screen trying to start up. This computer has NO files on it, is less than 14 days old and has no reason so be this sh*tty of a product. I've always been loyal to HP and Mac, and this just reinforces my thoughts on the lack of quality companies like Acer put behind their products. Couldn't even supply a keyboard that worked!

reviewDescription: I use this PC as my primary personal desktop computer. reviewDescription: I have only a small area under my monitor, so I needed a small PC for my desk. reviewTitle: Excellent little home theatre and server PC
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviewDescription: I'm using this as both a Home Server (for storing and transferring files between the various PCs and other devices in the house) and as a Home Theatre PC (watching movies and TV shows). So far (2 months) it has performed faultlessly and suits our requirements perfectly. Aside from the 2 seconds when it first turns on, the fan doesn't seem to run at all (or runs silently) because we simply don't hear it (unlike other mini PCs we've used before), so it's an ideal HTPC. Very happy with this purchase.

reviewTitle: Excellent Mini PC. Easy to set up and operate. Great performance. Everything just works!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2022
reviewDescription: This unit is my first mini PC and I bought it for use as an office machine and minor video editing.  I did not purchase it as a gaming PC, however I understand that it can run most games which are not super graphic intensive.  However I am running Cities Skylines through Steam and it is working very well.Set up was super easy and everything works flawlessly.  The unit is super quiet, with just a small momentary fan noise upon boot-up, but after that, it is silent.  The Bluetooth and Wi-Fi modules work perfectly and connect without a problem.My unit came with a 512GB SSD primary drive and 16GB of RAM.  I added a secondary 2TB 2.5" HDD and it works perfectly.  Please note that some users have tried to add an SSD instead of an HDD as a secondary drive and that the computer does have issues recognising some SSDs by certain manufacturers (Samsung), so please do your research if you want to use an SSD instead of an HDD as a secondary drive.Power and bootup is lightning fast and it comes with Windows 11 pre-installed.  You can also put Linux on this unit should you choose and you can access the BIOS by pressing the "del" key on bootup to access the BIOS settings to install and configure.This is a great little unit at a really good price. Recommended to anyone who is after a great small form factor PC for their home or office.

reviewTitle: Work needed for bluetooth mouse and Onedrive
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2022
reviewDescription: I bought this mini PC for playing movies and videos in May 2022.10/2/2022 update:0. There was a new found issue.  The power supply module maybe a switching power supply that creates an annoying humming noise.  I had to place it far away from the desk, but I can still hear it ......Earlier review:1. I needed a 5M distance bluetooth mouse.  Previous PC worked OK, but does not work when mouse receiver directly connected to Mini PC.  After troubleshoot, noticed RF interference to receiver.  Connected a USB hub to Mini PC then wireless receiver to Hub worked.  Place USB Hub far away from Mini PC.2.  Movie or video has so many hick ups, stop and go in the middle of a video.  After troubleshoot, found it was the MS OneDrive synching and backing up in the background.  Uninstalled OneDrive solved problem!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
reviewDescription: While the PC is great for Windows.  I would caution any one buying this with the intention of using it as a 4K Linux media device.  While it can play 4K video, it definitely struggles with included RAM in streaming it.  I have a 1G connection and I still get ALOT of buffering when watching 4K videos on Youtube.  While this is not an unusual thing, the lack of a dedicated graphics card and the extremely slow RAM that the device comes with only make this a more common occurrence.  I've seen videos of similar PCs to this streaming just fine while using Windows 10.  So if that's what you want to buy this for, I would recommend using the included copy of Windows.  But this would definitely need an upgrade to work well in Linux.  I can't imagine gaming with the extremely slow RAM provided, but I'm sure on very low resolutions with esports titles you'd be fine.  I just wouldn't want to do that.  You see the CPU/GPU share the RAM,. so the slower your RAM speed; the worse that everything performs.  I would have really liked to see a much faster max speed for this RAM as even putting another 16GB, in there at this speed probably won't help very much.  But that is the next thing I'm  going to do.  I would wait for a sale and try to spend a little more if you want a computer for gaming.  Even a cheap laptop with a dedicated GPU would work better than this mini PC.

reviewTitle: Awesome performance, BUT Bluetooth & USB issues (easily resolved)
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022
reviewDescription: First off, I've been extremely satisfied with the performance of this little computer. However, I spent the first month frustrated with mouse and keyboard lag - at times completely non-functional - and audio crackling on my Airpods. I tried everything from updating the drivers, BIOS, etc. and even a clean install of Windows. All with no luck. It was so bad I planned to return it out of frustration. That was until I discovered the interference issues between USB 3.0 and Bluetooth. Turns out, these issues are exacerbated by metal, so you can see how a metal casing wasn't doing me any favors. I pulled out a USB extender and my mouse issues were completely resolved. Still, Bluetooth had a range of only 2-3 feet. Today I received an external USB antenna and all issues seem to be fully resolved. I would highly recommend this computer based on performance and overall value. Just know that you may need an external device if you encounter wireless issues.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2023
reviewDescription: Love this ALL IN ONE- I was tired of bulky towers and a ton of cords every where. This is semi portable, wireless and compact. Very pixilated/poor quality - it does look better in a well lit room.  I don't really need the camera but it would've been nice. Overall, for the price, it serves my needs!

reviewTitle: Don't think this one is a touch screen...
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
reviewDescription: I don't believe this computer to be a touch-screen, but beyond that, this Lenovo IdeaCentre AIO 3-2022 - All-in-One Desktop is a great desktop computer! It was purchased for my dad, who needed something new for his home office to do his work.I thought that this would be a great computer for him because it's an all-in-one, so it would help his desk be less messy. Everything is contained in the monitor, so no tower or extra wires all over the place. And it comes with a wireless keyboard & mouse to have less wires & clutter on your desk.I don't use the computer myself for day-to-day activities, but I did set it up for my dad & that was easy. The system booted up quickly, it asks you a few questions & pretty much sets itself up. Once I connected it to WiFi, the computer did all the necessary updates, accessed our Cloud, & downloaded all my dad's documents from his old computer to this new computer. I was really impressed with that, because usually, I have to do that manually or through an info share program. It really took me no time at all to get this computer ready for my dad.And this is a really sleek, nice looking computer too. I really like it & am a little jealous of my dad. I think my next desktop is going to be this one!

reviewTitle: Just what it is.  All In One.  Nice. Did have a few items to change, though.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviewDescription: I needed a computer for my spouse.  This fit the bill.  I wish I had thought out the purchase more before I bought i, though.  Nothing bad.......I just needed USB and memory adjustments.  Height check, too.I did add memory to it after purchase.  That 8GB is not enough IMHO.  Windows uses 6GB right off the bat!  If it had to use virtual memory (on the disk), then it would slow down big time.Memory upgrade was........interesting.  Watch a couple of youtube videos.  You can do it. Just go slow.4 USB slots is ok, but, wife wanted her special mouse, so, instead of sharing one slot with the KB and mouse, she was now using 2.  Then, I got a DVD drive, for she HAD to have it for a couple of programs.  Now, only have one left.  Yup, got a USB hub, and so all is ok.Screen is nice.  The whole setup is nice.My only knock on the unit is that the height is not adjustable.  I thought about cutting the desk, or the bar that supports the screen, but, nope.......wife said oh no to that!  ;)  BTW, desk to center of screen is 11".It does tilt front to back, but the tilt to the front is about 5 degrees - not much.  To the back is fine.In summary..........a nice unit.  Check the height.  Consider more memory.  And, rethink the USB setup that you will use.Enjoy!
