Also very impressed with the screen and display.  Definitely recommend this computer.

reviewTitle: Good Deal on a Used Chromebox
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2023
reviewDescription: For a $100 discount I expected a more "used" piece of equipment than what I received. It looked new rather than used including the packing material. I took the savings and upgraded the memory from 8G to 16G. Otherwise, the i3 processor is quite sufficient for browsing, spreadsheets, and word processing. You also get upgraded ports and memory slots that you would not get in the lower Celeron line. There is a fan that comes on once in a while but it's not objectionable.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2023
reviewDescription: At such a premium price, it's disappointing that the some of the major non-google android apps especially the Kindle Reader app is not available on the Google Play Store.It is really sad that even in 2023, AMZN/GOOG/MSFT/AAPL etc continue to lock out each other's flagship apps off each other's locked-out proprietary devices and platforms - not in the best interest of the consumer while some of these platforms were derived from open sources AOSP/Linux.

reviewTitle: Nice size but Chrome box is not for me
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2022
reviewDescription: Asus chromebox 4 is a nice size, plenty of usb and hdmi ports.  Once I started using the chromebox it shut down several times during usage.  Had trouble getting it to come back on.  Wasn't easy to add my brother wireless printer and bluetooth mouse.  It seems that chromebook or box you can't use a external cd/dvd player.  Not compatible.  Chrome OS is nothing but internet usage.  Not many apps that you can add.  I returned the chromebox and went back to my 8 year old Lenovo desktop windows computer.

reviewTitle: More than enough power to handle anything in Chrome OS
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
reviewDescription: The Amazon device description covers most everything about this computer.  It is fast and more than capable of handling almost anything Chrome OS can throw at it without a hiccup.  It will drive a large FHD screen with no problem and 4K seems to work just fine as well.  The same caveats apply to this device as to any other Chrome OS device, it does NOT run Apple or Microsoft apps natively.  Apple has a work around called iCloud.com that allows you to run all their basic apps (Mail, Photos, Notes, Numbers, Find My, etc.) but not things like Final Cut or Logic Pro.  Microsoft has made a good chunk of its software available on the cloud was well.  That said, this machine was designed for the Google software ecosystem including their Android Apps and that's where it is happiest.  If that works for you, this is an excellent machine for the money.

reviewTitle: It does NOT have an I7 or 16 gigs of RAM
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviewDescription: It comes with an I3 and 8 gigs - having said that it performs great with those specs. I have it hooked up to dual 24" ViewSonic monitors and Logitech KB and mouse. Reboots for updates take less than a minute. It has replaced my Windows 10 laptop and I do not regret it. There are a few things to get used to that are different, but worth it in my opinion

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021
reviewDescription: This Chromebox worked great for five mobths. Then when turning the unit on, the monitor would turn on for about three seconds then would go into a power saving state. I called Asus and they had me do a soft reset and a powerwash. That worked for one re-start. The tech hung up and it all was good until the next time. This time it would not power on. I called tech support and they said they would email a shipping label within 24 to 48 hours stating I needed to pay for the shipping label for the fixed unit to be sent back to me. Expected time for the whole process to take place is three weeks according to tech support.I would not recommend this product as I've only used this for a total of around 20 hours.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
reviewDescription: Using ChromeOS since 2015, purchased this ASUS CHROMEBOX4 for replace another Chromebox. Awsosme performances with Google Stadia and Nvidia GeForce Now. The pc can install Linux and Android 11 too. 8 gb of ram are enough even for more than 50 tabs opened at the same time. 128 gb of ssd are definitely ok. Google Drive subscription for automated backup is reccomended. The Intel I3 dual core with hyper threading (4 core total) runs fine even 4k streaming.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
reviewDescription: This Asus Chromebox 4 is Intelligent and genius because of its design and performance.  Up and productive in less than a minute.  The technology in this product makes it enjoyable, safe, and efficient to use.  Incredibly fast and high quality performance.  No extra dollars spent on anti virus software, its included in the purchase.  Tech support for over 6 years after release date at no cost.  This ASUS can handle up to 3 screens at 4k quality.  On top of all the above, the added bonus is its so quiet and uses little electricity!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
reviewDescription: Ok, so initially it said the Chrome Box was beyond update period.  So, I started the return process and ordered another box.  Then about 20 days into it, I realized that the software was current.  So, if this happens be patient.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2022
reviewDescription: I, at one time, loved ASUS and Chrome OS.  I am not a fancy-pants computer person, and Chrome OS provided everything I needed and more.Then, I purchased this Chromebox.  Immediately I noticed that the tabs at the top of the page were one-half covered, once a page was opened, I couldn't close it, and when trying to go back a page, it would only open a duplicate page.Amazon had me return it and shipped a replacement right away.  But, the replacement had the same problem.AMAZON tech services said to return it.ASUS techs had never heard of the problem.I asked bout AMAZON and ASUS techs if it could be I need a new monitor.  "All" the techs I spoke with said it could not be the monitor.Until this is corrected, I will use my old Chromebook.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviewDescription: Overall the computer is very nice for the price.  Easy to setup, starts up quickly and the video camera is easy to turn on/off.  The biggest downfall is the screen resolution, text took a little to get used to.  If you are going to use computer for movies or high end photo editing - this is not for you.  But for most applications such as web surfing, personal finance and everyday usage - it works great with very quick responses.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
reviewDescription: My old all-in-one desktop worked fine, but was getting sloooower and slooower.  I keep tons of files in the cloud and it was taking the computer 10 minutes to sync everything before I could really use it.  Time to move on.I purchased the Dell all-in-one based upon specs and reviews.  I am happy with the purchase with caveats.I got the performance I wanted.  It boots up and syncs all my cloud storage in like a minute.  Every application I use, including multiple browers, just sails.  I am very happy with the overall performance.My issues:The screen at 27" needs to be 4K.  The pixelation is just awful.  Some text looks like it's on a monitor from the 1990's.  Also, the screen is advertised as being "anti-glare."  I have mirrors that don't work as well as this monitor.  It is anything but anti-glare.  My old all-on-one is sitting next to this one right now with zero reflections on the screen.  On this one, I can see everything behind me.  It's going to give me a few headaches.The keyboard and mouse, in my opinion, are awful.  I switched out the dongle with my old PC and now have a several year old keyboard and mouse that are far better.  Unfortunately, the person who buys my old PC used will get the new ones meant for this computer.

reviewTitle: Arrived on time and as described
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2022
reviewDescription: I would recommend this seller as the product arrived on time and as described. It looked almost new and is performing perfectly

reviewTitle: Dell has done it again, custom motherboards cannot be replaced even if defective
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviewDescription: Has a defect in the motherboard which is well documented by Dell on the on board video.  Dell replaced the motherboard TWICE, same issue video failure.  The motherboard is a custom size and no other type of dell or any other motherboard will fit to replace the defective one.  Dell has stopped returning my calls.  I have several open cases and they acknowledge the problem but will do nothing to fix or replace the unit which by their own admission is defective.  I stopped buying Dell's 25 years ago because they use custom parts that cannot be replaced by any other manufacturer.  I BUY 50 new PC's a year, I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER DELL AGAIN.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2021
reviewDescription: Awesome seller! Packed well & arrived earlier than expect, several adapters were included.  The computer is a peppy little machine at a great price.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
reviewDescription: No power cord and it said it comes with it.

reviewTitle: For the cost, well worth it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 17, 2022
reviewDescription: Arrived in good order.  Booted up without issue.  Found my WiFi.  Connected like a champ. Updated no issue. Window 11 ready.  SSD is the way to go these days.  8 gig memory installed as advertised.  Added another stick of Acer 8 gig.  16 gig RAM recognized.  Expandable to more if needed.  Video card is just fine for those running games.  I play Uboat that is a resource hog like no other.  Game plays without issue or lag at all.  There is a nice feature named Nitrosense preinstalled.  The app controls the cooling fans automatically or at a set speed if desired. Playing Uboat that sucks the life out of the CPU and GPU the fans kicked into high for cool running while I played the game.  That my friends are a nice feature.  And to add, the fans run slowly when heavy gaming is not in use.  As a result, it is very quiet as one simply browses or is working emails, etc.Many moons ago my very first computer (in the 90's) was an Acer Emachine E-monster 550.  It was a great machine.  I'm glad Acer has kept assembling computers.  This Nitro appears to be just a great as my old Emachine.I'm very pleased with the purchase.  Nice job Acer.

reviewTitle: Good for beginners, but you may need additional screws for upgrades
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 26, 2022
reviewDescription: As someone who is very inept and clueless when it comes to computers and gaming, this desktop was a great beginner gaming desktop. I'm not much of a hardcore gamer, but I am able to run most of the games that I play including Overwatch, Assassin's Creed, and Monster Hunter. I also mostly use the computer for schoolwork and work-related projects, and it is plenty enough for just that.I also did some basic upgrades that some of the reviews suggested including adding another M.2 drive and upgrading to a 16gb 3200 mhz RAM, which really improved its quality. There isn't a screw for the m.2 drive, however, and I had to take it from a spare laptop of mine that no longer works. The installation was easy once I looked up how to on Youtube, and I couldn't be any happier with my decision. The computer is worth the  money, especially for those starting out for gaming purposes but is also multifunctional for other tasks.

reviewTitle: add more ram and hard drives.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 5, 2022
reviewDescription: Great PC for the price. Got it as a secondary pc. I added 32 gigs of 3200 mhz ram, installed a second m.2 drive and added 2 sata drives to it for a total of 10TB of storage. (note: you need to have sata cables to add HDD's, but the connectors are on along the edge of the motherboard sticking out the side towards the bottom side of the pc, took me a minute to find them). The wifi card works fine in it but I swapped mine out for the killer wifi card simply because its better and the killer software gives you nice control on wifi settings. I paired it with an ASUS 32 inch wquhd 144 hz monitor. The keyboard it comes with is kinda small, which is good if you have limited space but I prefer a bigger keyboard so I used a different one. ( I have large hands) I did not use the mouse it comes with, I prefer a thumb trackball mouse but the mouse it comes with is functional and works fine. So far it has performed well. Plays games just fine. It's easy to add upgrades to it. If you buy this pc, in the very minimum i recommend adding at least 1 more 8gb strip of ram to it at 3200 mhz for optimal performance. The 8GB it comes with is not enough for gaming, but this pc is a great starter for the money. If you're on a budget and looking for something affordable, this ACER Nitro is great. I might upgrade the video card at a later date but the Geforce it comes with will run every game currently on the market on medium to high settings, older games can be run at max settings. Overall I am happy with it.Edit: I did upgrade the video card to a geforce 3060 card After having for a few weeks. Now I‚Äôm happier with it. Upgrades are no problem.

reviewTitle: Great Desktop computer for the money
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 29, 2022
reviewDescription: I wanted an up to date computer that was up-gradable to Windows 11. Please make sure to check this before buying a computer. The computer powered up right out of the box without any issues, connected to internet and upgraded to Windows 11 in less than two hours I was all set up. I upgraded the RAM by adding another 8GB. The web sight says the Ram is PC 2666 MHZ but is actually PC3200 in the computer. I had to return the PC2666 because felt it important that the computer runs with what was put in, plus was the same price for either speed, so faster RAM did not cost me more. One reviewer said his fan was loud. Mine is quieter than my last computer. I suppose in a quiet room you could here it. The Red LED lighting is okay. I added two more SATA hard drives for storage. I have not run any games yet. From the reviews I read this should not be an issue. I am not a hard core gamer and most of my games are several years old so I do not expect and issues. I am very happy with this computer.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 13, 2022
reviewDescription: After having this system for a while, I will go ahead and say an extra 8gb stick with of RAM is required to get full utilization from this system. I also bought an extra m.2 ssd. Gaming- with this system and the upgrades purchased for it, I am able to play games mostly in QHD and get 50-60 fps. I am also able to even play in native 4k (high or medium graphics preset) and get above 30 to 40 fps. Solid gaming experience. Production- as a side hobby I am a music producer, and use FL Studio 20 as my main work environment. Compared to my previous system I am able to have a fast, steady, and smooth workflow with the increased processing power of the 11th Gen Intel CPU in the system. Lastly I upgraded to Win 11, and I can confidently say this system is pretty much capable of anything you throw at it. Can‚Äôt forget the upgrade path also, for future upgrades to the CPU, GPU, more RAM etc. Overall- I am happy with the purchase, but I recommend upgrading the RAM and getting more storage.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 1, 2022

reviewDescription: I use this PC as my primary personal desktop computer. Still running cool and quiet.Opening and expanding it is super easy and it's all very nicely laid out inside. A really good value proposition for a home or private work lab.

It came with a licensed version of Windows 11 Pro, and it installed perfectly, and has drivers properly installed as well.  It works great, and I love it! reviewDescription: I'm using this as both a Home Server (for storing and transferring files between the various PCs and other devices in the house) and as a Home Theatre PC (watching movies and TV shows). reviewTitle: Excellent Mini PC. Easy to set up and operate. Great performance. Everything just works!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 10, 2022
reviewDescription: This unit is my first mini PC and I bought it for use as an office machine and minor video editing.  I did not purchase it as a gaming PC, however I understand that it can run most games which are not super graphic intensive.  However I am running Cities Skylines through Steam and it is working very well.Set up was super easy and everything works flawlessly.  The unit is super quiet, with just a small momentary fan noise upon boot-up, but after that, it is silent.  The Bluetooth and Wi-Fi modules work perfectly and connect without a problem.My unit came with a 512GB SSD primary drive and 16GB of RAM.  I added a secondary 2TB 2.5" HDD and it works perfectly.  Please note that some users have tried to add an SSD instead of an HDD as a secondary drive and that the computer does have issues recognising some SSDs by certain manufacturers (Samsung), so please do your research if you want to use an SSD instead of an HDD as a secondary drive.Power and bootup is lightning fast and it comes with Windows 11 pre-installed.  You can also put Linux on this unit should you choose and you can access the BIOS by pressing the "del" key on bootup to access the BIOS settings to install and configure.This is a great little unit at a really good price. Recommended to anyone who is after a great small form factor PC for their home or office.

reviewTitle: Work needed for bluetooth mouse and Onedrive
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 4, 2022
reviewDescription: I bought this mini PC for playing movies and videos in May 2022.10/2/2022 update:0. There was a new found issue.  The power supply module maybe a switching power supply that creates an annoying humming noise.  I had to place it far away from the desk, but I can still hear it ......Earlier review:1. I needed a 5M distance bluetooth mouse.  Previous PC worked OK, but does not work when mouse receiver directly connected to Mini PC.  After troubleshoot, noticed RF interference to receiver.  Connected a USB hub to Mini PC then wireless receiver to Hub worked.  Place USB Hub far away from Mini PC.2.  Movie or video has so many hick ups, stop and go in the middle of a video.  After troubleshoot, found it was the MS OneDrive synching and backing up in the background.  Uninstalled OneDrive solved problem!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 9, 2021
reviewDescription: While the PC is great for Windows.  I would caution any one buying this with the intention of using it as a 4K Linux media device.  While it can play 4K video, it definitely struggles with included RAM in streaming it.  I have a 1G connection and I still get ALOT of buffering when watching 4K videos on Youtube.  While this is not an unusual thing, the lack of a dedicated graphics card and the extremely slow RAM that the device comes with only make this a more common occurrence.  I've seen videos of similar PCs to this streaming just fine while using Windows 10.  So if that's what you want to buy this for, I would recommend using the included copy of Windows.  But this would definitely need an upgrade to work well in Linux.  I can't imagine gaming with the extremely slow RAM provided, but I'm sure on very low resolutions with esports titles you'd be fine.  I just wouldn't want to do that.  You see the CPU/GPU share the RAM,. so the slower your RAM speed; the worse that everything performs.  I would have really liked to see a much faster max speed for this RAM as even putting another 16GB, in there at this speed probably won't help very much.  But that is the next thing I'm  going to do.  I would wait for a sale and try to spend a little more if you want a computer for gaming.  Even a cheap laptop with a dedicated GPU would work better than this mini PC.

reviewTitle: Awesome performance, BUT Bluetooth & USB issues (easily resolved)
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 5, 2022
reviewDescription: First off, I've been extremely satisfied with the performance of this little computer. However, I spent the first month frustrated with mouse and keyboard lag - at times completely non-functional - and audio crackling on my Airpods. I tried everything from updating the drivers, BIOS, etc. and even a clean install of Windows. All with no luck. It was so bad I planned to return it out of frustration. That was until I discovered the interference issues between USB 3.0 and Bluetooth. Turns out, these issues are exacerbated by metal, so you can see how a metal casing wasn't doing me any favors. I pulled out a USB extender and my mouse issues were completely resolved. Still, Bluetooth had a range of only 2-3 feet. Today I received an external USB antenna and all issues seem to be fully resolved. I would highly recommend this computer based on performance and overall value. Just know that you may need an external device if you encounter wireless issues.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 14, 2022
reviewDescription: Pay attention to the model in these reviews. Most are NOT the 16g i7 27", which I talk about here.I ONLY use a stylus to touch my monitor and don't use the onscreen keyboard. The touch has been flawless and I have already used the touch screen more than I have on my two touchscreen laptops, in ten years.The dongle for the wireless mouse and keyboard is in the mouse, dummy, and also flawless.I love how compact the keyboard is without feeling like a laptop keyboard. My WPM dropped for a few days until I warmed up to it. The silent, soft touch is outstanding!The audio is exceptional, compared to other built-in speakers, but I didn't buy this for sound and haven't listened to enough tracks to be able to offer a real opinion.As for the description, there are several models to choose from, with different RAM, processors, monitor size, etc., so I can see how things can get hairy there. Whether its a $700 or $1400 investment, the item description needs to be spot on and I hope everyone got their purchases squared away; I got exactly what I ordered. I wish I had a Win11Pro option but, I am so happy with the Home version, I may not even upgrade.I have a 2013 Lenovo laptop: 8g i7 still going strong  (lasted longer than dells and hps Ive owned), and I am brand loyal. It was fine until my new gig got me running too many programs simultaneously to run my business with so, new toy and write-off!You'll either like Win11 or you won't but, generally, the older we are, the less we like change so, just bite the bullet. I wasn't a fan of Win8, liked Win10 but, I think Win11 would have been the natural procression from win7.If you are a Mac fan, MS seems to have gone back to their roots and stolen some things from Apple so, the look and feel of Win11 may appeal to you.The placement of the USB ports are convenient, or not. Some on the back and some on the side of the monitor. I added a USB expansion for things I disconnect often.The camera is pull up/push down and adds 2" to the height of the monitor. A small but important detail, with all the video conferencing today and, Windows Hello facial recognition. OTOH, maybe they‚Äôre doing CMOS battery backup with a supercap or some other method not requiring a battery.Two dings: First, as delivered, you can‚Äôt use a hot key to get into the BIOS. No big deal: the BIOS can be reached via the usual Win 10 restore functions easily, and after the BIOS settings are redone to no longer hide the opening screen, the hotkey (DEL, by default) works just fine.Second, the user manual is the worst I‚Äôve ever seen for any electronic device. Ever. Wholly apart from being in unreadable 1 or 2 point type, it says nothing useful, which is to say, nothing you can‚Äôt learn from just looking at the connections and the icons on the case. Hence, as you get this up and running, you had best be an experienced computer builder with good access to Google, or you‚Äôll have a lot of frustrations. reviewTitle: Shootout between N95 and N6005 mini PC‚Äôs yields surprising results
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 20, 2023
reviewDescription: This review is a follow-up to my original review of the Kamrui GK3 Plus mini PC (N95/500GB SSD/16GB DRAM). That review noted the GK3 Plus would not hit the claimed CPU turbo speed of 3.4GHz, never getting higher than 2.7GHz. The seller responded to the review and offered a replacement PC, which I agreed to check out. The purpose of re-reviewing the Kamrui GK3 Plus was to determine whether my original experience was typical, and if so, whether there is any significant effect on usability or real-world performance at 2.7GHz vs 3.4GHz.The test PC‚Äôs were the Kamrui GK3 Plus, an N95 model of slightly different design, and an N6005 ‚ÄúSilver Pentium‚Äù mini (3.3GHz turbo). All PCs contain 16GB of DRAM, although it is implemented as dual-channel for the N6005, while the N95 minis use single-channel.  For testing, I used CPU-Z‚Äôs ‚ÄúBench CPU‚Äù feature and Cinebench, as well as several programs that track minimum, current, and maximum speeds and temperatures of processor cores.RESULTS¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†N95 GK3 Plus¬†¬†--¬†¬†N95 PC #2¬†¬†--¬†¬†N6005 PC #3---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Base clock:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†1.7GHz¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†1.7GHz¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2.0GHzObserved fastest clock¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2.7GHz¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†3.4GHz¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†3.3GHzCinebench, single core¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†725¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†903¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†667Cinebench, four cores¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2543¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2672¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2410CPU-Z Bench, single core¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†305¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†367¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†305CPU-Z Bench, four cores¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†1180¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†1185¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†1187Max Temp & Power (¬∞C - W)¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†78¬∞ - 11W¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†65¬∞ - 7W¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†60¬∞ - 18WTEST SCORES SUGGEST:a. The ability of PC #2 to hit 3.4GHz provides some advantage in single-core mode, but any advantage becomes virtually insignificant for all three PC's when four cores are running. The number of operating cores and the speed of individual cores are set automatically as the PC's run.b. The higher base clock speed and dual-channel memory of the N6005 PC were not enough to take a lead over the other PC‚Äôs, but did provide comparable performance.c. The higher peak CPU temperature in the GK3 Plus can be managed by making sure the PC is not resting on a surface that restricts airflow. The majority of cooling air enters and exists through vents on the underside of the case. Adding taller stick-on feet to the bottom of the case can help. Note these temperatures occurred only under heavy processor load. The GK3 Plus temperature normally hovers around 50¬∞C or less.OTHER OBSERVATIONS:The GK3 Plus uses easily replaceable laptop style memory that can be accessed by removing the 2.5" SDD basket. Processor specs indicate 16GB is the maximum. Some report installing a 32GB memory module, while other comments state adding more than 16GB might not be worth the additional cost.Per videos, it is possible to get at the SSD and swap it out as well, but the SSD is hidden on the bottom side of the circuit board and requires a more involved disassembly and care not to break wires going to the case. The SSD is probably an M.2 SATA device, not NVMe, but the socket in the N5105 version of this PC appears to be NVMe. For more storage, it is easier to install a 1GB or 2GB 2.5" SSD in the top of the PC and use it for data and program installations.CONCLUSION:I spent several hours comparing PC's. In the end, I noticed no obvious difference in overall performance, or in response while web browsing. In a ‚Äúblind test,‚Äù it would be difficult to tell which PC I might be using. Real-world performance is not hampered in any noticeable way by the ability to run at 2.7GHz vs 3.4GHz, especially since the other N95 PC spends most of its time at 2.7GHz.About 90% of GK3 Plus reviews rate the PC at 4 or 5 stars, which indicates the GK3 Plus is successfully meeting the expectations and needs of purchasers. Based on my most recent experiences, I‚Äôve added a star to my rating of the Kamrui GK3 Plus. The various coupon incentives offered by Amazon can make the GK3 Plus a very attractive choice.

reviewTitle: Turn any monitor into an all in one PC
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 30, 2023
reviewDescription: This is a great PC in a small package.  I have wanted to buy a mini PC for a long time, but have always been afraid I would just receive an enhanced Raspberry Pi.I changed my mind when I discovered this little gem, I saw the Intel N95 chip and was sold based on the reputation of the processor.My KAMRUI GK3 Plus Mini PC arrived 36 hours after I ordered it and I tore it open excited to see what it had to offer. Inside the package was the PC, power cord and a HDMI cable along with a vesa mount and screws. It was packaged well and had a security seal on the package to ensure the box contained what Iordered.Setup was as easy as can be and I had the machine up and running in less than 5 minutes. Once everything was set up it did take a while for Windows to update all of it's packages, but once that was finished I was able to begin personalizing my machine. I wanted to put the PC through a bit of stress, so I installed a crypto mining program and let it run for two days. This program ran the PC at it's max the entire time and there was no sign of overheating or slowing at all.Over all I am very impressed with this little machine. This is going to become my main machine in my house since I can hide it anywhere. I highly recommend this little machine.I am a data scientist and will be testing the threading of the 4 cores with some machine learning algorithms and will update my review when I have tested it thouroughly.

reviewDescription: I recently got my hands on the GK3 PLUS mini PC, and I have to say, I'm thoroughly impressed! reviewTitle: Another Little Machine with Alder Lake Goodness
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 11, 2023
reviewDescription: This is the second Intel N95 Mini PC I‚Äôve bought. After using the last one as my mini server, I was tempted to buy one for my girlfriend for her web-browsing, Netflix binging, and light gaming use.The result is more than satisfactory to say the least. The boot time is lighting fast, from power on to Windows desktop takes less than 10 seconds. Although this is a low TDP chip, it packs some punches. For normal light office and web-browsing, is it more than adequate.The power draw, or lack thereof, is truly what makes this shine. It idles at less than 5 watts, and pulls under 15 watts while at full load, while running Windows 11! Everyone knows how Windows 11 is slow and has a ton of bloatware, but this machine can handle it just fine. It is worth to mention that during the first boot into Windows, it will automatically start Windows Update, and the system may feel slow for a period of time. It is normal. When the updates are done, you‚Äôll be delighted at the experience using this little machine.I also tested to run some old emulators on it. Ridge Racer PSP was one of my favorites back in the day, and I can run that game on this machine with 3X resolution. I don‚Äôt remember that game looked this good! Had a blast from the past enjoy playing this game at 60 fps, awesome!

reviewTitle: A great MiniPC/MicroPC running Windows 11 Pro, I'm very happy with the purchase
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 17, 2023
reviewDescription: Having many years of IT experience, I've usually purchase end-user devices with the most resources that I could afford, e.g., laptop with fastest Intel i7 and 32 GB memory.  I needed a smaller device to support work from home with multiple monitors and peripherals.This unit has many USB-A 2 and 3 ports, two HDMI ports, and ever a 15 pin RGB/VGA port, permitting me to attach almost everything I need without a port-replicator.  With dual monitors, printer, and all peripherals on a single power strip, everything is only drawing between 33.5 W and 34.5 W.  12th gen N95 Intel CPU with 16GB memory, makes for a fairly quick machine for work remote access and routine activities.As of 2023-02-17. I've only noticed one anomaly.  When coming out of hibernation, the monitors (1 HDMI, 1 USB) will "reset" about every minute until I reboot.  I don't know if this is a HW or SW issue, although I'm current on all OS and driver patches.As of 2023-02-18, this has become persistent, without using hibernation.  I'll try rebooting multiple times and see if this continues.  Might need to consider a return if vendor can't explain and correct.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 28, 2022
reviewDescription: I was looking for a gaming desktop to replace my gaming laptop for everyday use (got tired of disconnecting/reconnecting the laptop when I traveled).  When I couldn't find a low-profile desktop in my budget and with the desired specs I turned to mini PCs.  The Ace ARM5 ticked off all my boxes:- great chipset with dedicated graphics- tons of expandability- small form factor- good selection of I/O (including Display Port & USB-C)- decent thermals- interesting design (I love it) and RGB lights- GREAT PRICE!!!While my Intel i7 laptop is faster, the difference is barely noticeable in everyday tasks and web browsing.  This is the only mini PC I found with a combination of Display Port + USB-C + USB-A 3 ports.  Expanding the memory from 16 to 32 GB and adding an additional 1T SSD was super easy due to the magnetic side panel (and only brought my total costs to $600 USD).As for gaming...playing E-sport titles (like CSGO, Fortnite, etc.) is great.  I've transitioned to playing AAA titles on my console, so don't need (or want) to play them on this machine.  However, I was surprised how great this little PC handled City Skylines.  I loaded up my largest save (over 500K population) and the ARM5 navigated around and rendered everything without a hitch.  The fan did kick on, but it's so quiet you'll never hear it over your game sounds.In terms of "cons" the power selector is a bit of a gimmick.  You'll probably leave in one mode and forget about it.  Also, I wish the RGB light patterns you set were remembered when you have to shut down/restart (I eventually just left it as the "rainbow" default).  Finally...you'll either love or hate the design.  I think it's pretty interesting, but have seen other reviews that can't stomach it.  The tented form factor helps keep it cool. and the small footprint (about the same space as a Roku or Fire TV remote) is great for anyone with limited desk spaceAll-in-all this is a great machine at an even better price, and I would highly recommend purchasing it!!!

reviewDescription: I bought this PC because I owned a console my whole life and wanted to upgrade. I did not know much about PC's when I first bought this. I play mainly Apex Legends so that was the first game I wanted to try out and once I get it all downloaded when I load the game up I felt very delayed/Framey. I lowered the settings to low-mid and I didn't get more than 70 frames and that wasn't the worst part. I couldn't see past 10-15 meters Infront of my character. the graphics were so bad. My console got a stable 60 so this wasn't even an upgrade at all. the only good part about this is the customer service was great and I'm getting it refunded. reviewDescription: I purchased this computer because I wanted an entry level gaming machine that I can do other computing on. I gave this a 2 star because the components used to build it. This is the first windows 11 system I have owned, but the hard drive isn't partitioned with a separate partition for Windows OS. More concerning is the 1TB hard drive only has 118gb available. This means the system isn't properly configured and the drive wasn't imaged correctly.It's your money and I can't tell you what to do with it. My money will never buy another computer from this company. As I said the components used are fairly good so instead of returning the machine it will go to my local computer shop to be set up correctly.As a last note, if you plant to use this for any hardcore gaming you will need to add your own GPU.

reviewDescription: I've been a Mac user for more than 30 years. I decided to try out my photo software on this pc and used it for my last assignment for a major corporation. I am happy to report it worked out well. Probably not as fast as a new Mac, but not slow either. Faster than my current Mac desktop on photo editing and manipulation. I can't imagine it would be very good for video at all, but IT IS a very basic PC and I am very happy with it. And it is perfect with many open source (READ FREE) programs like Libre Office (Microsoft Office replacement). From what I have read, Blackview is new to the PC business but makes very respectable cell phones. You won't go wrong if you are looking for a cheap, but respectable PC.

reviewTitle: Fast Compact Mini PC, great for minimalist build
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2022
reviewDescription: The Geekom IT8 Mini PC is a nice, compact mini PC with a bit of umph! Great for minimalist desk builds.¬†The packaging was fairly good and was pleasant to open. It has both the front and rear IO pictures on the box, which is a nice touch to see what the PC has. Removing the top half of the box you can see just how small these PCs are. I have never owned a PC of this size. I pulled out my portable bluetooth mouse and placed it on top for reference how small this! In the box you get the mini PC, a VESA mount, mounting screws, power brick, instruction manual, and HDMI cable.¬†I plan on mounting mine to the back of my monitor so I opened up the instructions to take a look. Instructions are very clear. There was a section for how to install the vesa mount plate with detailed pictures. Very professional looking. Install the plate with the provided screws on the monitor. Install two mounting screws on the bottom of the mini PC.¬†The CPU in this is the coffee lake 8259U with 4 cores and 8 threads. You can get 8 or 16 GB SODIMM RAM, which means you can always upgrade later up to maximum of 32GB. You can also pick between a 256 or 512 GB nvme SSD storage. There is also room for a 2.5 inch SSD/HDD which I think I‚Äôll add later.¬†For IO you get a front facing USB type A and type C port and a headphone jack. On the side you have a standard SD card slot. On the back is a 19V barrel jack for power, a mini display port, 1000Mb ethernet, two USB type A and one USB type c that also supports display out, and lastly a HDMI port.It has windows 11 pre-installed. Took about 10 minutes to get fully set up. Everything worked fine, wifi, sound, etc.As far as the fan goes, I haven‚Äôt done heavy workloads. It‚Äôs kicked on a few times and it‚Äôs barely noticeable. It stays on for ~30 seconds and shuts off. My pc is also mounted behind my monitor which might help with the sound.So far it‚Äôs great! Just was I was looking for in a family PC and monitor build. I‚Äôll update this review later after I‚Äôve had some time to play with it and find out if there any problems and my thoughts then.

reviewTitle: Endlich ein leiser Mini-PC mit einer guten Performance f√ºr das Homeoffice
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany on April 3, 2022
reviewDescription: Nachdem ich einige Jahre lang einen gro√üen und lauten Desktop Tower-PC arbeite, war ich auf der Suche nach einem kleinen und leisen Mini PC, bei dem ich keinerlei Abstriche machen muss. Der neue Mini IT8 von GEEKOM ist schon einige Zeit unter anderem in den USA auf dem Markt und wurde dort von den Tech-Experten von ZDNet f√ºr dessen gute Erweiterbarkeit, die vielen Schnittstellen und den leisen L√ºfter hoch gelobt.Da der Mini-PC nun auch in Deutschland erh√§ltlich ist, war f√ºr mich klar, dass ich den kleinen Mini unbedingt ausprobieren muss - ob dieser mein bisheriges PC-System vollst√§ndig ersetzen kann!? Ich m√∂chte Euch gerne meine Einsch√§tzung und Erfahrungen mit dem Mini IT8 weitergeben.--- Leiser L√ºfter trotz angemessener PerformanceMini PC‚Äôs gibt es viele auf dem Markt, von unperformant und g√ºnstig, bis hin zu hochgez√ºchteten und ultra-teuren Power Horse PC‚Äôs, die eigentlich in einem Mini-PC Formfaktor nur selten gut aufgehoben sind. Der Mini IT8 von GEEKOM befindet sich irgendwo in der golden Mitte hiervon. Die Architektur der verbauten Intel Quad-Code CPU i5-8259U der 8. Generation ist zwar nicht mehr taufrisch, liefert aber einen optimalen Kompromiss aus Leistung, Kosten und geringer Abw√§rme: Der verbaute L√ºfter ist unter normalen Arbeitsbedingungen kaum wahrnehmbar und surrt nur leise vor sich hin, was f√ºr mich eines der wichtigsten Kriterien √ºberhaupt darstellt, da der Mini-PC in unmittelbarer N√§hre auf dem Schreibtisch steht.--- SSD- und RAM-Speicher sind flexibel erweiterbarNeben einem leisen L√ºfter werden noch weitere wichtige Anforderungen an einen guten Mini PC erf√ºllt: der Mini IT8 hat eine Menge Schnittstellen und l√§sst sich zudem flexibel erweitern. Die verbaute Kingston SSD (2280 M.2 Formfaktor) kann mit nur wenigen Handgriffen gegen ein SSD-Modell mit maximal 1 TB ausgetauscht werden, falls die verbauten 256 GB irgendwann mal knapp werden sollten. Ein weiterer 2,5-Zoll SATA Anschluss bietet sogar Platz f√ºr eine zus√§tzliche SATA SSD bis maximal 2 TB.Der DDR4 RAM-Speicher, √ºbrigens ebenfalls Markenspeicher von Kingston, ist mit 16 GB bereits √ºppig dimensioniert, selbst unter Windows 11 Pro bietet dieses noch einige Reserven f√ºr die Zukunft. Doch auch der RAM-Speicher lie√üe sich sp√§ter mit einem zus√§tzlichen SO-DIMM-Riegel auf maximal 32 GB erweitern. √ñffnen l√§sst sich das Geh√§use hierzu mit leicht zug√§nglichen 4 Schrauben, was auch technischen Laien gut gelingen d√ºrfte.--- Es gibt viele und vor allem moderne SchnittstellenbuchsenNeben der flexiblen Erweiterbarkeit der internen Komponenten √ºberzeugt der GEEKOM Mini PC aber insbesondere auch durch seine diversen Schnittstellenbuchsen. √úber die drei verbauten USB-Buchsen lassen sich externe Festplatten, Speichersticks oder ein DVD-Brenner anschlie√üen. Diese sind dank der Unterst√ºtzung des aktuellsten USB 3.2 Gen 2 Standards mit maximal 10 Gbit/s auch f√ºr die Zukunft ausreichend schnell. Dar√ºber hinaus gibt es zwei moderne USB-C Buchsen, eine hiervon ist DisplayPort-f√§hig, sodass sich hieran beispielsweise ein aktueller 4K-Monitor betreiben l√§sst.--- Mehrere 4K-Monitore lassen sich anschlie√üenDer Mini PC unterst√ºtzt offiziell bis zu vier 4K UHD-Displays bei einer Bildwiederholrate von 60Hz, was in dieser Anzahl vermutlich niemand aussch√∂pfen d√ºrfte. Ich selber verwende einen 28-Zoll HUAWEI MateView mit 4K-Aufl√∂sung √ºber HDMI am GEEKOM Mini IT8. Dieser wird problemlos erkannt und sch√∂pft die volle UHD-Aufl√∂sung aus. Dank einer beiliegenden VESA Mount-Halterung l√§sst sich der kleine PC auch problemlos hinter einem Display montieren, sodass der Mini-PC keinen weiteren Platz auf dem Schreibtisch ben√∂tigt. Neben HDMI 2.0 gibt es noch einen Mini-DisplayPort und den genannten USB-C Anschluss f√ºr die Verbindung von weiteren Displays.--- √úbliche Schnittstellen entsprechen dem aktuellen StandardEine LAN-Buchse f√ºr die Netzwerkverkabelung ist ebenso vorhanden, wie ein SD-Kartenleser und ein 3,5mm Klinkenanschluss f√ºr Boxen oder Kopfh√∂rer. WLAN wird nach dem WiFi 5 Standard (ehemals als 802.11ac bezeichnet) unterst√ºtzt, was einen Durchsatz von maximal 1,3 GBit/s erlaubt. Das aktuelle WiFi 6 kann der kleine Mini-PC leider nicht, allerdings sind moderne WiFi 6 f√§hige Router noch recht selten und derzeit kaum verbreitet, sodass ich hierin keinen echten Nachteil sehe. Das Bluetooth-Protokoll l√§sst sich ebenfalls verwenden, beispielsweise zur Anbindung von kabellosen Tastaturen, M√§usen oder Lautsprechern.--- Einsch√§tzung der Leistungsf√§higkeit: ein Arbeitstier f√ºr das HomeofficeDie Intel Quad-Core CPU des kleinen GEEKOM Mini IT8 ist mit seinen maximal 8 Threads im Hyper-Threading Modus ordentlich flink unterwegs. Das vorinstallierte Windows 11 Pro reagiert fl√ºssig, auch im Betrieb mit mehreren parallelen Programmen, wie beispielsweise Office-Apps und Google Chrome mit diversen offnen Tabs und gleichzeitigem Abspielen eines YouTube-Videos gibt es keine f√ºhlbaren Einschr√§nkungen. Unter normalen Homeoffice-Bedingungen konnte ich den Mini-PC bislang nicht an seine Grenzen bringen - dieser d√ºrfte, meiner subjektiven Einsch√§tzung nach, f√ºr mich √ºber ausreichend Leistungsreserven f√ºr die kommenden Jahre verf√ºgen.Da die CPU auch den modernen H.265/HEVC Video-Codec in der Hardware decodieren kann, eignet der der Mini-PC zudem hervorragend als Video-Player im Wohnzimmer, beispielsweise f√ºr Netflix oder Amazon Prime Video - der L√ºfter bleibt hierbei angenehm leise. Die verbaute interne Grafikeinheit Intel Iris Plus Graphics 655 leistet zwar problemlos den 4K-Monitorbetrieb, ist den Anforderungen von modernen Grafik-intensiven Spielen aber nicht gewachsen. Hardcode-Gamer werden also nicht gl√ºcklich mit dem Mini-PC und sollten daher auch weiterhin lieber zu einem Tower-PC mit einer dedizierten Grafikkarte greifen. F√ºr ein paar Casual Games zwischendurch reicht die Grafik-Performance des GEEKOM Mini IT8 aber allemal.--- Viel Kunststoff aber dennoch recht hochwertig verarbeitetAbseits der technischen Spezifikationen ist f√ºr mich die allgemeine Verarbeitungsqualit√§t und das Preis-Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis bei der Auswahl des richtigen Mini-PC‚Äôs wichtig gewesen. Das Geh√§use des GEEKOM Mini IT8 ist weitestgehend aus einem schwarzem Kunststoff hergestellt. Lediglich der Unterboden und zwei seitliche K√ºhlgitter sind aus Metall. Hier h√§tte es meiner Meinung nach durchaus etwas ‚Äûmehr‚Äú sein d√ºrfen, beispielsweise ein Aluminium-anstatt des Kunstoff-Deckels.Allerdings ist die Qualit√§t der Verarbeitung und der verwendeten Materialien absolut in Ordnung und der Mini-PC liegt mit einem Gewicht von etwa 570g auch durchaus wertig in der Hand. Es finden sich keinerlei ungew√∂hnliche Spaltma√üe und es knatscht und quietscht auch nichts unter Druck. Der Mini-PC √ºberzeugt mich eher als pragmatisches Arbeitstier und weniger mit einem h√ºbschen Design. Aber auch das ist Geschmacksache und bei der Wahl eines Mini-PC nicht unbedingt entscheidend.--- Was mir gut gef√§llt+ Der geringe Formfaktor mit einer geringen Grundfl√§che von ca. 11,5 x 12,0cm (L√§nge x Breite) und einer H√∂he von lediglich 5,0cm.+ Der integrierte L√ºfter ist angenehm leise und im normalen Homeoffice-Betrieb kaum wahrnehmbar.+ Die gebotene System-Performance ist ein guter Kompromiss aus ausreichender Leistung, zu angemessenen Kosten bei nur geringer Abw√§rme.+ Es handelt sich bei der verbauten SSD und dem RAM-Speicher um hochwertigen Markenspeicher von Kingston.+ Der Mini-PC kann zuk√ºnftig flexibel erweitert werden mit mehr RAM, einer gr√∂√üeren SSD oder einer zus√§tzlichen 2,5-Zoll Festplatte.+ Die verbauten Schnittstellenbuchsen sind vielseitig und entsprechen den aktuellsten technischen Standards.+ Das vorinstallierte Windows 11 Pro ist h√∂herwertiger als die Home Edition, welche die Konkurrenz h√§ufig beilegt.+ Die Verarbeitungsqualit√§t des gesamten Systems ist auf einem angemessenen, hohen Niveau.--- Wo ich noch Potential sehe- Das Geh√§use d√ºrfte gern aus etwas mehr Aluminium bestehen.- Anstatt des verwendeten Rundsteckers vom Netzteil w√§re die Stromversorgung √ºber USB-C w√ºnschenswert gewesen.--- Mein pers√∂nliches FazitDie in Deutschland bislang unbekannte Marke GEEKOM hat mit ihrem Mini IT8 vieles richtig gemacht. Die Arbeit mit dem kleinen PC macht Spa√ü, wenn man bedenkt, was alles in der geringen Grundfl√§che des Handteller-gro√üen Ger√§tes steckt. Der Mini-PC l√∂st meinen bisherigen gro√üen Tower-PC ab und ich habe bislang nichts vermisst. Falls der SSD-Speicherplatz irgendwann nicht mehr ausreichen sollte, dann kann ich diesen mit wenigen Handgriffen selber erweitern oder einfach eine zus√§tzliche 2,5-Zoll SSD einbauen.Der leise L√ºfter war, neben der guten Gesamtperformance und der flexiblen Erweiterbarkeit f√ºr mich das entscheidende Kaufkriterium. Ich kann daher nur jedem empfehlen, dem kleinen Mini PC eine Chance zu geben - f√ºr mich ist es jedenfalls die richtige Entscheidung gewesen.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany on March 30, 2022
reviewDescription: Der kleine, ca. 560g leichte Geekom Mini IT8 PC kommt gut verpackt und recht wertig daher.Auf dem Rechner ist Windows 11 Pro (21H2) vorinstalliert, welches in wenigen Minuten einsatzbereit ist. Weitere Windows-Updates werden nach dem ersten Start im Hintergrund noch heruntergeladen. Alternativ funktioniert auch Linux wunderbar (getestet mit Linux Mint 20.3 Cinnamon).Die Bootzeiten mit Windows aber auch Linux sind fix, in wenigen Sekunden ist der Rechner einsatzbereit.Im Leerlauf verbraucht der PC nur ca. 8-10 Watt (gemessen mit einer smarten WLAN Steckdose), beim Browsen oder bei normalen Officearbeiten ca. 15-30 Watt, unter Volllast (Benchmarks, Enconding o.√Ñ.) auch mal 50 Watt. Alles im Rahmen. Auch die Lautst√§rke empfinde ich als vollkommen OK. Im Leerlauf ist der L√ºfter aus, bei etwas mehr Last h√∂rt man den L√ºfter nur leise.Als CPU kommt der Intel Core i5-8259U mit bis zu 4 x 3,80 GHz zum Einsatz. Die Grafikkarte Iris Plus 655 ist integriert. Der CPU-Typ ist schon ein paar Jahre auf dem Markt, aber f√ºr den Anwendungsbereich v√∂llig ausreichend.Die 16 GB RAM sind f√ºr das normale Arbeiten mehr als genug (verbaut ist ein DIMM, ein weiterer DIMM kann nachger√ºstet werden, sodass insgesamt bis zu 32 GB RAM m√∂glich sind). Auch die verbaute 256 GB M.2 SSD von Kingston ist flott. Die SSD kann sehr einfach gegen eine Gr√∂√üere ersetzt werden, zus√§tzlich l√§sst sich eine 2,5" SSD parallel einbauen.√ñffnen l√§sst sich der PC mit 4 Schrauben - man sollte etwas aufpassen beim Aufmachen, um nicht das SATA-Kabel mit zuviel Schwung abzureissen.Treiber f√ºr Windows 10/11 findet man im Support-Bereich auf der Geekom Webseite - dort gibt es auch Windows zum Download, wenn man den PC in den Werkszustand zur√ºcksetzen muss.Im AMI BIOS k√∂nnen die √ºblichen Einstellungen vorgenommen werden.Zusammengefasst l√§sst sich sagen, dass der kleine "Kraftzwerg‚Äú schnell und leise ist, wenig Strom verbraucht, erweiterbar ist und alle wichtigen Schnittstellen mitbringt. Die Windows Pro Version (statt nur die abgespeckte Home-Edition) rundet das positive Bild ab.Sch√∂n w√§re noch gewesen, wenn der Mini PC Wifi-6 unterst√ºtzen w√ºrde und vielleicht noch einen USB-Anschluss mehr h√§tte. Das Design ist schlicht, aber letztlich Geschmacksache.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany on April 9, 2022
reviewDescription: Ich habe mir diesen Mini-PC bestellt, da ich haupts√§chlich ein MacBook nutze, es aber f√ºr meine Anwendungszwecke ganz praktisch ist noch einen Windows PC zu haben.Ich habe mich f√ºr dieses Modell entschieden, da ich finde, dass es sich mit seinem unauff√§lligen Design perfekt in mein Schreibtisch Setup einf√ºgt.Die Leistung des PCs ist v√∂llig ausreichend f√ºr meinen Anforderungsbereich und er l√§uft dank der eingebauten SSD, den 16 GB RAM und dem Intel Core i5 8. Generation auch sehr schnell. Der PC f√§hrt schnell hoch, Programme starten ohne Wartezeit und auch sonst bekommt man ein sehr fl√ºssiges Erlebnis mit Windows 11.Die Anschl√ºsse finde ich auch sehr super und der PC ist mit den zwei USB-C Ports auch f√ºr die Zukunft gewappnet.Sehr cool finde ich auch, dass man den PC auch theoretisch mit der mitgelieferten Vesa Platte am Monitor befestigen k√∂nnte.Leider kann ich das aktuell nicht machen, da die Vesa Schrauben noch von meiner Monitorhalterung verwendet werden.Insgesamt finde ich bekommt man hier ein sehr solides Produkt mit guter Qualit√§t und Leistung und ich bin sehr zufrieden.

reviewTitle: PN52 Mini PC: Small but Mighty!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 9, 2023
reviewDescription: Introducing the ASUS ExpertCenter PN52, a compact and powerful mini PC that packs a punch! With its AMD Ryzen 7 5800H processor, 16GB of DDR4 RAM, and 512GB PCIe SSD, this mini desktop computer is perfect for those who need a powerful machine but don't have the space for a full-sized tower.One of the things that impressed me most about the PN52 was its powerful performance. Thanks to its AMD Ryzen 7 5800H processor and Radeon graphics, this mini PC boasts 8 cores, 16 threads, and a CPU main frequency of up to 4.4GHz. Plus, it comes pre-installed with Windows 11 Pro, making it a great choice for productivity and creativity tasks.But the PN52 isn't just powerful, it's also versatile. With its expandable memory and storage, you can easily upgrade this mini PC to suit your needs. It also comes with ASUS exclusive DirectCU technology, which helps keep the system cool and running smoothly. And thanks to its comprehensive connectivity options, including multiple USB 3.2 ports, HDMI and DP ports, and a 2.5 Gigabit Ethernet port, you can easily connect all your peripherals and devices.Another thing that sets the PN52 apart from other mini PCs is its enhanced software. The MyASUS app offers two-way AI noise cancellation, system diagnostics, smart fan control, and more, making it easier to keep your system running at its best. Plus, with its dual-channel DDR4 16GB RAM (expandable up to 64GB) and 512GB M.2 2280 PCIe3.0 SSD, this mini PC has enough memory and storage to handle even the most demanding tasks.Of course, like any product, there are pros and cons to the ASUS ExpertCenter PN52. On the plus side, it's a compact and powerful mini PC that's perfect for productivity and creativity tasks. It's also expandable and comes with comprehensive connectivity options. On the downside, it can be a bit pricey compared to other mini PCs on the market.Overall, I would definitely recommend the ASUS ExpertCenter PN52 to anyone looking for a powerful and versatile mini PC. With its impressive specs, enhanced software, and comprehensive connectivity options, it's a great choice for anyone who needs a powerful machine in a compact package. Plus, with ASUS's excellent customer service and three-year warranty, you can rest assured that you're making a solid investment.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 6, 2023
reviewDescription: This is a very good computer. It's very fast and a great upgrade from my old one.  It is supposed to come with built W-fi and a wireless keyboard and mouse. Upon arrival the wireless key board and mouse were both dead. The built in Wi-fi would not connect to my network. I called the tech support number on the computer and Ying Lin spent almost an hour trying to get the Wi-fi it to work. She could not and thought it was a router problem. A tried in vain to trouble shoot the router but it seemed fine.  The Wi-fi works perfectly with an external adapter card. I e-mailed Yin and asked for a new internal adapter and wireless key board mouse. A week or so later she said she could send them. They arrived quickly and I installed the new internal adapter myself. It connected to my network immediately.  The new wireless key board and mouse work but the mouse is of poor quality. It won't work on a mouse pad. It only works on a hard surface and there is quite a delay. I'll use my old wired mouse for now. All in all I am very happy with my purchase and give 5 stars to their tech support. The are friendly and patient even if not always successful on the first try.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 6, 2023
reviewDescription: Love this PC. It's great for a starter gaming PC. My only gripe is that it could really have a better PSU of at least 400 watts or better if there was such a way to put one in. It's not upgradable to Windows 11 but hey we're not complaining. I will be buying a better LP graphics card to get better gaming performance. Wish it could take better ones for even better gaming experience. We really love that it has a DVD/CD burner and a WiFi drive for us to use around the house. Also love the wireless keyboard and mouse. We had issues connecting to our monitor because connection was outdated but we bought a bigger better ASUS monitor to use it and it was one since then. We might by another one or just build one in the future that's upgradable but who knows. Until then me and my wife will be gaming every day on this. Great Gaming PC

reviewTitle: Arrived low battery, maybe bad memory module(s).  Not working, vendor is replacing the computer
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 28, 2022
reviewDescription: I am writing this while the experience is fresh, and will update as I learn more.I received the computer fairly quickly, but they left the computer sitting out near the gate to the apartment complex and did not put it by my door as is the usual.  Not the vendor's or Amazon's problem -  but it is.The box was intact and when I opened it, the packing is some of the best I have seen.Dell makes a good solid computer case and the parts are well made. But this particular computer the motherboard and the case are not aligned, so hard to plug in the DisplayPort cableBut Dell computers (Dell corporation) does not seem to know how to make a stable power supply.  When the battery gets low, many of them refuse to turn on. Like this one, they blink twice, then seven times with yellow LED on the power switch.  Which might mean a bad memory chip. But on the Internet that gets turned into bizarre methods for fixing it.Little things make a big difference.  I am looking for a place to buy old computers at a reliable price and quality and support. This group is going to replace my computer with one that actually works when it arrives.  I checked the CMOS battery they sent and it was 2.54 volts. So they probably did not actually test the computer before the sent it.  Just pushed in new memory and sent it without testing.It is nearly impossible to guess what companies do these days. They do not really collaborate with customers, just sell stuff.  They hardly know my name, let alone what I want to do.  They seem like good people, but so young (to me).  I am cynical, but not pessimistic.  My son taught me that.Thanks for listening.Richard Collins

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2022
reviewDescription: I was quietly fired for 4 months, unable to get leads, pay was shorted and then outright terminated on August 1st by a large insurance brokerage after enjoying a comfy 3 years working at home, I couldn't imagine anything else. Rather than loathing over a perceived loss, I decided to quickly move to a more grateful and deserving employer by investing in myself.  That meant getting my own computer, sending out about 20 resumes and being EXTRA picky about who I was about to gift my labor to... I grabbed this system on the 7th to replace the former setup my former employer provided and it is working great.  I am now employed with a great private firm, 4 days workweek vs the 6 day workweek nightmare most put up with.. and aep is around the corner so... I'm looking forward to reaping the rewards. I couldn't have done it without this package. It helped me gain my ahip, filled in the space where my employers equipment went so that was very satisfying... My former employer used a thinkcentre but, this is MUCH more powerful and its all mine! So no quietspying which was a fear of mine while working for them.  I look forward in this being my very last job working for someone else as the pain and bitterness I experienced as an American employee still was worth it in the end as I have built up a nice nest egg and am just adding to it in preparation to fully expate. I will def be taking this computer with me if it lasts! It has been a great system and to others who are leaving jobs, this is a great business computer, excellent for starting a new business and even starting to work for yourself after a lifetime of serving those who may not appreciate you.

reviewDescription: I used a spare mini-PC in my home entertainment center when we moved in 3 years ago. It is now a 9 year old PC that I shouldn't have done the Windows 10 upgrade on. I decided to look for an affordable, small, quiet mini-PC to replace it and stumbled across the Beelink portfolio. Because I don't use it for gaming, I needed mid-range specs that could handle webinars and other streaming content. It also needed to not have to have a loud fan. The old PC had no fan and while this Beelink does have one, it is variable speed and sometimes doesn't run at all. When it does, it is so quiet you don't know it is running unless you put your ear right next to it. I can't believe that you can get a mini-PC with these components at this price. Why did I wait so long to replace the 9 year old dinosaur?  Thanks Beelink!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 3, 2023
reviewDescription: i've built hundreds of pc's in my day. my house has a home built huge server for security and content, that can be shared throughout the house. this little thing blows away my house NUC. crazy. runs all my security software, was a breeze to set up on the home network.  is 100 times quieter than the monster server. i walk in the room and wonder why the computer isnt on, but it is. my only gripe is i didnt get the ryzen 7 for $50 more. but this ryzen 5 is plenty powerful with the ram and storage right on the mobo. this is nuts.anyone want a used monster server? takes a closet to hold it...  i will get the ryzen 7 for my office.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 14, 2023
reviewDescription: I work at home and previously used my laptop to remote in using Citrix Workspace. I wanted to get away from using my laptop because I had to unplug everything to use it away from my desk. I didn't want to spend too much money because this was just to remote in and I wasn't going to use it for anything else. I did some research on this desktop before buying it and I am very impressed. Some of the tech YouTube guys also said the same thing. Start up was very easy. I like that it has all the ports that I need and it's tucked away. I also thought of mounting it on the back of my monitor, but that would be a hassle to reach over to turn on or unplug something. Overall I love this little guy! It's been only two days, but it's very quiet, so no annoying fan so far (my laptop did that a few times when I would use Zoom/Teams Meeting).

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 1, 2023
reviewDescription: While I have yet to really put it through it's paces, the SER 5 5600H 16gb 500gb model is great. I am absolutely loving it. Really can't beat the price to performance.Now, of course, this is a mobile processor with integrated graphics. You have to set your expectations knowing that it's not going to rival any desktop PC, especially one dedicated to gaming. However, I wanted a mini PC to form the basis of a mobile PC system for myself, capable of stuff like Fusion 360, running 3D printing software and some limited gaming. So far, this PC has completely blown away any expectations I had. I've been able to run Steam no problem, and expect any title except the absolute most demanding will run fine, albeit at medium settings. Handles indie games fantastic. Will probably crush any emulation you throw at it.One thing I love? Zero bloatware. I booted Windows and found absolutely nothing else on this PC. That alone was wonderful. Runs Windows great. Pro tip...I'm using a 720p display, which gives me great frame rates on games. It can almost certainly handle 1080p but you may be more limited on playable titles and settings. Also awesome I can add a SATA drive and upgrade RAM. If this PC had thunderbolt or an extra PCIE4 M.2 slot for using an external graphics card, it would be hands down the best mini PC for the price.Couldn't be happier. You're not going to find a lot better at this price point, unless you build a full PC yourself and hunt for some deals.

reviewTitle: Powerful micro PC for home computing!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 22, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought the SER5. It came completely assembled! Even though the directions still showed how to install the drive and memory, they were already pre-installed! Firing it up was simple and once it had configured itself, I was able to launch some applications and install various pieces of software. The responsiveness of the machine is great! Apps launch almost instantly. The fan only turned on once while the box was configuring itself. Since then, I have not been able to tax it enough to get the fan running again. So operation is absolutely silent!I did NOT experience the "green screen" some users have complained about when watching videos. I DID experience the SLEEP issue - even though I had sleep set to "never", the machine still went to sleep after some period of time. I fixed this by installing Windows PowerToys and using the "Awake" module to set sleep to "Never". Since doing that days ago, the box is still awake and has not gone to sleep.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 27, 2022
reviewDescription: I was originally looking for a laptop that had the power for heavy multitasking and a bit of gaming. I wanted upgradability, quiet, powerful, compact, and simple. I quickly got into the $1500 range and out of my price range. I wanted a computer that I can easily set up on my couch and take down as needed.This computer has exceeded my expectations in every way. It is quiet, very powerful, had a clean install of Windows 11 Pro. From the moment I plugged it in, it has run flawlessly. It was easy to set up, everything worked as it should.Because of the pricing of this PC, I was able to put together a setup that is much more custom, rather than being stuck with what a laptop offers. I bought a nice portable monitor to my liking, I bought a small mechanical keyboard, a very good gaming mouse and saved a lot of money in the process.Being a techie, I looked into all the components they used. It is obvious to me that they put a lot of effort into building a quality computer. And they took time to design a nice well engineered case to hold it all and make it perform and cool. I was worried that they were just trying to build a cheap PC and sell it for cheap and that is not at all the case. I am impressed, which is not easy to do.The only flaw I can find, which I already knew going in, was the lack of video out on the USB-C. It is a limitation of the motherboard and they may just not of had that option.This PC is very fast, games perfect, runs cool. I highly recommend this setup with the 5600H processor. The only software glitch which you will need to address is downloading and installing the latest AMD adrenaline drivers and interface to get the most out of gaming and graphics.Good Job Beelink! Keep up the good work, you deserve it on this one.

reviewDescription: The computer shipped promptly, arrived quickly, and was more than I expected, although it wasn't exactly as described. I was offered a $15.00 refund or an AX200 chip.  I opted for the chip, found out I'd need an adapter, my error, so I didn't bother customer service again, just bought one on my own.  No biggie. reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 20, 2023
reviewDescription: Pros:low low pricedecent CPU performancedecent amount of memory/diskCons:may barely meet specFlexIO adapter variesexpect moderate internal damageFirst, my intent is to use this as a server, not a desktop, and it will run Linux rather than the included Windows OS.  As such, I will be attempting to run this headless, and don't care about graphics quality.  Mine had a serial port instead of a third display port, unlike what other reviewers received, but that's fine with me.There is a M.2 (A+E) slot for a WiFi adapter, but that was empty and the two antenna plugs were just dangling under the SSD.  However, they included a USB WiFi adapter in the package, so I guess that counts as meeting specs.  Also, it frees up that slot for a M.2-to-SATA adapter so I can rig up an external eSATA drive bay.  Yay!  There is also an empty 2280 NVMe slot below the 2.5" SSD.The biggest scare was the unit's condition when I first opened the box.  There was a screw missing from the drive bay, and another (different size) screw loose and rattling inside the chassis when I unboxed it and slid the top off.  I suspect the loose screw was from a M.2 card they removed; they should have just tightened it down so it wouldn't rattle free, as powering it up like that was likely to short something.Also, there was a loose piece of plastic that seems to be part of the fan duct that normally goes between the cooler fins and the rear of the case.  The rest of that duct was simply missing, so I'm worried about over-heating as the warm air recirculates rather than being expelled.  That part doesn't seem to be available new or used anywhere, so I'm hoping I can get by with some Kapton tape or 3D print something that fits.In addition, the back panel was slightly bent and some of the CPU cooler fins were damaged, but nothing that couldn't be straightened or would prevent it from working; it is used, after all.  I think the people doing the refurbishment just don't understand how to use the packaging to secure the unit when it's shipped, as that seems to be a common complaint.So, after a little additional refurbishment, I put it back together, plugged it in, and it did boot up just fine.I don't recommend this for people who aren't comfortable opening up a PC case and replacing internals.  However, for someone looking for a media PC or small x86 server to tinker with, it may just fit the bill.

I clean it and it's fine now.  Accessories are used and the seller doesn't mention it. It is not a high  level of refurbished.

reviewTitle: Potentially good value but be prepared to deal with issues
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 25, 2021
reviewDescription: I bought two of these. I believe the two systems came from different companies, but Amazon's product system is flawed so only one review can be entered and may or may not apply to the actual vendor.Refurbished: one just barely met the criteria stated by Amazon. The other most definitely did not. It had a damaged USB port and was dirty and front cover scuffed, easily visible from across the room, not just arm's length. I was able to carefully repair the USB port, wipe down the box, and don't care about the scuff. Just worth noting. Cleary this company has poor quality control or people that do not under stand the criteria or care. Who knows. I did not want the hassle of returning the item if I could avoid it. Not everyone buying one of these systems will be in that position, however, so these things need to work properly upon delivery.One system arrived with a very low quality mouse and keyboard which was unexpected since this was not listed in the description. The other did not. Neither system arrived with any sort of wifi, as expected based on the description. Both systems had the 16 Gb of RAM, 512 Gb SATA SSB (different brand in each)  and the i5-7500T processor. There's room in each system for an M.2 drive as well as M.2 wifi slot. Each system also had the option slot populated with Displayport so there are three (3) DP ports, no HDMI. Good to know in case you require different cables or adapters for your display device.Internally, watch for the following. I had examples of each:- screws missing from brackets, possibly rolling around inside the chassis which could cause a short, or the wrong size screw for the purpose- incorrect and missing drive caddy retention device- loose and broken plastics brackets for the CPU fan shroud- M.2 screws may or may not be present, so have spares if you need themSeriously, these are NOT refurbished by any reasonable definition. Lower expectations accordingly, be prepared to either fix things yourself or spend time going back and forth with the vendor-of-the-day getting one that actually meets specifications.The other issue is Amazon itself. I purchased a specific model from a specific vendor that was advertised as Prime and had a specific delivery date. A day after the order was placed the delivery changed and it was now going to be 4 days later, and was not listed as Prime. Such tactics I have seen before at Amazon. Feels like bait and switch. Very irritating.In the end, these do serve the intended purpose for me. These will be hit or miss. Casual users may wish to carefully consider if they're in a position to deal with potential issues.I'd (carefully and reluctantly) purchase again when the price is sufficiently low.

reviewTitle: Rocky start with (possibly) a happy ending

reviewDescription: The small computer came wrapped with only thin plastic in a very large box with the mouse, keyboard, and some documentation for company. When I took the computer out of the box the first thing I noticed was that something rattled around inside the metal housing as I moved it. Opening the case I eventually found a tiny screw, like the ones used to secure storage drives in bays. I couldn't tell whether it came out of some part of the machine or it had dropped in at some point in the refurb process. That's lost star number two.  However, once I set it up and started the machine it ran fine.  Maybe I'll get lucky with this system.

reviewTitle: Would not power on with included AC adapter
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 27, 2022
reviewDescription: I wanted to replace an older full-sized desktop system, with a smaller energy-efficient and compact unit for general internet web browsing.  A refurbished low cost micro-sized PC seemed like the perfect solution.First the packaging:It came in a box the length of the keyboard, thick enough to also include in it the mouse, power supply, and micro pc.  It appears to be a box just put together by folding over a large piece of cardboard, and it fell apart as soon as I opened one end to remove the contents.  Strike one, but ok this isn't a real big deal.Ok fine, they cut corners in getting the packaging together to keep costs down.I check the power supply and it is not an HP power supply, but some off-brand third party unit. I figure as long as it works, it shouldn't be an issue.I connect the PC up to a monitor via displayport cable, plug in the AC adapter, plug in the mouse and keyboard, and try powering it on.  Nothing happens.  I recheck all the connections and they seem good.  But still the PC won't power up.  I plug in the AC adapter to a different AC on the power strip and try again... still no go.  Bad PC?  Bad power supply? Incompatible power supply?  Strike two... maybe they will ship me a replacement power supply, and I can use my laptop AC adapter in the mean time.Since I also have an HP laptop, and the plug in the back appears to have the same connector, I try my HP AC Adapter from my laptop to try and power it on.  Voila!  It powers up!  The included power supply appears to be incompatible with this HP micro PC.So I try configuring Windows as it goes through the Windows setup screens.  I'm noticing that the monitor will flicker intermittently, perhaps once  every 5-10 seconds or so.  Maybe this will go away once I complete the Windows setup and update drivers, and perhaps use another DisplayPort, as this unit has 3 DisplayPorts.I completed the setup and updated all drivers and firmware (it was already the latest firmware from HP).  I tried all 3 DIsplayPorts and a different DispayPort cable, but the flickering continued.  This appears to be a sign of issues with the micro PC itself.  Strike three!There are just too many issues with this system.  The refurbisher seems to have no QC in place to check for such issues.This was sent back for a refund.

reviewTitle: HP warranty and support is PISS POOR!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 12, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought this computer in Aug 2022. It's been working fine until recently (Apr 2023 and still under warranty) when I was removing the wireless keyboard/mouse dongle, the dongle fell about. The plastic cap came out, but the shell remained inside the port. I tried removing it with my fingers and then the tiny board came out and the metal case remained inside. I continued pulling on it with my fingers and was finally able to remove it with my fingers (no tools). I contacted HP support to see about getting a replacement since it is still under warranty. The CSR on the chat said that I had to pay for the replacement since it "accidentally" broke while removing it. I asked to chat with the manager and was told the manager would advise the same thing. Piss poor HP. Warrantly claims mean nothing.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 29, 2021
reviewDescription: I purchased 2 of these computers.Pros:‚Ä¢  The computers match the specs given in the listing.‚Ä¢  Shipping was prompt.Cons:‚Ä¢  Both computers were individually bubble wrapped and placed into a large box with no stabilization.  They were left to just bounce around the box.  The power adapters were not wrapped and were loose in the box as well.  Thankfully nothing appeared damaged.‚Ä¢  Both power adapters were missing the the power cable with the 3 prong power cable that attaches to the power adapters.‚Ä¢  After finding power cables that would work, the computers would not power on.  I was able to find alternate power adapters from decommissioned computers that did work.‚Ä¢  Operating system was installed at the absolute bare minimum.  There were almost zero software and hardware drivers installed which made setup take a bit longer.I purchased 2 of these computers form the same seller previously and had a completely different experience. I have also purchased many renewed and refurbed computers over the years, so I know what to expect. The experience with these 2 computers and this current order was absolutely sub par.However, at the end of the day, I was able to get the computers to work and that's what I needed.
