reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 8, 2023
reviewDescription: First of all, I was amazed that this unit worked.. It came wrapped in a plastic bag, in a box that was 2 to 4 times as large as the computer (to allow the the size of the included keyboard and accessories).  The pc, however, booted up and set up as easy as any one I've ever used.  Nice value for the money as far as I'm concerned.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2022
reviewDescription: I was debating between this and the Mac Mini, but let me tell you this is 100% worth it! Not to mention the USB ports, monitor ports, and connectivity options in the front. This mini pc is just awesome, and the best part is you can easily add two extra SSDs for more storage if you have your media and games on separate drives. The i5-11320H and 16GB of DDR4 is plenty for coding and gaming. Windows 11 right out of the box. Fan noise is pretty quiet, it only speeds up when launching a demanding game or software and it quickly dissipates, gets very quiet. For the price, storage upgrades, and ports, this thing blows the Mac Mini out of the water, hands down.Of course this doesn't run your big game titles in highest settings, but most games and older titles in medium to low 720 or 1080 (and some games like crash bandicoot 4 on high settings 1080) run absolutely fine.

reviewTitle: Exactly as ordered; Quiet, respectfully fast.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2022
reviewDescription: I ordered the UM700 with Ryzen 7 3750H, 16g Ram, 512GB SSD.... Win 11 Pro was installed as a Home user.  Went through the Win 11 updates (45 minutes).  Subsequently created a Restore Point and Recovery Disk.Very pleased with the unit.  I cannot hear the fan except for 2 seconds at startup.  It is quiet! The Kingston 512gb SSD read/write speeds are very good for the modest disk (see image).  (A Samsung 970 Pro would be about 50% faster as I experience on my other desktop but I do not require such for this unit.)  I do not plan on gaming so I cannot comment on this.  For Office applications and pretty heavy graphics during mapping and GIS analysis the unit exceeds my expectations.  Great value for the cost.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2021
reviewDescription: This is an amazing little computer. It does exactly what its specs would lead you to believe it would do, in the tiniest space imaginable. I particularly love the pop off cover, which makes internal access amazingly easy‚Äî though I wonder if there is an internal battery that will need replacement sometime in the distant future that will be difficult to replace. OTOH, maybe they‚Äôre doing CMOS battery backup with a supercap or some other method not requiring a battery.Two dings: First, as delivered, you can‚Äôt use a hot key to get into the BIOS. No big deal: the BIOS can be reached via the usual Win 10 restore functions easily, and after the BIOS settings are redone to no longer hide the opening screen, the hotkey (DEL, by default) works just fine.Second, the user manual is the worst I‚Äôve ever seen for any electronic device. Ever. Wholly apart from being in unreadable 1 or 2 point type, it says nothing useful, which is to say, nothing you can‚Äôt learn from just looking at the connections and the icons on the case. Hence, as you get this up and running, you had best be an experienced computer builder with good access to Google, or you‚Äôll have a lot of frustrations. (In fairness, I didn‚Äôt try calling the help line; it might have been great and solved all problems.) But n.b.: if you‚Äôre not a neophyte, this is a dream to set up.I have not yet tested whether the box is Win 11 compatible. From the specs, it should be, and if not, I assume a BIOS upgrade will be forthcoming.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviewDescription: Average computer, it was good for the first month. Then the wifi starting to not working, and the computer getting slow.

reviewTitle: Best value in mini computers right now
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2022
reviewDescription: I bought two of these for my parents, and was amazed by how silent they are, how powerful they are and how small they are. The only thing separating them from perfection is that the back USB-C port is for charging only. If that had been a second thunderbolt port... but I digress.Noteworthy: the fan is topmounted and blows down (which makes sense when you consider that the device may also be mounted vertically behind a TV), and the board itself comes with a built-in array microphone. Other than that, the default configuration is luxuriously well dimensioned for RAM and SSD (this little device would have put my last dev box to shame), and the system comes with a clean install of Windows 11 Pro, devoid of bloatware.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
reviewDescription: This little machine performs as promised. I‚Äôve attached a userbench assessment of its base specs. Very happy with my purchase and I encourage you to buy. Sucks that the RAM is soldered but still more than worth the price tag.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
reviewDescription: Not sure why, but the USB4 port is entirely incapable of transmitting a 4K 120hz signal to my LG OLED. It actually can't even output 1440p at 120hz, so do not buy this if you are intending to use with a 120hz TV.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2022
reviewDescription: This device is quite good with a lot of ports but the USB C on the front is not a Thunderbolt 4. It look like USB4 because it only supports ONE MONITOR.I used a Plugable dock 5in1 100w (with one USB-C host to 3 USB-C output + 15w ready for each port, support dual monitor 4k) but the outcome only got one monitor.To make sure the problem is not from the Dock, i tried with another my laptop (Samsung pro book 360, Raider GE66) and the Dock showed exactly 2 monitor and a third port USB C for data. I am using 15.6 inches full HD monitor powered by one cable USB C (using less than 15w).So the problem must be this device, and... it must be USB4 not thunderbolts 4, or not fully function of thunderbolts 4. Beware before you buy.

reviewTitle: Great for non PC enthusiasts who want to game on a budget
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022
reviewDescription: Excellent little computer. Great for a non PC enthusiast, casual gamer or someone's first PC. It boots up quickly, handles all normal tasks perfectly (web, streaming, multitasking) and can even achieve 1080p/60fps in some 3D games (at lower fidelity settings).The selling points of this device are its small size, low power consumption, out of the box functionality, and gaming capability. I would consider this to be the best gaming mini PC currently available until a mini PC equipped with the 680M becomes available, which will likely cost more than this device.If you purchase this device, be sure to install the latest Iris Xe drivers. The TH50 I receive had the Iris Xe driver from 2021, while there is a new driver available from 2022.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2022
reviewDescription: I bought 2 computers one from MINISFORUM and one from Beelink.The Minisforum arrived 1st, so I naturally opened and tried to use that one first.  After I spent 2 days trying to move my settings and software onto the Minisforum, which was not easy, it had something wrong with the WIFI where it would only connect to my 2.5g wifi and would absolutely not connect with my 5g, would not run the speed I would have liked. Anyway, I really can not rate this computer because it totally DIED on day three in the middle of a video/chat with a customer.  I tried everything to get it up and running again and it would not power on.  Tried to contact customer support, good luck with that it's in China. I tried to call the selling merchant, but no luck there either. they did not respond to my emails or phone calls. Sent it back to Amazon/seller two weeks ago.  I'm still waiting for my refund.  I am now going to start a complaint with Amazon.  We'll have to see how far that gets me.So altogether I'd have to grade my whole experience as a BIG FAT F.  Kinda a shame. The sellers beefed it up as such a great mini computer.  By the way, it's really a COOFUN made in China, with as my research has found out, with very cheap and inferior parts.  Buy one, and you'll see.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
reviewDescription: The reason I say it‚Äôs ok is because it runs most games very well Fortnite gets a easy 300fps but if your looking for great performance keep looking, there‚Äôs been instances i would get kicked out of games and random apps open, the packaging of the pc was good but the pc itself could do with more storage and a better graphics card, also the water following kinda sucks because my pc overheats even when I put a fan next to it to cool it off

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
reviewDescription: this is my first PC and id like to say that this is a very good starter. Pretty fast in opening things, gaming wise is decent. mine came with 16 gigs of ram and also came with 1 TB of SSD. Honestly, this pc isn't bad for a starter.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2022
reviewDescription: I will begin this review by stating that I purchased and returned two other computers from other companies before this one. The first was DOA (bad GPU) and the second, while it worked well enough, had poor cooling out of the gate, limited expandability after looking closer at the case and motherboard, and a ton of bloatware on it. Frustrated, I waited a couple weeks and then resumed my computer search. That's when I found the Hellfire II and, after looking over its parts and the existing reviews, decided to give it a try. Obviously, I tried to keep my expectations low, but I figured the components of the Hellfire II themselves I could not source for less money (not without sniping for deals over time) so I thought it was worth a try.I've only had it a week and a half, but it has performed wonderfully in that time. My primary use for it is streaming video, some minor productivity (word processing and web-browsing,) and gaming. I am not a hardcore gamer by any means, but the RTX3060Ti plays the couple games I enjoy most (Killing Floor 2, Hunt: Showdown, Cyberpunk 2077 for example) at highest settings with high and stable frames on a 4K monitor. The particular one I got (if anyone is interested) is an MSI RTX3060Ti. All in all it pretty much crushed my expectations in a positive way.Other comments: I am very happy with the cooling situation, which as I mentioned previously was a concern of mine with these little cases with hardly fans in them. The AMD processor keeps up with everything I do easily; I haven't even come close to taxing it, and it also stays very, very cool with the water-cooling system (which itself rates very well if you look it up.) 16GB of RAM is plenty for me as well. It's cheap enough to upgrade to 32, but as with the processor comments I haven't even come close to needing all 16GB. Haven't even used the 1TB HDD it came with yet and have no plans to, but it's a nice-to-have if I ever do. The PSU I got was 650W, which, between itself and the Cooler Master chassis, allows for a moderate amount of expandability options - I expect to get a lot of life out of this going forward.I am very pleased with this purchase and I would recommend it to anyone trying to get a budget gaming build (or do anything graphical processing oriented) with some modest to good parts and options to grow in the future.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviewDescription: this pc is the best. it is better than the rest of my pcs. handled every game that i own on highest quality

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2022
reviewDescription: I am new to PC gaming and this is my first PC. I'm somewhat PC illiterate and haven't owned one in over 12 years...even then, I had an Acer Laptop! I definitely got the nice plug and play experience and everything started up very smoothly and nicely :) I have no complaints about the setup process and Windows 10 is glorious. There are a couple things to note, though, if you are starting out.1. My RGB fans didn't work right away. When I turned on the tower, I expected it to light up. I didn't mind opening up the side panel to look around at the motherboard - but the motherboard doesn't have an RGB connector at all. A cord on the opposite side panel wasn't fully locked into place when it arrived. Not a huge deal for me though, but it would've been nice to see it light up the first time. I emailed support about this and they got back to me right away :)2. I 'saved' some money by getting this build, however, I soon realized I would need storage as it filled up quickly. Just keep in mind if you get the 500gb SSD you'll be needing some extra storage. I went with an internal HD Toshiba X300 (4TB).I've had this PC for a week and I don't have any complaints at all. It's beautifully built, works just fine (comes with all the extra cords needed to add more storage), I don't play a lot of FPS games - mostly MMORPGs, RPGs, and The Sims, so I wouldn't say I'm someone who needs the best of the best, but this does a pretty damn good job of making the experience worthwhile. My next upgrade is for the ram/memory but I can wait on it a bit :) also... don't forget to hook up your HDMI to the better graphics card! I put my HDMI into my integrated graphics card by accident, hahaha. Wasn't bad, but wasn't amazing.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviewDescription: Guys are super nice. Product arrived undamaged and came with a free keyboard. Simple and easy instructions to set it up and came at a very reasonable price tag. So much better than building a computer yourself.

Definitely beautiful and I have been having such a good time with it ü•∞

reviewTitle: Very low tier build, but okay for the price.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
reviewDescription: With gaming computers, you get what you pay for. If you buy the cheapest version of this PC, don't expect 60+fps unless you're running at 720p. As soon as you increase to 1080p, you're going to be at about 20-25 fps max in most games out there. It's a fairly weak PC for gaming, but can be upgraded. They don't all come with the same parts either. Some will have nicer RAM sticks and RGB fans while others will come with super cheap sticks of RAM and black fans that don't work with RGB. It's a toss up as to what you'll actually get. So there's that. Some are slightly nicer than others, yet the price is the same. I've seen some come with more expensive video cards and some with generic video cards. If you like RPGs like me, that 500GB SSD is going to fill up VERY fast, so you might want to upgrade that as well. I have single games that are 64GB in size. The mouse is nice as is the rainbow keyboard that they come with. The mouse is corded, not cordless, so that's a plus if you hate paying for batteries. I play games like Dragon Quest XI S: Definitive Edition, Trials of Mana, Tales of Zestiria, Tales of Berseria, etc and depending on which game I'm playing, I'll have to reduce the resolution to 720 in order to get smooth fps. Some will run smoothly in 1080, but that's rare. This is not a powerhouse PC. The cheapest one is very entry level and won't blow anyone away. If you just need something better than grandma's Dell desktop from 2011, this will be a major upgrade over that.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
reviewDescription: Just as expected and more. We looked at so many others and for the price, it was so well worth it. You can definitely trust you would not be disappointed üòâ.

reviewTitle: Disappointed with the lack of info.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
reviewDescription: The computer is as expected as far as the specs, so no issue so far.  But I was surprised that it didn't have an hdmi port which in this age should be a default.  They should have noted that in the description as a courtesy as I would not have bought this computer if the info was there.  Or there should have been an option to upgrade and add in the hdmi port.  But I see why there is no upgrade option as this is how amazon bought the unit and can't make any changes after it was delivered to their warehouse.  It's not a setup where Amazon send the request for this unit and Dell sends it to Amazon after the purchase.  This would be a better method for customers but may not be the best format for Amazon.  I will not be buying computers from Amazon because of this, i.e., the lacking of an upgrade capability to add in a basic thing like an hdmi.  My first and most likely last time buying a computer from Amazon unless they change this policy.

reviewTitle: Fast processor, basic memory and storage. Accessories are cheap.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 26, 2022
reviewDescription: HP Pavilion Desktop Computer PC, AMD Ryzen 7 Processor, AMD Radeon Graphics, 16 GB RAM, 512 GB PCIe SSD,  is perfect for me to work with files, watch movies, listen to music, etc.In the case of multitasking, there is no problem of task stuttering. Wi-Fi and bluetooth are included, so this computer satisfies all my needs.I play games occasionally so I tested CSGO at 1080P, medium settings, with an average frame rate of around 145FPS; Overwatch the configuration requirements are slightly higher, but there is also an average frame rate of 70FPS, even during team battles, the frame rate can remain stable; as for the average frame rate of LOL, it is even higher, reaching more than 200FPS. Of course, for some large-scale single-player games, it can only be played barely.Computer upgradeThe computer has reserved two hard disk interfaces and shelves, which is very convenient if you want to add a hard disk. Memory is DDR4-3200 MHz RAM (2 x 8 GB). This memory is completely sufficient for use.The motherboard has reserved two interfaces to upgrade the discrete graphics card. But the computer's own power supply is only 180w. If you need to install a discrete graphics card, you need to replace it with the power supply. (remember ryzen 7 5700g is equivalent to GTX750)Pros:If you're not a heavy gamer, you won't need to make any changes to this computer. It can accompany you for a long time.To add a hard disk in the future, you only need to plug in the interface and fix it. All the cables have been fixed, which is very convenient.Cons:Although HP is a good brand, there is no price advantage.The included keyboard and mouse seem so cheap. The power supply is too small for friends who need to upgrade the graphics card in the future, only 180w.

reviewTitle: A Fast and Efficient PC, With A Few Flaws
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 28, 2022
reviewDescription: I haven't owned a desktop PC in a long time but I saw HP's sleek Pavilion Desktop - AMD Ryzen 7 Processor - 16GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Natural Silver and was very curious! Wow, they don't make them like they use to anymore with a slew of countless features, highlights, and tech in place.. but here's the spec's to know:- This desktop is considerably more compact and lightweight vs the PC's of the past, making it possible to be set on the shelves right beneath my desk and if I want to relocate it at any time, it's easily maneuverable.- With plenty of media slots for all your devices to plug into, the possibilities for multimedia projects are endless. The biggest flaw in this area is the ONE HDMI slot, especially when 2 monitors is the new norm.- Onboard graphics are fine for my level of use with 4k videos playing well enough, but avid gamers may want to upgrade the low-grade video card and power supply to achieve the full potential of this PC.- The level of quietness this machine exudes on a regular basis is incredible, even when performing high CPU tasks! Unfortunately, the lack of a CD-DVD DRIVE is another flaw that left me disappointed and robbed.Although, there aren't the traditional mainstays built into this PC that the general population have grown accustomed to.. the pro's incinerate the con's with a device whose high-speed performance and up-to-date technology blows competitors out of the water! If you're looking for a PC that's reliable, quick, and easy-to-operate, then I highly recommend this great piece of machinery.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 27, 2022
reviewDescription: It's been some time since I had a tower that got shot by lightning.  Not wanting to build I have been looking but never talked myself into another.  I was getting closer and then I saw this.  I love the simplicity of the front, its just a beautiful clean design that makes on look twice.  The start button and and ports line vertically down the right side are neat and in easy reach, ready to work.  Being a photographer, top of the list was the graphic processor so after researching before taking this offer this  AMD Ryzen 7 5700G Processor was rated as the the best integrated processor, that all I needed to kick me into taking this.Last year I made up a short video slideshow to make a somewhat non scientific benchmark to test the time each of my devices to render it in my video editor.  Its just a simple mix of twenty five images with music.  My former, still good, PC did it in 55 seconds,  my mid range gaming laptop I got back in 2019 did it in on minute 2 seconds.  Now for this processor it rendered in just twenty five (25) seconds (tenth of seconds rounded), that sold it for me.  On the other specs I was going to give it four stars but bumped that up simply for that reason, its the best I have ever had.Now for the rest I do wish it had another M2 slot for another drive, 512 is not enough. I have a 1Tb 2.5 inch SSD of images over half full.  I saw inside there are sata connections to will instal that drive so I'm going to instal that soon.  I do wish it had dual HDMI ports on the back as I do like to work with two screens when editing, I'm working of finding a way do do that which would pretty fill my bucket list for a computer.In the end this is a great, better than expected, desktop tower that for the most part be would all that one would need.UPDATE  I have installed my 1Tb SSD and works perfectly.  I do most of my work on two screens but had a hard time finding a way to extend the screens as this model does not have the capability.  After four cables and three devices all but one sent back I found a way and works great.  I love this computer is plenty fast for my use. Below is an Amazon link to the device I used to extend the screen.https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0943VNT67?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details

reviewTitle: Excellent Desktop PC for family and gaming
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 17, 2022
reviewDescription: This HP Pavilion Desktop Computer was a wonderful choice for our usage. We needed a desktop computer that would be easily used by both family, kids and adults, for things like email, bill pay, etc, as well as for gaming. This one has just the right amount of bells and whistles for what we plan to use it for. I prefer having a desktop computer for family usage as we put it in a central location in our home to allow us to monitor the activity on the PC. It also keeps my husband from being able to pick up the computer by the screen, like he did with the laptop computer we had before this one, and killing it.My 12 year old is on the newer side of PC gaming. We needed a computer that he could use on his own with things from setting the PC up to downloading and playing his games with other friends also on their PC‚Äôs at home. When we were taking this out of the box, I stepped away for a minute to grab something in another room. When I returned 60 seconds later to get to work setting it up, he had already finished setting this up 100% all by himself. We like that there are some options for add ons. Given our plans for using this Desktop PC, the possible options work out well for us.I would definitely recommend this HP Pavilion Desktop Computer. I think it‚Äôs a great versatile option for families.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 26, 2022
reviewDescription: This is a solid desktop. It has a high-performing integrated GPU along with an 8-core AMD CPU.  It benchmarks well for its size and prize.  It supports up to 16 GB of ram via 2 slots, has one NVme slot that will support a drive, and can handle 2 additional standard drives.  It has 2 expansion slots.  My only issue with the box is that it comes with a 180-watt proprietary form factor PSU.  This means your expansion options like a new graphics card will be limited by power consumption regardless of open slots.  Still, if you want a box that you can game or photo edit on, as well as normal PC apps, and you don't plan to mess with expanding or modifying it, this is a solid little system.

reviewDescription: Take the 3200 MHZ ram, overclock it or just upgrade it to 3600 mhz 32GBslap a 3060 TI in thereyou have a 1440p system for under 1450. reviewTitle: Great little PC that needs to be upgraded!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 16, 2020
reviewDescription: First, try to run all of the firmware and driver updates you can.  Out of the box this had near 0 wifi signal when in the same room as my 802.11AX router.  Did a driver update on the card (had to manually get it from another computer and place it on USB due to poor connection) and bam, full bars.Next had to do a driver update on the bluetooth as well, wouldn't stay connected to the bluetooth amp (using a Fosi Amp to power two Polk t15s in the kitchen cabinets)BUY RAM!  4 gig is a HUGE bottle neck.  I grabbed 16 gig (over kill, 8 is enough for our purpose) of Gskill DDR4.  The computer than ran faster than some laptops with much faster processors.Lastly, make sure you buy some 1 ft USB and HDMI cables if you plan on doing a VESA mounted touchscreen build.Boot is fast, coming with Win 10 Pro is why I bought this one.  The 240G SSD is decently quick.as stated 4 gig of ram is woefully inadequate for any use past booting it up and shutting it down.  It would choke opening a single window of Firefox or chrome.  With 16 gig it runs multiple windows and tabs with Amazon Prime music running in the background no problem.My use was a kitchen PC.  I run only Prime music, firefox for recipe's and basic research and the Lorex camera app.We are using a planer touch screen and Windows is set to tablet mode.  No keyboard or mouse at all.  works like a big tablet, but FAR faster and cheaper, (if you can find a 23 inch tablet)I am planning on getting another mini PC now to replace my work computer, but I would never recommend gaming on something this small.  I can imagine it over heating under those loads.  Maybe Angry Birds would be ok!  Not serious hard core games though.  Division 2 chokes my i5 desktop with a 2060, can't imagine it even running on the Minix with its Pentium silver and integrated graphics.WARNING: When disassembling for upgrade, be very careful of the wifi antenna (cables).  They are very think and taped to the case.  do not just lift the motherboard out!!! Also be careful of them on reassembly, they want to fall into the way of the screw hole below the SSD to the left of the RAM slots.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 28, 2021
reviewDescription: ***Update***After leaving a one-star review, Minix contacted me to start warranty support. This support was a little slow as they are not US based and would respond to my emails outside business hours here in the states. So, one email a day took a while for them to come to the same conclusion I had before contacting them. The SSD had failed and needed replaced. After a few weeks of the back and forth a new drive was shipped to me and then I had to load the OS to the device to get it going again. Not a problem for me as a full time IT professional. May be a problem for you if you aren't one. The device is working again and seems to be performing as it originally did.Make sure that you do not use the US support contact information provided on Minix's web site if you have trouble. Use their Hong Kong support as the US support does not exist and your emails will go unanswered.***Original Review***We purchased 27 of these for a business use. Most have been working just fine. We have had an SSD fail in one of these devices, so far, during the 1 year warranty period. We have emailed the support address the manufacturer provides on their website. We have received no response in over two weeks to multiple emails.Because of this, I cannot recommend purchasing these if you think you might need to rely on the warranty. If you only need these to work during the Amazon return period, then it may be worth the risk for you.Also, keep in mind that these units with the extra RAM you will have to physically open the device and install the RAM yourself. Not a problem for me, but it may be for you. It did cost several hours of labor to open and install all the RAM in 27 devices.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 22, 2020
reviewDescription: We bought a couple of these for the office. I took the 4gb of RAM from one and added it to the other, and then replaced the missing RAM in the first unit with an 8gb chip. I was worried about being able to run the Windows and Office software and also stream video with just 4gb. So this was preventative. We got the version of the minix with built-in 240GB ssd. The thing is cute, takes about 30sec to open (4 screws after you peel off the little rubber feet) and snaps in place in the included plastic VESA  holder that screws to the back of the Benq screen we bought. Something to keep in mind: this is compatible for a 60hz screen, which is fine for us. Also, if you want to clamp it to a monitor, and simultaneously use the monitor‚Äôs stand, make sure the monitor‚Äôs stand bracket doesn‚Äôt use or get in the way of the vesa mount!This thing fires up right away and works just as you‚Äôd expect right out of the box. It even came with an hdmi cable so they didn‚Äôt cheap out. We needed to buy a compact USB extension cable (with multiple ports) because it only comes with 3, but the unit is tiny and lightweight and so far is working really well for us at a great price. If things progress this way over a year or so, we will plunge in and get a bunch more for our office. We don‚Äôt put an insane load on our computers, but when I have gone cheap with an HP with a lame processor and 4gb of RAM, it was unbearably slow. The minix seems much better especially with the SSD. In the future, if I can‚Äôt get one with the SSD built in, I have now seen what the inside of this thing looks like and adding an off-the-shelf SSD would be a snap and I wouldn‚Äôt think twice about it.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 14, 2020
reviewDescription: Our company needs some Windows 10 PC's to access a web based software package. That's all these PC's will do. They will access these web pages, open attached PDF's or short instructional videos, and allow the user to input data back into the software. These will not be running Excel, processing large video files, running multiple programs at once, gaming, or doing any 3D design work.For our purposes, when paired with a touch screen monitor, these appear to be a really good solution. We're working on placing them into Windows 10's Kiosk mode to lock them into the application we want. We did upgrade the RAM as 4 GB shared with OS and GPU (in the CPU) did not leave all that much for running multiple browser windows. We felt that 8 GB would give us some cushion in that area. The devices seem responsive and easy to set up/configure as they run a full version of Win 10 Pro.One downside I am seeing is that build quality may be suspect. After adding RAM, I had next to zero wireless reception. I re-opened the case to see if something had come loose. Visually, it did not appear so and swapping RAM sticks does not impact the wireless card. However, after removing the M.2 SSD, I noted that the main antenna connection (grey wire in my case) was not fully seated. This was also under what looked like hot glue. I removed the glue and antenna connectors and tried to re-seat them. The secondary (black) cable seated with no issues, but the grey one kept popping off. I inspected it and found the connector had been all mangled and required quite a bit of re-work to get it connected. If you have WiFi reception issues, you may want to check these connections.That and conflicting information as to the actual warranty of these devices is the reason for my 3 out of 5 stars. I'll update my review once we've had these in operation for any length of time and also report any other issues that come up.

reviewDescription: Purchased to replace a NEO Z83-4 Plus since I've upgraded to a 4K display. So yes, I'm sure you can technically connect three monitors at 4K60. But it can't realistically drive even one of them.

reviewTitle: Do not buy if you don't know how to change the CPU cooler
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 6, 2023
reviewDescription: Many people complained about the noisy back fan. It is caused by the primitive cpu cooler. Since this trash cpu cooler is useless, cpu temp can reach more than 80 degree and cause the back fan to work at full speed (back fan speed is based on cpu temp).  So first, change the back fan speed strategy, do not follow the cpu temp. Second, get a new cpu cooler to keep cpu from overheating. Since the CPU slot is LGA 1200, you have to take apart the entire motherboard and put something in the back of the motherboard to install a new cpu cooler. This is very exhausting.
